function.name: gst_adapter_available
function.description: Gets the maximum amount of bytes available, that is it returns the maximum value that can be supplied to gst_adapter_peek() without that function returning NULL.
function.return: number of bytes available in @adapter

function.name: gst_adapter_available_fast
function.description: Gets the maximum number of bytes that are immediately available without requiring any expensive operations (like copying the data into a temporary buffer).
function.return: number of bytes that are available in @adapter without expensive operations

function.name: gst_adapter_clear
function.description: Removes all buffers from @adapter.

function.name: gst_adapter_copy
function.description:
Copies @size bytes of data starting at @offset out of the buffers contained in @GstAdapter into an array @dest provided by the caller.
The array @dest should be large enough to contain @size bytes. The user should check that the adapter has (@offset + @size) bytes available before calling this function.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the bytes offset in the adapter to start from

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to copy

function.name: gst_adapter_flush
function.description:
Flushes the first @flush bytes in the @adapter. The caller must ensure that at least this many bytes are available.
See also: gst_adapter_peek().

parameter.name: flush
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to flush

function.name: gst_adapter_masked_scan_uint32
function.description:
Scan for pattern @pattern with applied mask @mask in the adapter data, starting from offset @offset.
The bytes in @pattern and @mask are interpreted left-to-right, regardless of endianness. All four bytes of the pattern must be present in the adapter for it to match, even if the first or last bytes are masked out.
It is an error to call this function without making sure that there is enough data (offset+size bytes) in the adapter.
This function calls gst_adapter_masked_scan_uint32_peek() passing NULL for value.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask to apply to data before matching against @pattern

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.parameter_description: pattern to match (after mask is applied)

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset into the adapter data from which to start scanning, returns the last scanned position.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes to scan from offset

function.name: gst_adapter_masked_scan_uint32_peek
function.description:
Scan for pattern @pattern with applied mask @mask in the adapter data, starting from offset @offset. If a match is found, the value that matched is returned through @value, otherwise @value is left untouched.
The bytes in @pattern and @mask are interpreted left-to-right, regardless of endianness. All four bytes of the pattern must be present in the adapter for it to match, even if the first or last bytes are masked out.
It is an error to call this function without making sure that there is enough data (offset+size bytes) in the adapter.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask to apply to data before matching against @pattern

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.parameter_description: pattern to match (after mask is applied)

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset into the adapter data from which to start scanning, returns the last scanned position.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes to scan from offset

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to uint32 to return matching data

function.return: offset of the first match, or -1 if no match was found.

function.name: gst_adapter_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstAdapter. Free with g_object_unref().
function.return: a new #GstAdapter

function.name: gst_adapter_peek
function.description:
Gets the first @size bytes stored in the @adapter. The returned pointer is valid until the next function is called on the adapter.
Note that setting the returned pointer as the data of a #GstBuffer is incorrect for general-purpose plugins. The reason is that if a downstream element stores the buffer so that it has access to it outside of the bounds of its chain function, the buffer will have an invalid data pointer after your element flushes the bytes. In that case you should use gst_adapter_take(), which returns a freshly-allocated buffer that you can set as #GstBuffer malloc_data or the potentially more performant gst_adapter_take_buffer().

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to peek

function.return: a pointer to the first @size bytes of data, or NULL

function.name: gst_adapter_prev_timestamp
function.description:
Get the timestamp that was before the current byte in the adapter. When @distance is given, the amount of bytes between the timestamp and the current position is returned.
The timestamp is reset to GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and the distance is set to 0 when the adapter is first created or when it is cleared. This also means that before the first byte with a timestamp is removed from the adapter, the timestamp and distance returned are GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and 0 respectively.

parameter.name: distance
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to location for distance, or NULL

function.return: The previously seen timestamp.

function.name: gst_adapter_push
function.description: Adds the data from @buf to the data stored inside @adapter and takes ownership of the buffer.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstBuffer to add to queue in the adapter

function.name: gst_adapter_take
function.description:
Returns a freshly allocated buffer containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter.
Caller owns returned value. g_free after usage.
Free-function: g_free

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.return: oven-fresh hot data, or #NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_take_buffer
function.description:
Returns a #GstBuffer containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter. This function is potentially more performant than gst_adapter_take() since it can reuse the memory in pushed buffers by subbuffering or merging.
Caller owns returned value. gst_buffer_unref() after usage.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.return: a #GstBuffer containing the first @nbytes of the adapter, or #NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_adapter_take_list
function.description:
Returns a #GList of buffers containing the first @nbytes bytes of the @adapter. The returned bytes will be flushed from the adapter. When the caller can deal with individual buffers, this function is more performant because no memory should be copied.
Caller owns returned list and contained buffers. gst_buffer_unref() each buffer in the list before freeing the list after usage.

parameter.name: nbytes
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bytes to take

function.return: a #GList of buffers containing the first @nbytes of the adapter, or #NULL if @nbytes bytes are not available

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_available
function.description: Check if alloc tracing was compiled into the core
function.return: TRUE if the core was compiled with alloc tracing enabled.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_get
function.description: Get the named alloc trace object.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the alloc trace object

function.return: a GstAllocTrace with the given name or NULL when no alloc tracer was registered with that name.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_list
function.description: Get a list of all registered alloc trace objects.
function.return: a GList of GstAllocTrace objects.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_live_all
function.description: Get the total number of live registered alloc trace objects.
function.return: the total number of live registered alloc trace objects.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_print
function.description: Print the status of the given GstAllocTrace.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_print_all
function.description: Print the status of all registered alloc trace objects.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_print_live
function.description: Print the status of all registered alloc trace objects, ignoring those without live objects.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_set_flags
function.description: Enable the given features on the given GstAllocTrace object.

function.name: gst_alloc_trace_set_flags_all
function.description: Enable the specified options on all registered alloc trace objects.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_caps
function.description: Get the configured caps on @appsink.
function.return: the #GstCaps accepted by the sink. gst_caps_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_drop
function.description: Check if @appsink will drop old buffers when the maximum amount of queued buffers is reached.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsink is dropping old buffers when the queue is filled.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_emit_signals
function.description: Check if appsink will emit the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsink is emiting the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals.

function.name: gst_app_sink_get_max_buffers
function.description: Get the maximum amount of buffers that can be queued in @appsink.
function.return: The maximum amount of buffers that can be queued.

function.name: gst_app_sink_is_eos
function.description:
Check if @appsink is EOS, which is when no more buffers can be pulled because an EOS event was received.
This function also returns %TRUE when the appsink is not in the PAUSED or PLAYING state.
function.return: %TRUE if no more buffers can be pulled and the appsink is EOS.

function.name: gst_app_sink_pull_buffer
function.description:
This function blocks until a buffer or EOS becomes available or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.
This function will only return buffers when the appsink is in the PLAYING state. All rendered buffers will be put in a queue so that the application can pull buffers at its own rate. Note that when the application does not pull buffers fast enough, the queued buffers could consume a lot of memory, especially when dealing with raw video frames.
If an EOS event was received before any buffers, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.
function.return: a #GstBuffer or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS.

function.name: gst_app_sink_pull_buffer_list
function.description:
This function blocks until a buffer list or EOS becomes available or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.
This function will only return buffer lists when the appsink is in the PLAYING state. All rendered buffer lists will be put in a queue so that the application can pull buffer lists at its own rate. Note that when the application does not pull buffer lists fast enough, the queued buffer lists could consume a lot of memory, especially when dealing with raw video frames.
If an EOS event was received before any buffer lists, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.
function.return: a #GstBufferList or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS.

function.name: gst_app_sink_pull_preroll
function.description:
Get the last preroll buffer in @appsink. This was the buffer that caused the appsink to preroll in the PAUSED state. This buffer can be pulled many times and remains available to the application even after EOS.
This function is typically used when dealing with a pipeline in the PAUSED state. Calling this function after doing a seek will give the buffer right after the seek position.
Note that the preroll buffer will also be returned as the first buffer when calling gst_app_sink_pull_buffer().
If an EOS event was received before any buffers, this function returns %NULL. Use gst_app_sink_is_eos () to check for the EOS condition.
This function blocks until a preroll buffer or EOS is received or the appsink element is set to the READY/NULL state.
function.return: a #GstBuffer or NULL when the appsink is stopped or EOS.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_callbacks
function.description:
Set callbacks which will be executed for each new preroll, new buffer and eos. This is an alternative to using the signals, it has lower overhead and is thus less expensive, but also less flexible.
If callbacks are installed, no signals will be emited for performance reasons.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: a user_data argument for the callbacks

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_caps
function.description: Set the capabilities on the appsink element. This function takes a copy of the caps structure. After calling this method, the sink will only accept caps that match @caps. If @caps is non-fixed, you must check the caps on the buffers to get the actual used caps.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_drop
function.description: Instruct @appsink to drop old buffers when the maximum amount of queued buffers is reached.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_emit_signals
function.description: Make appsink emit the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals. This option is by default disabled because signal emission is expensive and unneeded when the application prefers to operate in pull mode.

function.name: gst_app_sink_set_max_buffers
function.description: Set the maximum amount of buffers that can be queued in @appsink. After this amount of buffers are queued in appsink, any more buffers will block upstream elements until a buffer is pulled from @appsink.

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of buffers to queue

function.name: gst_app_src_end_of_stream
function.description: Indicates to the appsrc element that the last buffer queued in the element is the last buffer of the stream.
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK when the EOS was successfuly queued. #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE when @appsrc is not PAUSED or PLAYING.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_caps
function.description: Get the configured caps on @appsrc.
function.return: the #GstCaps produced by the source. gst_caps_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_emit_signals
function.description: Check if appsrc will emit the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals.
function.return: %TRUE if @appsrc is emiting the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_latency
function.description: Retrieve the min and max latencies in @min and @max respectively.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_max_bytes
function.description: Get the maximum amount of bytes that can be queued in @appsrc.
function.return: The maximum amount of bytes that can be queued.

function.name: gst_app_src_get_size
function.description: Get the size of the stream in bytes. A value of -1 means that the size is not known.
function.return: the size of the stream previously set with gst_app_src_set_size();

function.name: gst_app_src_get_stream_type
function.description: Get the stream type. Control the stream type of @appsrc with gst_app_src_set_stream_type().
function.return: the stream type.

function.name: gst_app_src_push_buffer
function.description:
Adds a buffer to the queue of buffers that the appsrc element will push to its source pad. This function takes ownership of the buffer.
When the block property is TRUE, this function can block until free space becomes available in the queue.
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK when the buffer was successfuly queued. #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE when @appsrc is not PAUSED or PLAYING. #GST_FLOW_UNEXPECTED when EOS occured.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_callbacks
function.description:
Set callbacks which will be executed when data is needed, enough data has been collected or when a seek should be performed. This is an alternative to using the signals, it has lower overhead and is thus less expensive, but also less flexible.
If callbacks are installed, no signals will be emited for performance reasons.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: a user_data argument for the callbacks

function.name: gst_app_src_set_caps
function.description: Set the capabilities on the appsrc element. This function takes a copy of the caps structure. After calling this method, the source will only produce caps that match @caps. @caps must be fixed and the caps on the buffers must match the caps or left NULL.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_emit_signals
function.description: Make appsrc emit the "new-preroll" and "new-buffer" signals. This option is by default disabled because signal emission is expensive and unneeded when the application prefers to operate in pull mode.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_latency
function.description: Configure the @min and @max latency in @src. If @min is set to -1, the default latency calculations for pseudo-live sources will be used.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_max_bytes
function.description: Set the maximum amount of bytes that can be queued in @appsrc. After the maximum amount of bytes are queued, @appsrc will emit the "enough-data" signal.

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum number of bytes to queue

function.name: gst_app_src_set_size
function.description: Set the size of the stream in bytes. A value of -1 means that the size is not known.

function.name: gst_app_src_set_stream_type
function.description:
Set the stream type on @appsrc. For seekable streams, the "seek" signal must be connected to.
A stream_type stream

function.name: gst_atomic_int_set
function.description:
Unconditionally sets the atomic integer to @value.
Deprecated: Use g_atomic_int_set().

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_length
function.description: Get the amount of items in the queue.
function.return: the number of elements in the queue.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_new
function.description: Create a new atomic queue instance. @initial_size will be rounded up to the nearest power of 2 and used as the initial size of the queue.
function.return: a new #GstAtomicQueue

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_peek
function.description: Peek the head element of the queue without removing it from the queue.
function.return: the head element of @queue or NULL when the queue is empty.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_pop
function.description: Get the head element of the queue.
function.return: the head element of @queue or NULL when the queue is empty.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_push
function.description: Append @data to the tail of the queue.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_ref
function.description: Increase the refcount of @queue.

function.name: gst_atomic_queue_unref
function.description: Unref @queue and free the memory when the refcount reaches 0.

function.name: gst_audio_buffer_clip

parameter.name: segment
parameter.parameter_description: Segment in %GST_FORMAT_TIME or %GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT to which the buffer should be clipped.

parameter.name: frame_size
parameter.parameter_description: size of one audio frame in bytes.

function.return:
%NULL if the buffer is completely outside the configured segment, otherwise the clipped buffer is returned.
If the buffer has no timestamp, it is assumed to be inside the segment and is not clipped

function.name: gst_audio_check_channel_positions
function.description: This functions checks if the given channel positions are valid. Channel positions are valid if: <itemizedlist> <listitem><para>No channel positions appears twice or all positions are %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_NONE. </para></listitem> <listitem><para>Either all or none of the channel positions are %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_NONE. </para></listitem> <listitem><para>%GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_FRONT_MONO and %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_FRONT_LEFT or %GST_AUDIO_CHANNEL_POSITION_FRONT_RIGHT don't appear together in the given positions. </para></listitem> </itemizedlist>
function.return: %TRUE if the given channel positions are valid and %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_adjust
function.description: Adjust @time with the internal offset of the audio clock.
function.return: @time adjusted with the internal offset.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_get_time
function.description: Report the time as returned by the #GstAudioClockGetTimeFunc without applying any offsets.
function.return: the time as reported by the time function of the audio clock

function.name: gst_audio_clock_invalidate
function.description:
Invalidate the clock function. Call this function when the provided #GstAudioClockGetTimeFunc cannot be called anymore, for example, when the user_data becomes invalid.
After calling this function, @clock will return the last returned time for the rest of its lifetime.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_new
function.description: Create a new #GstAudioClock instance. Whenever the clock time should be calculated it will call @func with @user_data. When @func returns #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, the clock will return the last reported time.
function.return: a new #GstAudioClock casted to a #GstClock.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_new_full
function.description: Create a new #GstAudioClock instance. Whenever the clock time should be calculated it will call @func with @user_data. When @func returns #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, the clock will return the last reported time.
function.return: a new #GstAudioClock casted to a #GstClock.

function.name: gst_audio_clock_reset
function.description: Inform @clock that future calls to #GstAudioClockGetTimeFunc will return values starting from @time. The clock will update an internal offset to make sure that future calls to internal_time will return an increasing result as required by the #GstClock object.

function.name: gst_audio_default_registry_mixer_filter
function.description:
Utility function to find audio mixer elements.
Will traverse the default plugin registry in order of plugin rank and find usable audio mixer elements. The caller may optionally fine-tune the selection by specifying a filter function.

parameter.name: first
parameter.parameter_description: set to #TRUE if you only want the first suitable mixer element

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the filter function

function.return: a #GList of audio mixer #GstElement<!-- -->s. You must free each element in the list by setting it to NULL state and calling gst_object_unref(). After that the list itself should be freed using g_list_free().

function.name: gst_audio_duration_from_pad_buffer
function.description: Calculate length in nanoseconds of audio buffer @buf based on capabilities of @pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the caps from

function.return: the length.

function.name: gst_audio_filter_class_add_pad_templates

parameter.name: allowed_caps
parameter.parameter_description: what formats the filter can handle, as #GstCaps

function.name: gst_audio_fixate_channel_positions
function.description: Custom fixate function. Elements that implement some sort of channel conversion algorithm should use this function for fixating on GstAudioChannelPosition properties. It will take care of equal channel positioning (left/right). Caller g_free()s the return value. The input properties may be (and are supposed to be) unfixed. Note that this function is mostly a hack because we currently have no way to add default fixation functions for new GTypes.
function.return: fixed values that the caller could use as a fixed set of #GstAudioChannelPosition values.

function.name: gst_audio_frame_byte_size
function.description: Calculate byte size of an audio frame.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the caps from

function.return: the byte size, or 0 if there was an error

function.name: gst_audio_frame_length
function.description: Calculate length of buffer in frames.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the caps from

function.return: 0 if there's an error, or the number of frames if everything's ok

function.name: gst_audio_get_channel_positions
function.description: Retrieves a number of (fixed!) audio channel positions from the provided #GstStructure and returns it as a newly allocated array. The caller should g_free () this array. The caller should also check that the members in this #GstStructure are indeed "fixed" before calling this function.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstStructure to retrieve channel positions from.

function.return: a newly allocated array containing the channel positions as provided in the given #GstStructure. Returns NULL on error.

function.name: gst_audio_is_buffer_framed
function.description: Check if the buffer size is a whole multiple of the frame size.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the caps from

function.return: %TRUE if buffer size is multiple.

function.name: gst_audio_set_caps_channel_positions_list
function.description: Sets a (possibly non-fixed) list of possible audio channel positions (given in pos) on the given caps. Each of the structures of the caps, after this function has been called, will contain a "channel-positions" field with an array. Each value in the array will contain each of the values given in the pos array. Note that the size of the caps might be increased by this, since each structure with a "channel- positions" field needs to have a fixed "channels" field. The input caps is not required to have this.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: #GstCaps to set the list of channel positions on.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the array containing one or more possible audio channel positions that we should add in each value of the array in the given structure.

parameter.name: num_positions
parameter.parameter_description: the number of values in pos.

function.name: gst_audio_set_channel_positions
function.description: Adds a "channel-positions" field to the given #GstStructure, which will represent the channel positions as given in the provided #GstAudioChannelPosition array.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstStructure to set channel positions on.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: an array of channel positions. The number of members in this array should be equal to the (fixed!) number of the "channels" field in the given #GstStructure.

function.name: gst_audio_set_structure_channel_positions_list
function.description: Sets a (possibly non-fixed) list of possible audio channel positions (given in pos) on the given structure. The structure, after this function has been called, will contain a "channel-positions" field with an array of the size of the "channels" field value in the given structure (note that this means that the channels field in the provided structure should be fixed!). Each value in the array will contain each of the values given in the pos array.

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: #GstStructure to set the list of channel positions on.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the array containing one or more possible audio channel positions that we should add in each value of the array in the given structure.

parameter.name: num_positions
parameter.parameter_description: the number of values in pos.

function.name: gst_audio_structure_set_int
function.description:
Do not use anymore.
Deprecated: use gst_structure_set()

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_create_ringbuffer
function.description: Create and return the #GstRingBuffer for @sink. This function will call the ::create_ringbuffer vmethod and will set @sink as the parent of the returned buffer (see gst_object_set_parent()).
function.return: The new ringbuffer of @sink.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_get_drift_tolerance
function.description: Get the current drift tolerance, in microseconds, used by @sink.
function.return: The current drift tolerance used by @sink.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_get_provide_clock
function.description: Queries whether @sink will provide a clock or not. See also gst_base_audio_sink_set_provide_clock.
function.return: %TRUE if @sink will provide a clock.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_get_slave_method
function.description: Get the current slave method used by @sink.
function.return: The current slave method used by @sink.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_set_drift_tolerance
function.description: Controls the sink's drift tolerance.

parameter.name: drift_tolerance
parameter.parameter_description: the new drift tolerance in microseconds

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_set_provide_clock
function.description: Controls whether @sink will provide a clock or not. If @provide is %TRUE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return a clock that reflects the datarate of @sink. If @provide is %FALSE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return NULL.

function.name: gst_base_audio_sink_set_slave_method
function.description: Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @sink.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_create_ringbuffer
function.description: Create and return the #GstRingBuffer for @src. This function will call the ::create_ringbuffer vmethod and will set @src as the parent of the returned buffer (see gst_object_set_parent()).
function.return: The new ringbuffer of @src.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_get_provide_clock
function.description: Queries whether @src will provide a clock or not. See also gst_base_audio_src_set_provide_clock.
function.return: %TRUE if @src will provide a clock.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_get_slave_method
function.description: Get the current slave method used by @src.
function.return: The current slave method used by @src.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_set_provide_clock
function.description: Controls whether @src will provide a clock or not. If @provide is %TRUE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return a clock that reflects the datarate of @src. If @provide is %FALSE, gst_element_provide_clock() will return NULL.

function.name: gst_base_audio_src_set_slave_method
function.description: Controls how clock slaving will be performed in @src.

function.name: gst_base_parse_add_index_entry
function.description: Adds an entry to the index associating @offset to @ts. It is recommended to only add keyframe entries. @force allows to bypass checks, such as whether the stream is (upstream) seekable, another entry is already "close" to the new entry, etc.
function.return: #gboolean indicating whether entry was added

function.name: gst_base_parse_convert_default
function.description: Default implementation of "convert" vmethod in #GstBaseParse class.

parameter.name: dest_value
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer where the conversion result will be put.

function.return: TRUE if conversion was successful.

function.name: gst_base_parse_frame_init
function.description: Sets a #GstBaseParseFrame to initial state. Currently this means all public fields are zero-ed and a private flag is set to make sure gst_base_parse_frame_free() only frees the contents but not the actual frame. Use this function to initialise a #GstBaseParseFrame allocated on the stack.

function.name: gst_base_parse_frame_new
function.description: Allocates a new #GstBaseParseFrame. This function is mainly for bindings, elements written in C should usually allocate the frame on the stack and then use gst_base_parse_frame_init() to initialise it.

parameter.name: overhead
parameter.parameter_description: number of bytes in this frame which should be counted as metadata overhead, ie. not used to calculate the average bitrate. Set to -1 to mark the entire frame as metadata. If in doubt, set to 0.

function.return: a newly-allocated #GstBaseParseFrame. Free with gst_base_parse_frame_free() when no longer needed, unless you gave away ownership to gst_base_parse_push_frame().

function.name: gst_base_parse_push_frame
function.description:
Pushes the frame downstream, sends any pending events and does some timestamp and segment handling. Takes ownership of @frame and will clear it (if it was initialised with gst_base_parse_frame_init()) or free it.
This must be called with sinkpad STREAM_LOCK held.
function.return: #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_average_bitrate
function.description:
Optionally sets the average bitrate detected in media (if non-zero), e.g. based on metadata, as it will be posted to the application.
By default, announced average bitrate is estimated. The average bitrate is used to estimate the total duration of the stream and to estimate a seek position, if there's no index and the format is syncable (see gst_base_parse_set_syncable()).

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_duration
function.description: Sets the duration of the currently playing media. Subclass can use this when it is able to determine duration and/or notices a change in the media duration. Alternatively, if @interval is non-zero (default), then stream duration is determined based on estimated bitrate, and updated every @interval frames.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: how often to update the duration estimate based on bitrate, or 0.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_frame_rate
function.description: If frames per second is configured, parser can take care of buffer duration and timestamping. When performing segment clipping, or seeking to a specific location, a corresponding decoder might need an initial @lead_in and a following @lead_out number of frames to ensure the desired segment is entirely filled upon decoding.

parameter.name: lead_in
parameter.parameter_description: frames needed before a segment for subsequent decode

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_has_timing_info
function.description: Set if frames carry timing information which the subclass can (generally) parse and provide. In particular, intrinsic (rather than estimated) time can be obtained following a seek.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_min_frame_size
function.description: Subclass can use this function to tell the base class that it needs to give at least #min_size buffers.

parameter.name: min_size
parameter.parameter_description: Minimum size of the data that this base class should give to subclass.

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_passthrough
function.description: Set if the nature of the format or configuration does not allow (much) parsing, and the parser should operate in passthrough mode (which only applies when operating in push mode). That is, incoming buffers are pushed through unmodified, i.e. no @check_valid_frame or @parse_frame callbacks will be invoked, but @pre_push_buffer will still be invoked, so subclass can perform as much or as little is appropriate for passthrough semantics in @pre_push_buffer.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if parser should run in passthrough mode

function.name: gst_base_parse_set_syncable
function.description: Set if frame starts can be identified. This is set by default and determines whether seeking based on bitrate averages is possible for a format/stream.

parameter.name: syncable
parameter.parameter_description: set if frame starts can be identified

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_flush
function.description:
Create an RTP buffer and store @payload_len bytes of the adapter as the payload. Set the timestamp on the new buffer to @timestamp before pushing the buffer downstream.
If @payload_len is -1, all pending bytes will be flushed. If @timestamp is -1, the timestamp will be calculated automatically.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_get_adapter
function.description: Gets the internal adapter used by the depayloader.
function.return: a #GstAdapter.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_push
function.description: Create an RTP buffer and store @payload_len bytes of @data as the payload. Set the timestamp on the new buffer to @timestamp before pushing the buffer downstream.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_set_frame_based
function.description: Tells #GstBaseRTPAudioPayload that the child element is for a frame based audio codec

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_set_frame_options
function.description: Sets the options for frame based audio codecs.

parameter.name: frame_duration
parameter.parameter_description: The duraction of an audio frame in milliseconds.

parameter.name: frame_size
parameter.parameter_description: The size of an audio frame in bytes.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_set_sample_based
function.description: Tells #GstBaseRTPAudioPayload that the child element is for a sample based audio codec

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_set_sample_options
function.description: Sets the options for sample based audio codecs.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_audio_payload_set_samplebits_options
function.description: Sets the options for sample based audio codecs.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_depayload_push
function.description:
Push @out_buf to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_buf.
Unlike gst_base_rtp_depayload_push_ts(), this function will not apply any timestamp on the outgoing buffer. Subclasses should therefore timestamp outgoing buffers themselves.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_depayload_push_list
function.description: Push @out_list to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_list.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_base_rtp_depayload_push_ts
function.description:
Push @out_buf to the peer of @filter. This function takes ownership of @out_buf.
Unlike gst_base_rtp_depayload_push(), this function will by default apply the last incomming timestamp on the outgoing buffer when it didn't have a timestamp already. The set_get_timestamp vmethod can be overwritten to change this behaviour (and take, for example, @timestamp into account).
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_base_sink_do_preroll
function.description:
If the @sink spawns its own thread for pulling buffers from upstream it should call this method after it has pulled a buffer. If the element needed to preroll, this function will perform the preroll and will then block until the element state is changed.
This function should be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: the mini object that caused the preroll

function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK if the preroll completed and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the render vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_blocksize
function.description: Get the number of bytes that the sink will pull when it is operating in pull mode.
function.return: the number of bytes @sink will pull in pull mode.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_last_buffer
function.description:
Get the last buffer that arrived in the sink and was used for preroll or for rendering. This property can be used to generate thumbnails.
The #GstCaps on the buffer can be used to determine the type of the buffer.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref
function.return: a #GstBuffer. gst_buffer_unref() after usage. This function returns NULL when no buffer has arrived in the sink yet or when the sink is not in PAUSED or PLAYING.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_latency
function.description: Get the currently configured latency.
function.return: The configured latency.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_max_lateness
function.description: Gets the max lateness value. See gst_base_sink_set_max_lateness for more details.
function.return: The maximum time in nanoseconds that a buffer can be late before it is dropped and not rendered. A value of -1 means an unlimited time.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_render_delay
function.description: Get the render delay of @sink. see gst_base_sink_set_render_delay() for more information about the render delay.
function.return: the render delay of @sink.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_sync
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to synchronize against the clock.
function.return: TRUE if the sink is configured to synchronize against the clock.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_throttle_time
function.description: Get the time that will be inserted between frames to control the maximum buffers per second.
function.return: the number of nanoseconds @sink will put between frames.

function.name: gst_base_sink_get_ts_offset
function.description: Get the synchronisation offset of @sink.
function.return: The synchronisation offset.

function.name: gst_base_sink_is_async_enabled
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to perform asynchronous state changes to PAUSED.
function.return: TRUE if the sink is configured to perform asynchronous state changes.

function.name: gst_base_sink_is_last_buffer_enabled
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to store the last received buffer in the last-buffer property.
function.return: TRUE if the sink is configured to store the last received buffer.

function.name: gst_base_sink_is_qos_enabled
function.description: Checks if @sink is currently configured to send Quality-of-Service events upstream.
function.return: TRUE if the sink is configured to perform Quality-of-Service.

function.name: gst_base_sink_query_latency
function.description:
Query the sink for the latency parameters. The latency will be queried from the upstream elements. @live will be TRUE if @sink is configured to synchronize against the clock. @upstream_live will be TRUE if an upstream element is live.
If both @live and @upstream_live are TRUE, the sink will want to compensate for the latency introduced by the upstream elements by setting the @min_latency to a strictly possitive value.
This function is mostly used by subclasses.

parameter.name: upstream_live
parameter.parameter_description: if an upstream element is live

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the min latency of the upstream elements

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the max latency of the upstream elements

function.return: TRUE if the query succeeded.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_async_enabled
function.description: Configures @sink to perform all state changes asynchronusly. When async is disabled, the sink will immediatly go to PAUSED instead of waiting for a preroll buffer. This feature is usefull if the sink does not synchronize against the clock or when it is dealing with sparse streams.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_blocksize
function.description: Set the number of bytes that the sink will pull when it is operating in pull mode.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_last_buffer_enabled
function.description: Configures @sink to store the last received buffer in the last-buffer property.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_max_lateness
function.description: Sets the new max lateness value to @max_lateness. This value is used to decide if a buffer should be dropped or not based on the buffer timestamp and the current clock time. A value of -1 means an unlimited time.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_qos_enabled
function.description: Configures @sink to send Quality-of-Service events upstream.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_render_delay
function.description:
Set the render delay in @sink to @delay. The render delay is the time between actual rendering of a buffer and its synchronisation time. Some devices might delay media rendering which can be compensated for with this function.
After calling this function, this sink will report additional latency and other sinks will adjust their latency to delay the rendering of their media.
This function is usually called by subclasses.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_sync
function.description: Configures @sink to synchronize on the clock or not. When @sync is FALSE, incomming samples will be played as fast as possible. If @sync is TRUE, the timestamps of the incomming buffers will be used to schedule the exact render time of its contents.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_throttle_time
function.description: Set the time that will be inserted between rendered buffers. This can be used to control the maximum buffers per second that the sink will render.

function.name: gst_base_sink_set_ts_offset
function.description: Adjust the synchronisation of @sink with @offset. A negative value will render buffers earlier than their timestamp. A positive value will delay rendering. This function can be used to fix playback of badly timestamped buffers.

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_clock
function.description:
This function will block until @time is reached. It is usually called by subclasses that use their own internal synchronisation.
If @time is not valid, no sycnhronisation is done and #GST_CLOCK_BADTIME is returned. Likewise, if synchronisation is disabled in the element or there is no clock, no synchronisation is done and #GST_CLOCK_BADTIME is returned.
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like when receiving an EOS event in the #GstBaseSinkClass.event() vmethod or when receiving a buffer in the #GstBaseSinkClass.render() vmethod.
The @time argument should be the running_time of when this method should return and is not adjusted with any latency or offset configured in the sink.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: the jitter to be filled with time diff, or NULL

function.return: #GstClockReturn

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_eos
function.description:
This function will block until @time is reached. It is usually called by subclasses that use their own internal synchronisation but want to let the EOS be handled by the base class.
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like when receiving an EOS event in the ::event vmethod.
The @time argument should be the running_time of when the EOS should happen and will be adjusted with any latency and offset configured in the sink.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: the jitter to be filled with time diff, or NULL

function.return: #GstFlowReturn

function.name: gst_base_sink_wait_preroll
function.description:
If the #GstBaseSinkClass.render() method performs its own synchronisation against the clock it must unblock when going from PLAYING to the PAUSED state and call this method before continuing to render the remaining data.
This function will block until a state change to PLAYING happens (in which case this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK) or the processing must be stopped due to a state change to READY or a FLUSH event (in which case this function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE).
This function should only be called with the PREROLL_LOCK held, like in the render function.
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK if the preroll completed and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the render vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_blocksize
function.description: Get the number of bytes that @src will push out with each buffer.
function.return: the number of bytes pushed with each buffer.

function.name: gst_base_src_get_do_timestamp
function.description: Query if @src timestamps outgoing buffers based on the current running_time.
function.return: %TRUE if the base class will automatically timestamp outgoing buffers.

function.name: gst_base_src_is_live
function.description: Check if an element is in live mode.
function.return: %TRUE if element is in live mode.

function.name: gst_base_src_new_seamless_segment
function.description:
Prepare a new seamless segment for emission downstream. This function must only be called by derived sub-classes, and only from the create() function, as the stream-lock needs to be held.
The format for the new segment will be the current format of the source, as configured with gst_base_src_set_format()

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: The new start value for the segment

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: Stop value for the new segment

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The position value for the new segent

function.return: %TRUE if preparation of the seamless segment succeeded.

function.name: gst_base_src_query_latency
function.description:
Query the source for the latency parameters. @live will be TRUE when @src is configured as a live source. @min_latency will be set to the difference between the running time and the timestamp of the first buffer. @max_latency is always the undefined value of -1.
This function is mostly used by subclasses.

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the min latency of the source

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the max latency of the source

function.return: TRUE if the query succeeded.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_blocksize
function.description: Set the number of bytes that @src will push out with each buffer. When @blocksize is set to -1, a default length will be used.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_do_timestamp
function.description: Configure @src to automatically timestamp outgoing buffers based on the current running_time of the pipeline. This property is mostly useful for live sources.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_format
function.description:
Sets the default format of the source. This will be the format used for sending NEW_SEGMENT events and for performing seeks.
If a format of GST_FORMAT_BYTES is set, the element will be able to operate in pull mode if the #GstBaseSrcClass.is_seekable() returns TRUE.
This function must only be called in states < %GST_STATE_PAUSED.

function.name: gst_base_src_set_live
function.description:
If the element listens to a live source, @live should be set to %TRUE.
A live source will not produce data in the PAUSED state and will therefore not be able to participate in the PREROLL phase of a pipeline. To signal this fact to the application and the pipeline, the state change return value of the live source will be GST_STATE_CHANGE_NO_PREROLL.

function.name: gst_base_src_wait_playing
function.description:
If the #GstBaseSrcClass.create() method performs its own synchronisation against the clock it must unblock when going from PLAYING to the PAUSED state and call this method before continuing to produce the remaining data.
This function will block until a state change to PLAYING happens (in which case this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK) or the processing must be stopped due to a state change to READY or a FLUSH event (in which case this function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE).
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK if @src is PLAYING and processing can continue. Any other return value should be returned from the create vmethod.

function.name: gst_base_transform_is_in_place
function.description: See if @trans is configured as a in_place transform.
function.return:
TRUE is the transform is configured in in_place mode.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_is_passthrough
function.description: See if @trans is configured as a passthrough transform.
function.return:
TRUE is the transform is configured in passthrough mode.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_is_qos_enabled
function.description: Queries if the transform will handle QoS.
function.return:
TRUE if QoS is enabled.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_reconfigure
function.description: Instructs @trans to renegotiate a new downstream transform on the next buffer. This function is typically called after properties on the transform were set that influence the output format.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_gap_aware
function.description:
If @gap_aware is %FALSE (the default), output buffers will have the %GST_BUFFER_FLAG_GAP flag unset.
If set to %TRUE, the element must handle output buffers with this flag set correctly, i.e. it can assume that the buffer contains neutral data but must unset the flag if the output is no neutral data.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_in_place
function.description:
Determines whether a non-writable buffer will be copied before passing to the transform_ip function. <itemizedlist> <listitem>Always TRUE if no transform function is implemented.</listitem> <listitem>Always FALSE if ONLY transform function is implemented.</listitem> </itemizedlist>
MT safe.

parameter.name: in_place
parameter.parameter_description: Boolean value indicating that we would like to operate on in_place buffers.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_passthrough
function.description:
Set passthrough mode for this filter by default. This is mostly useful for filters that do not care about negotiation.
Always TRUE for filters which don't implement either a transform or transform_ip method.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_set_qos_enabled
function.description:
Enable or disable QoS handling in the transform.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_base_transform_suggest
function.description: Instructs @trans to suggest new @caps upstream. A copy of @caps will be taken.

function.name: gst_base_transform_update_qos
function.description:
Set the QoS parameters in the transform. This function is called internally when a QOS event is received but subclasses can provide custom information when needed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamp of the buffer generating the QoS expressed in running_time.

function.name: gst_basertppayload_is_filled
function.description: Check if the packet with @size and @duration would exceed the configured maximum size.
function.return: %TRUE if the packet of @size and @duration would exceed the configured MTU or max_ptime.

function.name: gst_basertppayload_push
function.description:
Push @buffer to the peer element of the payloader. The SSRC, payload type, seqnum and timestamp of the RTP buffer will be updated first.
This function takes ownership of @buffer.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_basertppayload_push_list
function.description:
Push @list to the peer element of the payloader. The SSRC, payload type, seqnum and timestamp of the RTP buffer will be updated first.
This function takes ownership of @list.
function.return: a #GstFlowReturn.

function.name: gst_basertppayload_set_options
function.description: Set the rtp options of the payloader. These options will be set in the caps of the payloader. Subclasses must call this method before calling gst_basertppayload_push() or gst_basertppayload_set_outcaps().

parameter.name: dynamic
parameter.parameter_description: if the payload type is dynamic

parameter.name: clock_rate
parameter.parameter_description: the clock rate of the media

function.name: gst_basertppayload_set_outcaps
function.description:
Configure the output caps with the optional parameters.
Variable arguments should be in the form field name, field type (as a GType), value(s). The last variable argument should be NULL.
function.return: %TRUE if the caps could be set.

function.name: gst_bin_add
function.description:
Adds the given element to the bin. Sets the element's parent, and thus takes ownership of the element. An element can only be added to one bin.
If the element's pads are linked to other pads, the pads will be unlinked before the element is added to the bin.
<note> When you add an element to an already-running pipeline, you will have to take care to set the state of the newly-added element to the desired state (usually PLAYING or PAUSED, same you set the pipeline to originally) with gst_element_set_state(), or use gst_element_sync_state_with_parent(). The bin or pipeline will not take care of this for you. </note>
MT safe.
function.return: TRUE if the element could be added, FALSE if the bin does not want to accept the element.

function.name: gst_bin_add_many
function.description: Adds a NULL-terminated list of elements to a bin. This function is equivalent to calling gst_bin_add() for each member of the list. The return value of each gst_bin_add() is ignored.

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstElement element to add to the bin

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: additional elements to add to the bin

function.name: gst_bin_find_unconnected_pad
function.description:
Recursively looks for elements with an unlinked pad of the given direction within the specified bin and returns an unlinked pad if one is found, or NULL otherwise. If a pad is found, the caller owns a reference to it and should use gst_object_unref() on the pad when it is not needed any longer.
Deprecated: use gst_bin_find_unlinked_pad() instead.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: bin in which to look for elements with unlinked pads

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: whether to look for an unlinked source or sink pad

function.return: unlinked pad of the given direction, or NULL.

function.name: gst_bin_find_unlinked_pad
function.description: Recursively looks for elements with an unlinked pad of the given direction within the specified bin and returns an unlinked pad if one is found, or NULL otherwise. If a pad is found, the caller owns a reference to it and should use gst_object_unref() on the pad when it is not needed any longer.

parameter.name: bin
parameter.parameter_description: bin in which to look for elements with unlinked pads

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: whether to look for an unlinked source or sink pad

function.return: unlinked pad of the given direction, or NULL.

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_interface
function.description:
Looks for an element inside the bin that implements the given interface. If such an element is found, it returns the element. You can cast this element to the given interface afterwards. If you want all elements that implement the interface, use gst_bin_iterate_all_by_interface(). This function recurses into child bins.
MT safe. Caller owns returned reference.
function.return: A #GstElement inside the bin implementing the interface

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_name
function.description: Gets the element with the given name from a bin. This function recurses into child bins.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the element name to search for

function.return: the #GstElement with the given name, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_get_by_name_recurse_up
function.description: Gets the element with the given name from this bin. If the element is not found, a recursion is performed on the parent bin.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the element name to search for

function.return: the #GstElement with the given name, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_all_by_interface
function.description:
Looks for all elements inside the bin that implements the given interface. You can safely cast all returned elements to the given interface. The function recurses inside child bins. The iterator will yield a series of #GstElement that should be unreffed after use.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement for all elements in the bin implementing the given interface, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_elements
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_recurse
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin. This iterator recurses into GstBin children.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sinks
function.description:
Gets an iterator for all elements in the bin that have the #GST_ELEMENT_IS_SINK flag set.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sorted
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the elements in this bin in topologically sorted order. This means that the elements are returned from the most downstream elements (sinks) to the sources.
This function is used internally to perform the state changes of the bin elements and for clock selection.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_iterate_sources
function.description:
Gets an iterator for all elements in the bin that have the #GST_ELEMENT_IS_SOURCE flag set.
Each element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
MT safe. Caller owns returned value.
function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstElement, or NULL

function.name: gst_bin_new
function.description: Creates a new bin with the given name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new bin

function.return: a new #GstBin

function.name: gst_bin_recalculate_latency
function.description:
Query @bin for the current latency using and reconfigures this latency to all the elements with a LATENCY event.
This method is typically called on the pipeline when a #GST_MESSAGE_LATENCY is posted on the bus.
This function simply emits the 'do-latency' signal so any custom latency calculations will be performed.
function.return: %TRUE if the latency could be queried and reconfigured.

function.name: gst_bin_remove
function.description:
Removes the element from the bin, unparenting it as well. Unparenting the element means that the element will be dereferenced, so if the bin holds the only reference to the element, the element will be freed in the process of removing it from the bin. If you want the element to still exist after removing, you need to call gst_object_ref() before removing it from the bin.
If the element's pads are linked to other pads, the pads will be unlinked before the element is removed from the bin.
MT safe.
function.return: TRUE if the element could be removed, FALSE if the bin does not want to remove the element.

function.name: gst_bin_remove_many
function.description: Remove a list of elements from a bin. This function is equivalent to calling gst_bin_remove() with each member of the list.

parameter.name: element_1
parameter.parameter_description: the first #GstElement to remove from the bin

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated list of elements to remove from the bin

function.name: gst_bit_reader_free
function.description: Frees a #GstBitReader instance, which was previously allocated by gst_bit_reader_new() or gst_bit_reader_new_from_buffer().

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint16
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint16 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint32
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint32 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint64
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint64 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_bits_uint8
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val and update the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint8 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_pos
function.description: Returns the current position of a #GstBitReader instance in bits.
function.return: The current position of @reader in bits.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_remaining
function.description: Returns the remaining number of bits of a #GstBitReader instance.
function.return: The remaining number of bits of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_get_size
function.description: Returns the total number of bits of a #GstBitReader instance.
function.return: The total number of bits of @reader instance.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_init
function.description: Initializes a #GstBitReader instance to read from @data. This function can be called on already initialized instances.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data from which the bit reader should read

function.name: gst_bit_reader_init_from_buffer
function.description: Initializes a #GstBitReader instance to read from @buffer. This function can be called on already initialized instances.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: Buffer from which the #GstBitReader should read

function.name: gst_bit_reader_new
function.description:
Create a new #GstBitReader instance, which will read from @data.
Free-function: gst_bit_reader_free

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: Data from which the #GstBitReader should read

function.return: a new #GstBitReader instance

function.name: gst_bit_reader_new_from_buffer
function.description:
Create a new #GstBitReader instance, which will read from the #GstBuffer @buffer.
Free-function: gst_bit_reader_free

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: Buffer from which the #GstBitReader should read

function.return: a new #GstBitReader instance

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint16
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint16 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint32
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint32 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint64
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint64 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_peek_bits_uint8
function.description: Read @nbits bits into @val but keep the current position.

parameter.name: val
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint8 to store the result

function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_set_pos
function.description: Sets the new position of a #GstBitReader instance to @pos in bits.
function.return: %TRUE if the position could be set successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip
function.description: Skips @nbits bits of the #GstBitReader instance.

parameter.name: nbits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of bits to skip

function.return: %TRUE if @nbits bits could be skipped, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_bit_reader_skip_to_byte
function.description: Skips until the next byte.
function.return: %TRUE if successful, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_buffer_copy_metadata

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags indicating what metadata fields should be copied.

function.name: gst_buffer_create_sub
function.description:
Creates a sub-buffer from @parent at @offset and @size. This sub-buffer uses the actual memory space of the parent buffer. This function will copy the offset and timestamp fields when the offset is 0. If not, they will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and #GST_BUFFER_OFFSET_NONE. If @offset equals 0 and @size equals the total size of @buffer, the duration and offset end fields are also copied. If not they will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE and #GST_BUFFER_OFFSET_NONE.
MT safe.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset into parent #GstBuffer at which the new sub-buffer begins.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the new #GstBuffer sub-buffer, in bytes.

function.return: the new #GstBuffer or NULL if the arguments were invalid.

function.name: gst_buffer_get_caps
function.description: Gets the media type of the buffer. This can be NULL if there is no media type attached to this buffer.
function.return: a reference to the #GstCaps. unref after usage. Returns NULL if there were no caps on this buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_is_metadata_writable
function.description: Similar to gst_buffer_is_writable, but this only ensures that the refcount of the buffer is 1, indicating that the caller is the sole owner and can change the buffer metadata, such as caps and timestamps.
function.return: TRUE if the metadata is writable.

function.name: gst_buffer_is_span_fast
function.description:
Determines whether a gst_buffer_span() can be done without copying the contents, that is, whether the data areas are contiguous sub-buffers of the same buffer.
MT safe.
function.return: TRUE if the buffers are contiguous, FALSE if a copy would be required.

function.name: gst_buffer_join
function.description:
Create a new buffer that is the concatenation of the two source buffers, and unrefs the original source buffers.
If the buffers point to contiguous areas of memory, the buffer is created without copying the data.
This is a convenience function for C programmers. See also gst_buffer_merge(), which does the same thing without unreffing the input parameters. Language bindings without explicit reference counting should not wrap this function.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer which is the concatenation of the source buffers.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_foreach
function.description:
Call @func with @data for each buffer in @list.
@func can modify the passed buffer pointer or its contents. The return value of @func define if this function returns or if the remaining buffers in a group should be skipped.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_get
function.description:
Get the buffer at @idx in @group.
Note that this function is not efficient for iterating over the entire list. Use an iterator or gst_buffer_list_foreach() instead.
function.return: the buffer at @idx in @group or NULL when there is no buffer. The buffer remains valid as long as @list is valid.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterate
function.description:
Iterate the buffers in @list. The owner of the iterator must also be the owner of a reference to @list while the returned iterator is in use.
Free-function: gst_buffer_list_iterator_free
function.return: a new #GstBufferListIterator of the buffers in @list. gst_buffer_list_iterator_free() after usage

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_add
function.description:
Inserts @buffer into the #GstBufferList iterated with @it. The buffer is inserted into the current group, immediately before the buffer that would be returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next(). The buffer is inserted before the implicit cursor, a subsequent call to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() will return the buffer after the inserted buffer, if any.
This function takes ownership of @buffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_add_group
function.description: Inserts a new, empty group into the #GstBufferList iterated with @it. The group is inserted immediately before the group that would be returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next_group(). A subsequent call to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next_group() will advance the iterator to the group after the inserted group, if any.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_add_list
function.description:
Inserts @list of buffers into the #GstBufferList iterated with @it. The list is inserted into the current group, immediately before the buffer that would be returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next(). The list is inserted before the implicit cursor, a subsequent call to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() will return the buffer after the last buffer of the inserted list, if any.
This function takes ownership of @list and all its buffers.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_do
function.description:
Calls the given function for the last buffer returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next(). gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() must have been called on @it before this function is called. gst_buffer_list_iterator_remove() and gst_buffer_list_iterator_steal() must not have been called since the last call to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next().
See #GstBufferListDoFunction for more details.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the gpointer to optional user data.

function.return: the return value from @do_func

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_free
function.description: Free the iterator.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_merge_group
function.description:
Merge a buffer list group into a normal #GstBuffer by copying its metadata and memcpying its data into consecutive memory. All buffers in the current group after the implicit cursor will be merged into one new buffer. The metadata of the new buffer will be a copy of the metadata of the buffer that would be returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next(). If there is no buffer in the current group after the implicit cursor, NULL will be returned.
This function will not move the implicit cursor or in any other way affect the state of the iterator @it or the list.
function.return: a new #GstBuffer, gst_buffer_unref() after usage, or NULL

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_n_buffers
function.description:
Returns the number of buffers left to iterate in the current group. I.e. the number of calls that can be made to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() before it returns NULL.
This function will not move the implicit cursor or in any other way affect the state of the iterator @it.
function.return: the number of buffers left to iterate in the current group

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_next
function.description:
Returns the next buffer in the list iterated with @it. If the iterator is at the end of a group, NULL will be returned. This function may be called repeatedly to iterate through the current group.
The caller will not get a new ref to the returned #GstBuffer and must not unref it.
function.return: the next buffer in the current group of the buffer list, or NULL

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_next_group
function.description: Advance the iterator @it to the first buffer in the next group. If the iterator is at the last group, FALSE will be returned. This function may be called repeatedly to iterate through the groups in a buffer list.
function.return: TRUE if the iterator could be advanced to the next group, FALSE if the iterator was already at the last group

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_remove
function.description:
Removes the last buffer returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() from the #GstBufferList iterated with @it. gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() must have been called on @it before this function is called. This function can only be called once per call to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next().
The removed buffer is unreffed.

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_steal
function.description: Returns the last buffer returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() without modifying the refcount of the buffer.
function.return: the last buffer returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next()

function.name: gst_buffer_list_iterator_take
function.description:
Replaces the last buffer returned by gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() with @buffer in the #GstBufferList iterated with @it and takes ownership of @buffer. gst_buffer_list_iterator_next() must have been called on @it before this function is called. gst_buffer_list_iterator_remove() must not have been called since the last call to gst_buffer_list_iterator_next().
This function unrefs the replaced buffer if it has not been stolen with gst_buffer_list_iterator_steal() and takes ownership of @buffer (i.e. the refcount of @buffer is not increased).
FIXME 0.11: this conditional taking-ownership is not good for bindings

function.name: gst_buffer_list_n_groups
function.description: Returns the number of groups in @list.
function.return: the number of groups in the buffer list

function.name: gst_buffer_list_new
function.description:
Creates a new, empty #GstBufferList. The caller is responsible for unreffing the returned #GstBufferList.
Free-function: gst_buffer_list_unref
function.return: the new #GstBufferList. gst_buffer_list_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_buffer_make_metadata_writable
function.description:
Similar to gst_buffer_make_writable, but does not ensure that the buffer data array is writable. Instead, this just ensures that the returned buffer is solely owned by the caller, by creating a subbuffer of the original buffer if necessary.
After calling this function, @buf should not be referenced anymore. The result of this function has guaranteed writable metadata.
function.return: a new #GstBuffer with writable metadata, which may or may not be the same as @buf.

function.name: gst_buffer_merge
function.description:
Create a new buffer that is the concatenation of the two source buffers. The original source buffers will not be modified or unref'd. Make sure you unref the source buffers if they are not used anymore afterwards.
If the buffers point to contiguous areas of memory, the buffer is created without copying the data.
Free-function: gst_buffer_unref
function.return: the new #GstBuffer which is the concatenation of the source buffers.

function.name: gst_buffer_new
function.description:
Creates a newly allocated buffer without any data.
MT safe.
function.return: the new #GstBuffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_new_and_alloc
function.description:
Creates a newly allocated buffer with data of the given size. The buffer memory is not cleared. If the requested amount of memory can't be allocated, the program will abort. Use gst_buffer_try_new_and_alloc() if you want to handle this case gracefully or have gotten the size to allocate from an untrusted source such as a media stream.
Note that when @size == 0, the buffer data pointer will be NULL.
MT safe.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size in bytes of the new buffer's data.

function.return: the new #GstBuffer.

function.name: gst_buffer_set_caps
function.description: Sets the media type on the buffer. The refcount of the caps will be increased and any previous caps on the buffer will be unreffed.

function.name: gst_buffer_span
function.description:
Creates a new buffer that consists of part of buf1 and buf2. Logically, buf1 and buf2 are concatenated into a single larger buffer, and a new buffer is created at the given offset inside this space, with a given length.
If the two source buffers are children of the same larger buffer, and are contiguous, the new buffer will be a child of the shared parent, and thus no copying is necessary. you can use gst_buffer_is_span_fast() to determine if a memcpy will be needed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: offset
