function.description: Lists all #GstEncodingTarget categories present on disk.
function.return: A list of #GstEncodingTarget categories.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_find
function.description: Find the #GstEncodingProfile with the specified name and category.
function.return: The matching #GstEncodingProfile or %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_description
function.return: the description of the profile, can be %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_format
function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the media format used in the profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_input_caps
function.description: Computes the full output caps that this @profile will be able to consume.
function.return: The full caps the given @profile can consume. Call gst_caps_unref() when you are done with the caps.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_name
function.return: the name of the profile, can be %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_presence
function.return: The number of times the profile is used in its parent container profile. If 0, it is not a mandatory stream.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_preset
function.return: the name of the #GstPreset to be used in the profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_restriction
function.return: The restriction #GstCaps to apply before the encoder that will be used in the profile. The fields present in restriction caps are properties of the raw stream (that is before encoding), such as height and width for video and depth and sampling rate for audio. Does not apply to #GstEncodingContainerProfile (since there is no corresponding raw stream). Can be %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_get_type_nick
function.return: the human-readable name of the type of @profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_is_equal
function.description: Checks whether the two #GstEncodingProfile are equal
function.return: %TRUE if @a and @b are equal, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_description
function.description: Set @description as the given description for the @profile. A copy of @description will be made internally.

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: the description to set on the profile

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_format
function.description: Sets the media format used in the profile.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the media format to use in the profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_name
function.description: Set @name as the given name for the @profile. A copy of @name will be made internally.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name to set on the profile

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_presence
function.description: Set the number of time the profile is used in its parent container profile. If 0, it is not a mandatory stream

parameter.name: presence
parameter.parameter_description: the number of time the profile can be used

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_preset
function.description: Sets the preset to use for the profile.

function.name: gst_encoding_profile_set_restriction
function.description: Set the restriction #GstCaps to apply before the encoder that will be used in the profile. See gst_encoding_profile_set_restriction() for more about restrictions. Does not apply to #GstEncodingContainerProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_add_profile
function.description:
Adds the given @profile to the @target. Each added profile must have a unique name within the profile.
The @target will steal a reference to the @profile. If you wish to use the profile after calling this method, you should increase its reference count.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEncodingTarget to add a profile to

function.return: %TRUE if the profile was added, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_category
function.return: The category of the @target. For example: #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_description
function.return: The description of the @target.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_name
function.return: The name of the @target.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_profile

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the profile to retrieve

function.return: The matching #GstEncodingProfile, or %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_get_profiles
function.return: A list of #GstEncodingProfile(s) this @target handles.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_load
function.description:
Searches for the #GstEncodingTarget with the given name, loads it and returns it.
If the category name is specified only targets from that category will be searched for.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the #GstEncodingTarget to load.

parameter.name: category
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the target category, like #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE. Can be %NULL

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: The #GstEncodingTarget if available, else %NULL.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_load_from_file
function.description: Opens the provided file and returns the contained #GstEncodingTarget.

parameter.name: filepath
parameter.parameter_description: The file location to load the #GstEncodingTarget from

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: The #GstEncodingTarget contained in the file, else %NULL

function.name: gst_encoding_target_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstEncodingTarget.
The name and category can only consist of lowercase ASCII letters for the first character, followed by either lowercase ASCII letters, digits or hyphens ('-').
The @category <emphasis>should</emphasis> be one of the existing well-defined categories, like #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE, but it <emphasis>can</emphasis> be a application or user specific category if needed.

parameter.name: category
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the category to which this @target belongs. For example: #GST_ENCODING_CATEGORY_DEVICE.

parameter.name: description
parameter.parameter_description: A description of #GstEncodingTarget in the current locale.

function.return: The newly created #GstEncodingTarget or %NULL if there was an error.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_save
function.description: Saves the @target to a default user-local directory.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: %TRUE if the target was correctly saved, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_target_save_to_file
function.description: Saves the @target to the provided file location.

parameter.name: filepath
parameter.parameter_description: the location to store the @target at.

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: If an error occured, this field will be filled in.

function.return: %TRUE if the target was correctly saved, else %FALSE.

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_get_pass
function.return: The pass number if this is part of a multi-pass profile. Starts at 1 for multi-pass. 0 if this is not a multi-pass profile

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_get_variableframerate
function.return: Whether non-constant video framerate is allowed for encoding.

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstEncodingVideoProfile
All provided allocatable arguments will be internally copied, so can be safely freed/unreferenced after calling this method.
If you wish to control the pass number (in case of multi-pass scenarios), please refer to the gst_encoding_video_profile_set_pass() documentation.
If you wish to use/force a constant framerate please refer to the gst_encoding_video_profile_set_variableframerate() documentation.

parameter.name: preset
parameter.parameter_description: the preset(s) to use on the encoder, can be #NULL

parameter.name: restriction
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstCaps used to restrict the input to the encoder, can be NULL. See gst_encoding_profile_get_restriction() for more details.

parameter.name: presence
parameter.parameter_description: the number of time this stream must be used. 0 means any number of times (including never)

function.return: the newly created #GstEncodingVideoProfile.

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_set_pass
function.description: Sets the pass number of this video profile. The first pass profile should have this value set to 1. If this video profile isn't part of a multi-pass profile, you may set it to 0 (the default value).

parameter.name: pass
parameter.parameter_description: the pass number for this profile

function.name: gst_encoding_video_profile_set_variableframerate
function.description: If set to %TRUE, then the incoming streamm will be allowed to have non-constant framerate. If set to %FALSE (default value), then the incoming stream will be normalized by dropping/duplicating frames in order to produce a constance framerate.

function.name: gst_error_get_message
function.description: Get a string describing the error message in the current locale.

parameter.name: domain
parameter.parameter_description: the GStreamer error domain this error belongs to.

parameter.name: code
parameter.parameter_description: the error code belonging to the domain.

function.return: a newly allocated string describing the error message (in UTF-8 encoding)

function.name: gst_event_get_seqnum
function.description:
Retrieve the sequence number of a event.
Events have ever-incrementing sequence numbers, which may also be set explicitly via gst_event_set_seqnum(). Sequence numbers are typically used to indicate that a event corresponds to some other set of events or messages, for example an EOS event corresponding to a SEEK event. It is considered good practice to make this correspondence when possible, though it is not required.
Note that events and messages share the same sequence number incrementor; two events or messages will never not have the same sequence number unless that correspondence was made explicitly.
function.return:
The event's sequence number.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_get_structure
function.description: Access the structure of the event.
function.return:
The structure of the event. The structure is still owned by the event, which means that you should not free it and that the pointer becomes invalid when you free the event.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_has_name
function.description: Checks if @event has the given @name. This function is usually used to check the name of a custom event.
function.return: %TRUE if @name matches the name of the event structure.

function.name: gst_event_new_buffer_size
function.description:
Create a new buffersize event. The event is sent downstream and notifies elements that they should provide a buffer of the specified dimensions.
When the @async flag is set, a thread boundary is prefered.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_custom
function.description:
Create a new custom-typed event. This can be used for anything not handled by other event-specific functions to pass an event to another element.
Make sure to allocate an event type with the #GST_EVENT_MAKE_TYPE macro, assigning a free number and filling in the correct direction and serialization flags.
New custom events can also be created by subclassing the event type if needed.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: The type of the new event

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: the structure for the event. The event will take ownership of the structure.

function.return: the new custom event.

function.name: gst_event_new_eos
function.description:
Create a new EOS event. The eos event can only travel downstream synchronized with the buffer flow. Elements that receive the EOS event on a pad can return #GST_FLOW_UNEXPECTED as a #GstFlowReturn when data after the EOS event arrives.
The EOS event will travel down to the sink elements in the pipeline which will then post the #GST_MESSAGE_EOS on the bus after they have finished playing any buffered data.
When all sinks have posted an EOS message, an EOS message is forwarded to the application.
The EOS event itself will not cause any state transitions of the pipeline.
function.return: the new EOS event.

function.name: gst_event_new_flush_start
function.description:
Allocate a new flush start event. The flush start event can be sent upstream and downstream and travels out-of-bounds with the dataflow.
It marks pads as being flushing and will make them return #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE when used for data flow with gst_pad_push(), gst_pad_chain(), gst_pad_alloc_buffer(), gst_pad_get_range() and gst_pad_pull_range(). Any event (except a #GST_EVENT_FLUSH_STOP) received on a flushing pad will return %FALSE immediately.
Elements should unlock any blocking functions and exit their streaming functions as fast as possible when this event is received.
This event is typically generated after a seek to flush out all queued data in the pipeline so that the new media is played as soon as possible.
function.return: a new flush start event.

function.name: gst_event_new_flush_stop
function.description:
Allocate a new flush stop event. The flush stop event can be sent upstream and downstream and travels serialized with the dataflow. It is typically sent after sending a FLUSH_START event to make the pads accept data again.
Elements can process this event synchronized with the dataflow since the preceeding FLUSH_START event stopped the dataflow.
This event is typically generated to complete a seek and to resume dataflow.
function.return: a new flush stop event.

function.name: gst_event_new_latency
function.description:
Create a new latency event. The event is sent upstream from the sinks and notifies elements that they should add an additional @latency to the running time before synchronising against the clock.
The latency is mostly used in live sinks and is always expressed in the time format.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_navigation
function.description: Create a new navigation event from the given description.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: description of the event. The event will take ownership of the structure.

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_new_segment
function.description:
Allocate a new newsegment event with the given format/values tripplets
This method calls gst_event_new_new_segment_full() passing a default value of 1.0 for applied_rate

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: is this segment an update to a previous one

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the segment values

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: the start value of the segment

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: the stop value of the segment

function.return: a new newsegment event.

function.name: gst_event_new_new_segment_full
function.description:
Allocate a new newsegment event with the given format/values triplets.
The newsegment event marks the range of buffers to be processed. All data not within the segment range is not to be processed. This can be used intelligently by plugins to apply more efficient methods of skipping unneeded data. The valid range is expressed with the @start and @stop values.
The position value of the segment is used in conjunction with the start value to convert the buffer timestamps into the stream time. This is usually done in sinks to report the current stream_time. @position represents the stream_time of a buffer carrying a timestamp of @start. @position cannot be -1.
@start cannot be -1, @stop can be -1. If there is a valid @stop given, it must be greater or equal the @start, including when the indicated playback @rate is < 0.
The @applied_rate value provides information about any rate adjustment that has already been made to the timestamps and content on the buffers of the stream. (@rate * @applied_rate) should always equal the rate that has been requested for playback. For example, if an element has an input segment with intended playback @rate of 2.0 and applied_rate of 1.0, it can adjust incoming timestamps and buffer content by half and output a newsegment event with @rate of 1.0 and @applied_rate of 2.0
After a newsegment event, the buffer stream time is calculated with:
position + (TIMESTAMP(buf) - start) * ABS (rate * applied_rate)

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: Whether this segment is an update to a previous one

parameter.name: applied_rate
parameter.parameter_description: The rate factor which has already been applied

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the segment values

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: The start value of the segment

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: The stop value of the segment

function.return: a new newsegment event.

function.name: gst_event_new_qos
function.description: Allocate a new qos event with the given values. This function calls gst_event_new_qos_full() with the type set to #GST_QOS_TYPE_OVERFLOW when diff is negative (buffers are in time) and #GST_QOS_TYPE_UNDERFLOW when @diff is positive (buffers are late).

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: the proportion of the qos message

parameter.name: diff
parameter.parameter_description: The time difference of the last Clock sync

function.return: a new QOS event.

function.name: gst_event_new_qos_full

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: the proportion of the qos message

parameter.name: diff
parameter.parameter_description: The time difference of the last Clock sync

function.return: a new QOS event.

function.name: gst_event_new_seek
function.description:
Allocate a new seek event with the given parameters.
The seek event configures playback of the pipeline between @start to @stop at the speed given in @rate, also called a playback segment. The @start and @stop values are expressed in @format.
A @rate of 1.0 means normal playback rate, 2.0 means double speed. Negatives values means backwards playback. A value of 0.0 for the rate is not allowed and should be accomplished instead by PAUSING the pipeline.
A pipeline has a default playback segment configured with a start position of 0, a stop position of -1 and a rate of 1.0. The currently configured playback segment can be queried with #GST_QUERY_SEGMENT.
@start_type and @stop_type specify how to adjust the currently configured start and stop fields in playback segment. Adjustments can be made relative or absolute to the last configured values. A type of #GST_SEEK_TYPE_NONE means that the position should not be updated.
When the rate is positive and @start has been updated, playback will start from the newly configured start position.
For negative rates, playback will start from the newly configured stop position (if any). If the stop position if updated, it must be different from -1 for negative rates.
It is not possible to seek relative to the current playback position, to do this, PAUSE the pipeline, query the current playback position with #GST_QUERY_POSITION and update the playback segment current position with a #GST_SEEK_TYPE_SET to the desired position.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the seek values

parameter.name: start_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new start position

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new start position

parameter.name: stop_type
parameter.parameter_description: The type and flags for the new stop position

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: The value of the new stop position

function.return: a new seek event.

function.name: gst_event_new_sink_message
function.description: Create a new sink-message event. The purpose of the sink-message event is to instruct a sink to post the message contained in the event synchronized with the stream.
function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_step
function.description:
Create a new step event. The purpose of the step event is to instruct a sink to skip @amount (expressed in @format) of media. It can be used to implement stepping through the video frame by frame or for doing fast trick modes.
A rate of <= 0.0 is not allowed, pause the pipeline or reverse the playback direction of the pipeline to get the same effect.
The @flush flag will clear any pending data in the pipeline before starting the step operation.
The @intermediate flag instructs the pipeline that this step operation is part of a larger step operation.

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of data to step

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_new_tag
function.description: Generates a metadata tag event from the given @taglist.

parameter.name: taglist
parameter.parameter_description: metadata list. The event will take ownership of the taglist.

function.return: a new #GstEvent

function.name: gst_event_parse_buffer_size
function.description: Get the format, minsize, maxsize and async-flag in the buffersize event.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the format in

parameter.name: minsize
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the minsize in

parameter.name: maxsize
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the maxsize in

parameter.name: async
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the async-flag in

function.name: gst_event_parse_latency
function.description: Get the latency in the latency event.

parameter.name: latency
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the latency in.

function.name: gst_event_parse_new_segment
function.description: Get the update flag, rate, format, start, stop and position in the newsegment event. In general, gst_event_parse_new_segment_full() should be used instead of this, to also retrieve the applied_rate value of the segment. See gst_event_new_new_segment_full() for a full description of the newsegment event.

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the update flag of the segment

parameter.name: rate
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the rate of the segment

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the format of the newsegment values

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the start value in

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the stop value in

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the stream time in

function.name: gst_event_parse_new_segment_full
function.description: Get the update, rate, applied_rate, format, start, stop and position in the newsegment event. See gst_event_new_new_segment_full() for a full description of the newsegment event.

parameter.name: update
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the update flag of the segment

parameter.name: rate
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the rate of the segment

parameter.name: applied_rate
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the applied_rate of the segment

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to the format of the newsegment values

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the start value in

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the stop value in

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the stream time in

function.name: gst_event_parse_qos
function.description: Get the proportion, diff and timestamp in the qos event. See gst_event_new_qos() for more information about the different QoS values.

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the proportion in

parameter.name: diff
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the diff in

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the timestamp in

function.name: gst_event_parse_qos_full
function.description: Get the type, proportion, diff and timestamp in the qos event. See gst_event_new_qos_full() for more information about the different QoS values.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the QoS type in

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the proportion in

parameter.name: diff
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the diff in

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to store the timestamp in

function.name: gst_event_parse_seek
function.description: Parses a seek @event and stores the results in the given result locations.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the stream format

parameter.name: start_type
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the #GstSeekType of the start position

parameter.name: start

parameter.name: stop_type
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the #GstSeekType of the stop position

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the stop postion expressed in @format

function.name: gst_event_parse_sink_message

parameter.name: msg
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the #GstMessage in.

function.name: gst_event_parse_step
function.description: Parse the step event.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the format in

parameter.name: amount
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the amount in

parameter.name: rate
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the rate in

parameter.name: flush

parameter.name: intermediate
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the intermediate boolean in

function.name: gst_event_parse_tag
function.description: Parses a tag @event and stores the results in the given @taglist location. No reference to the taglist will be returned, it remains valid only until the @event is freed. Don't modify or free the taglist, make a copy if you want to modify it or store it for later use.

function.name: gst_event_set_seqnum
function.description:
Set the sequence number of a event.
This function might be called by the creator of a event to indicate that the event relates to other events or messages. See gst_event_get_seqnum() for more information.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_event_type_get_flags

function.name: gst_fft_f32_new
function.description:
This returns a new #GstFFTF32 instance with the given parameters. It makes sense to keep one instance for several calls for speed reasons.
@len must be even and to get the best performance a product of 2, 3 and 5. To get the next number with this characteristics use gst_fft_next_fast_length().

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: Length of the FFT in the time domain

parameter.name: inverse
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the #GstFFTF32 instance should be used for the inverse FFT

function.return: a new #GstFFTF32 instance.

function.name: gst_fft_f32_window
function.description: This calls the window function @window on the @timedata sample buffer.

function.name: gst_filename_to_uri
function.description:
Similar to g_filename_to_uri(), but attempts to handle relative file paths as well. Before converting @filename into an URI, it will be prefixed by the current working directory if it is a relative path, and then the path will be canonicalised so that it doesn't contain any './' or '../' segments.
On Windows #filename should be in UTF-8 encoding.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: absolute or relative file name path

function.name: gst_filter_run
function.description:
Iterates over the elements in @list, calling @func with the list item data for each item. If @func returns TRUE, @data is prepended to the list of results returned. If @first is true, the search is halted after the first result is found.
Since gst_filter_run() knows nothing about the type of @data, no reference will be taken (if @data refers to an object) and no copy of @data wil be made in any other way when prepending @data to the list of results.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to execute for each item

parameter.name: first
parameter.parameter_description: flag to stop execution after a successful item

function.return: the list of results. Free with g_list_free() when no longer needed (the data contained in the list is a flat copy and does need to be unreferenced or freed).

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_construct
function.description:
Finish initialization of a newly allocated ghost pad.
This function is most useful in language bindings and when subclassing #GstGhostPad; plugin and application developers normally will not call this function. Call this function directly after a call to g_object_new (GST_TYPE_GHOST_PAD, "direction", @dir, ..., NULL).
function.return: %TRUE if the construction succeeds, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_get_target
function.description: Get the target pad of @gpad. Unref target pad after usage.
function.return: the target #GstPad, can be NULL if the ghostpad has no target set. Unref target pad after usage.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_new
function.description:
Create a new ghostpad with @target as the target. The direction will be taken from the target pad. @target must be unlinked.
Will ref the target.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new pad, or NULL to assign a default name

function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_new_from_template
function.description:
Create a new ghostpad with @target as the target. The direction will be taken from the target pad. The template used on the ghostpad will be @template.
Will ref the target.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new pad, or NULL to assign a default name.

parameter.name: templ
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPadTemplate to use on the ghostpad.

function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_new_no_target
function.description:
Create a new ghostpad without a target with the given direction. A target can be set on the ghostpad later with the gst_ghost_pad_set_target() function.
The created ghostpad will not have a padtemplate.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new pad, or NULL to assign a default name.

function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_new_no_target_from_template
function.description: Create a new ghostpad based on @templ, without setting a target. The direction will be taken from the @templ.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new pad, or NULL to assign a default name

parameter.name: templ
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPadTemplate to create the ghostpad from.

function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_ghost_pad_set_target
function.description: Set the new target of the ghostpad @gpad. Any existing target is unlinked and links to the new target are established. if @newtarget is NULL the target will be cleared.
function.return: TRUE if the new target could be set. This function can return FALSE when the internal pads could not be linked.

function.name: gst_index_get_writer_id
function.description:
Before entries can be added to the index, a writer should obtain a unique id. The methods to add new entries to the index require this id as an argument.
The application can implement a custom function to map the writer object to a string. That string will be used to register or look up an id in the index.
<note> The caller must not hold @writer's #GST_OBJECT_LOCK, as the default resolver may call functions that take the object lock as well, and the lock is not recursive. </note>

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the index to get a unique write id for

parameter.name: writer
parameter.parameter_description: the GstObject to allocate an id for

parameter.name: id
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a gint to hold the id

function.return: TRUE if the writer would be mapped to an id.

function.name: gst_init
function.description:
Initializes the GStreamer library, setting up internal path lists, registering built-in elements, and loading standard plugins.
Unless the plugin registry is disabled at compile time, the registry will be loaded. By default this will also check if the registry cache needs to be updated and rescan all plugins if needed. See gst_update_registry() for details and section <link linkend="gst-running">Running GStreamer Applications</link> for how to disable automatic registry updates.
This function should be called before calling any other GLib functions. If this is not an option, your program must initialise the GLib thread system using g_thread_init() before any other GLib functions are called.
<note><para> This function will terminate your program if it was unable to initialize GStreamer for some reason. If you want your program to fall back, use gst_init_check() instead. </para></note>
WARNING: This function does not work in the same way as corresponding functions in other glib-style libraries, such as gtk_init(). In particular, unknown command line options cause this function to abort program execution.

function.name: gst_init_check
function.description:
Initializes the GStreamer library, setting up internal path lists, registering built-in elements, and loading standard plugins.
This function will return %FALSE if GStreamer could not be initialized for some reason. If you want your program to fail fatally, use gst_init() instead.
This function should be called before calling any other GLib functions. If this is not an option, your program must initialise the GLib thread system using g_thread_init() before any other GLib functions are called.

parameter.name: err
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GError to which a message will be posted on error

function.return: %TRUE if GStreamer could be initialized.

function.name: gst_init_get_option_group
function.description:
Returns a #GOptionGroup with GStreamer's argument specifications. The group is set up to use standard GOption callbacks, so when using this group in combination with GOption parsing methods, all argument parsing and initialization is automated.
This function is useful if you want to integrate GStreamer with other libraries that use GOption (see g_option_context_add_group() ).
If you use this function, you should make sure you initialise the GLib threading system as one of the very first things in your program (see the example at the beginning of this section).
function.return: a pointer to GStreamer's option group.

function.name: gst_install_plugins_async
function.description:
Requests plugin installation without blocking. Once the plugins have been installed or installation has failed, @func will be called with the result of the installation and your provided @user_data pointer.
This function requires a running GLib/Gtk main loop. If you are not running a GLib/Gtk main loop, make sure to regularly call g_main_context_iteration(NULL,FALSE).
The installer strings that make up @detail are typically obtained by calling gst_missing_plugin_message_get_installer_detail() on missing-plugin messages that have been caught on a pipeline's bus or created by the application via the provided API, such as gst_missing_element_message_new().
It is possible to request the installation of multiple missing plugins in one go (as might be required if there is a demuxer for a certain format installed but no suitable video decoder and no suitable audio decoder).

parameter.name: details
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of installer string details (see below)

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call when the installer program returns

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the user data to pass to @func when called, or NULL

function.return: result code whether an external installer could be started

function.name: gst_install_plugins_context_free
function.description: Frees a #GstInstallPluginsContext.

function.name: gst_install_plugins_context_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstInstallPluginsContext.
function.return: a new #GstInstallPluginsContext. Free with gst_install_plugins_context_free() when no longer needed

function.name: gst_install_plugins_context_set_xid
function.description:
This function is for X11-based applications (such as most Gtk/Qt applications on linux/unix) only. You can use it to tell the external installer the XID of your main application window. That way the installer can make its own window transient to your application window during the installation.
If set, the XID will be passed to the installer via a --transient-for=XID command line option.
Gtk+/Gnome application should be able to obtain the XID of the top-level window like this: <programlisting> ##include <gtk/gtk.h> ##ifdef GDK_WINDOWING_X11 ##include <gdk/gdkx.h> ##endif ... ##ifdef GDK_WINDOWING_X11 xid = GDK_WINDOW_XWINDOW (GTK_WIDGET (application_window)->window); ##endif ... </programlisting>

parameter.name: xid
parameter.parameter_description: the XWindow ID (XID) of the top-level application

function.name: gst_install_plugins_installation_in_progress
function.description: Checks whether plugin installation (initiated by this application only) is currently in progress.
function.return: TRUE if plugin installation is in progress, otherwise FALSE

function.name: gst_install_plugins_return_get_name
function.description: Convenience function to return the descriptive string associated with a status code. This function returns English strings and should not be used for user messages. It is here only to assist in debugging.
function.return: a descriptive string for the status code in @ret

function.name: gst_install_plugins_supported
function.description: Checks whether plugin installation is likely to be supported by the current environment. This currently only checks whether the helper script that is to be provided by the distribution or operating system vendor exists.
function.return: TRUE if plugin installation is likely to be supported.

function.name: gst_install_plugins_sync
function.description:
Requests plugin installation and block until the plugins have been installed or installation has failed.
This function should almost never be used, it only exists for cases where a non-GLib main loop is running and the user wants to run it in a separate thread and marshal the result back asynchronously into the main thread using the other non-GLib main loop. You should almost always use gst_install_plugins_async() instead of this function.

parameter.name: details
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of installer string details

function.return: the result of the installation.

function.name: gst_iterator_filter
function.description:
Create a new iterator from an existing iterator. The new iterator will only return those elements that match the given compare function @func. @func should return 0 for elements that should be included in the iterator.
When this iterator is freed, @it will also be freed.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the compare function to select elements

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the compare function

function.return:
a new #GstIterator.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_find_custom
function.description:
Find the first element in @it that matches the compare function @func. @func should return 0 when the element is found. As in gst_iterator_fold(), the refcount of a refcounted object will be increased before @func is called, and should be unrefed after use in @func unless it is the matching element.
The iterator will not be freed.
This function will return NULL if an error happened to the iterator.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the compare function

function.return:
The element in the iterator that matches the compare function or NULL when no element matched.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_fold
function.description:
Folds @func over the elements of @iter. That is to say, @func will be called as @func (object, @ret, @user_data) for each object in @it. The normal use of this procedure is to accumulate the results of operating on the objects in @ret. If object is a refcounted object its refcount will be increased before @func is called, and it should be unrefed after use in @func.
This procedure can be used (and is used internally) to implement the gst_iterator_foreach() and gst_iterator_find_custom() operations.
The fold will proceed as long as @func returns TRUE. When the iterator has no more arguments, %GST_ITERATOR_DONE will be returned. If @func returns FALSE, the fold will stop, and %GST_ITERATOR_OK will be returned. Errors or resyncs will cause fold to return %GST_ITERATOR_ERROR or %GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC as appropriate.
The iterator will not be freed.

parameter.name: ret
parameter.parameter_description: the seed value passed to the fold function

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the fold function

function.return:
A #GstIteratorResult, as described above.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_foreach
function.description: Iterate over all element of @it and call the given function @func for each element. As in gst_iterator_fold(), the refcount of a refcounted object will be increased before @func is called, and should be unrefed after use.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to call for each element.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the function

function.return:
the result call to gst_iterator_fold(). The iterator will not be freed.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_free
function.description:
Free the iterator.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_new
function.description:
Create a new iterator. This function is mainly used for objects implementing the next/resync/free function to iterate a data structure.
For each item retrieved, the @item function is called with the lock held. The @free function is called when the iterator is freed.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the iterator structure

parameter.name: master_cookie
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint32 that is changed when the items in the iterator changed.

parameter.name: item
parameter.parameter_description: function to call on each item retrieved

function.return:
the new #GstIterator.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_new_list
function.description:
Create a new iterator designed for iterating @list.
The list you iterate is usually part of a data structure @owner and is protected with @lock.
The iterator will use @lock to retrieve the next item of the list and it will then call the @item function before releasing @lock again.
The @item function usualy makes sure that the item remains alive while @lock is released and the application is using the item. The application is responsible for freeing/unreffing the item after usage as explained in gst_iterator_next().
When a concurrent update to the list is performed, usually by @owner while holding @lock, @master_cookie will be updated. The iterator implementation will notice the update of the cookie and will return %GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC to the user of the iterator in the next call to gst_iterator_next().
@owner will be passed to the @free function when the iterator is freed.

parameter.name: lock
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GMutex protecting the list.

parameter.name: master_cookie
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint32 that is incremented when the list is changed.

parameter.name: item
parameter.parameter_description: function to call for each item

parameter.name: free
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the iterator is freed

function.return:
the new #GstIterator for @list.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_new_single
function.description: This #GstIterator is a convenient iterator for the common case where a #GstIterator needs to be returned but only a single object has to be considered. This happens often for the #GstPadIterIntLinkFunction.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: object that this iterator should return

parameter.name: copy
parameter.parameter_description: Function that returns a copy of @object or increases its refcount

parameter.name: free
parameter.parameter_description: Function to be called for freeing @object

function.return: the new #GstIterator for @object.

function.name: gst_iterator_next
function.description:
Get the next item from the iterator in @elem.
Only when this function returns %GST_ITERATOR_OK, @elem will contain a valid value. For iterators that return refcounted objects, the returned object will have its refcount increased and should therefore be unreffed after usage.
When this function returns %GST_ITERATOR_DONE, no more elements can be retrieved from @it.
A return value of %GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC indicates that the element list was concurrently updated. The user of @it should call gst_iterator_resync() to get the newly updated list.
A return value of %GST_ITERATOR_ERROR indicates an unrecoverable fatal error.
function.return:
The result of the iteration. Unref @elem after usage if this is a refcounted object.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_push
function.description:
Pushes @other iterator onto @it. All calls performed on @it are forwarded to @other. If @other returns %GST_ITERATOR_DONE, it is popped again and calls are handled by @it again.
This function is mainly used by objects implementing the iterator next function to recurse into substructures.
When gst_iterator_resync() is called on @it, @other will automatically be popped.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_iterator_resync
function.description:
Resync the iterator. this function is mostly called after gst_iterator_next() returned %GST_ITERATOR_RESYNC.
When an iterator was pushed on @it, it will automatically be popped again with this function.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_lfo_control_source_new
function.description: This returns a new, unbound #GstLFOControlSource.
function.return: a new, unbound #GstLFOControlSource.

function.name: gst_message_get_seqnum
function.description:
Retrieve the sequence number of a message.
Messages have ever-incrementing sequence numbers, which may also be set explicitly via gst_message_set_seqnum(). Sequence numbers are typically used to indicate that a message corresponds to some other set of messages or events, for example a SEGMENT_DONE message corresponding to a SEEK event. It is considered good practice to make this correspondence when possible, though it is not required.
Note that events and messages share the same sequence number incrementor; two events or messages will never not have the same sequence number unless that correspondence was made explicitly.
function.return:
The message's sequence number.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_get_stream_status_object
function.description: Extracts the object managing the streaming thread from @message.
function.return: a GValue containing the object that manages the streaming thread. This object is usually of type GstTask but other types can be added in the future. The object remains valid as long as @message is valid.

function.name: gst_message_get_structure
function.description: Access the structure of the message.
function.return:
The structure of the message. The structure is still owned by the message, which means that you should not free it and that the pointer becomes invalid when you free the message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_application
function.description: Create a new application-typed message. GStreamer will never create these messages; they are a gift from us to you. Enjoy.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: the structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure.

function.return:
The new application message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_async_done
function.description: The message is posted when elements completed an ASYNC state change.
function.return:
The new async_done message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_async_start

parameter.name: new_base_time
parameter.parameter_description: if a new base_time should be set on the element

function.return:
The new async_start message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_buffering
function.description:
Create a new buffering message. This message can be posted by an element that needs to buffer data before it can continue processing. @percent should be a value between 0 and 100. A value of 100 means that the buffering completed.
When @percent is < 100 the application should PAUSE a PLAYING pipeline. When @percent is 100, the application can set the pipeline (back) to PLAYING. The application must be prepared to receive BUFFERING messages in the PREROLLING state and may only set the pipeline to PLAYING after receiving a message with @percent set to 100, which can happen after the pipeline completed prerolling.
MT safe.
function.return: The new buffering message.

function.name: gst_message_new_clock_lost
function.description:
Create a clock lost message. This message is posted whenever the clock is not valid anymore.
If this message is posted by the pipeline, the pipeline will select a new clock again when it goes to PLAYING. It might therefore be needed to set the pipeline to PAUSED and PLAYING again.
function.return:
The new clock lost message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_clock_provide
function.description:
Create a clock provide message. This message is posted whenever an element is ready to provide a clock or lost its ability to provide a clock (maybe because it paused or became EOS).
This message is mainly used internally to manage the clock selection.

parameter.name: ready
parameter.parameter_description: TRUE if the sender can provide a clock

function.return:
the new provide clock message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_custom
function.description: Create a new custom-typed message. This can be used for anything not handled by other message-specific functions to pass a message to the app. The structure field can be NULL.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: the structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure.

function.return:
The new message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_duration
function.description: Create a new duration message. This message is posted by elements that know the duration of a stream in a specific format. This message is received by bins and is used to calculate the total duration of a pipeline. Elements may post a duration message with a duration of GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE to indicate that the duration has changed and the cached duration should be discarded. The new duration can then be retrieved via a query.
function.return:
The new duration message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_element
function.description: Create a new element-specific message. This is meant as a generic way of allowing one-way communication from an element to an application, for example "the firewire cable was unplugged". The format of the message should be documented in the element's documentation. The structure field can be NULL.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: The structure for the message. The message will take ownership of the structure.

function.return:
The new element message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_eos
function.description: Create a new eos message. This message is generated and posted in the sink elements of a GstBin. The bin will only forward the EOS message to the application if all sinks have posted an EOS message.
function.return:
The new eos message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_error
function.description: Create a new error message. The message will copy @error and @debug. This message is posted by element when a fatal event occured. The pipeline will probably (partially) stop. The application receiving this message should stop the pipeline.
function.return:
the new error message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_info
function.return: the new info message.

function.name: gst_message_new_latency
function.description: This message can be posted by elements when their latency requirements have changed.
function.return:
The new latency message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_new_clock
function.description: Create a new clock message. This message is posted whenever the pipeline selectes a new clock for the pipeline.
function.return:
The new new clock message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_progress

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: free, user visible text describing the progress

function.return: The new qos message.

function.name: gst_message_new_qos

parameter.name: live
parameter.parameter_description: if the message was generated by a live element

parameter.name: running_time
parameter.parameter_description: the running time of the buffer that generated the message

parameter.name: stream_time
parameter.parameter_description: the stream time of the buffer that generated the message

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamps of the buffer that generated the message

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: the duration of the buffer that generated the message

function.return:
The new qos message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_request_state
function.description: This message can be posted by elements when they want to have their state changed. A typical use case would be an audio server that wants to pause the pipeline because a higher priority stream is being played.
function.return:
the new requst state message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_segment_done
function.description: Create a new segment done message. This message is posted by elements that finish playback of a segment as a result of a segment seek. This message is received by the application after all elements that posted a segment_start have posted the segment_done.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the position being done

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The position of the segment being done

function.return:
the new segment done message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_segment_start
function.description: Create a new segment message. This message is posted by elements that start playback of a segment as a result of a segment seek. This message is not received by the application but is used for maintenance reasons in container elements.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: The format of the position being played

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The position of the segment being played

function.return:
the new segment start message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_state_changed
function.description: Create a state change message. This message is posted whenever an element changed its state.
function.return:
the new state change message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_state_dirty
function.description: Create a state dirty message. This message is posted whenever an element changed its state asynchronously and is used internally to update the states of container objects.
function.return:
the new state dirty message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_step_done

parameter.name: rate
parameter.parameter_description: the rate of the stepped amount

function.return:
the new step_done message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_step_start

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: if the step is active or queued

parameter.name: rate
parameter.parameter_description: the rate of the stepped amount

function.return:
The new step_start message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_stream_status
function.description: Create a new stream status message. This message is posted when a streaming thread is created/destroyed or when the state changed.
function.return:
the new stream status message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_structure_change
function.description:
Create a new structure change message. This message is posted when the structure of a pipeline is in the process of being changed, for example when pads are linked or unlinked.
@src should be the sinkpad that unlinked or linked.

parameter.name: busy
parameter.parameter_description: Whether the structure change is busy.

function.return:
the new structure change message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_tag
function.description: Create a new tag message. The message will take ownership of the tag list. The message is posted by elements that discovered a new taglist.

parameter.name: tag_list
parameter.parameter_description: the tag list for the message.

function.return:
the new tag message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_new_tag_full
function.description:
Create a new tag message. The message will take ownership of the tag list. The message is posted by elements that discovered a new taglist.
MT safe.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the originating pad for the tag.

parameter.name: tag_list
parameter.parameter_description: the tag list for the message.

function.return: the new tag message.

function.name: gst_message_new_warning
function.description: Create a new warning message. The message will make copies of @error and @debug.
function.return:
The new warning message.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_parse_async_start
function.description:
Extract the new_base_time from the async_start message.
MT safe.

parameter.name: new_base_time
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the new_base_time or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_buffering
function.description:
Extracts the buffering percent from the GstMessage. see also gst_message_new_buffering().
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_parse_buffering_stats
function.description: Extracts the buffering stats values from @message.

parameter.name: avg_in
parameter.parameter_description: the average input rate, or NULL

parameter.name: avg_out
parameter.parameter_description: the average output rate, or NULL

parameter.name: buffering_left
parameter.parameter_description: amount of buffering time left in milliseconds, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_clock_lost
function.description:
Extracts the lost clock from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the lost clock

function.name: gst_message_parse_clock_provide
function.description:
Extracts the clock and ready flag from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold a clock object, or NULL

parameter.name: ready
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the ready flag, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_duration
function.description:
Extracts the duration and format from the duration message. The duration might be GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE, which indicates that the duration has changed. Applications should always use a query to retrieve the duration of a pipeline.
MT safe.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the format, or NULL

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the duration, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_error

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: location for the debug message, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_info
function.description:
Extracts the GError and debug string from the GstMessage. The values returned in the output arguments are copies; the caller must free them when done.
MT safe.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: location for the debug message, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_new_clock
function.description:
Extracts the new clock from the GstMessage. The clock object returned remains valid until the message is freed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the selected new clock

function.name: gst_message_parse_progress
function.description: Parses the progress @type, @code and @text.

function.name: gst_message_parse_qos
function.description:
Extract the timestamps and live status from the QoS message.
The returned values give the running_time, stream_time, timestamp and duration of the dropped buffer. Values of GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE mean unknown values.
MT safe.

parameter.name: live
parameter.parameter_description: if the message was generated by a live element

parameter.name: running_time
parameter.parameter_description: the running time of the buffer that generated the message

parameter.name: stream_time
parameter.parameter_description: the stream time of the buffer that generated the message

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the timestamps of the buffer that generated the message

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: the duration of the buffer that generated the message

function.name: gst_message_parse_qos_stats
function.description:
Extract the QoS stats representing the history of the current continuous pipeline playback period.
When @format is @GST_FORMAT_UNDEFINED both @dropped and @processed are invalid. Values of -1 for either @processed or @dropped mean unknown values.
MT safe.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Units of the 'processed' and 'dropped' fields. Video sinks and video filters will use GST_FORMAT_BUFFERS (frames). Audio sinks and audio filters will likely use GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT (samples).

parameter.name: processed
parameter.parameter_description: Total number of units correctly processed since the last state change to READY or a flushing operation.

parameter.name: dropped
parameter.parameter_description: Total number of units dropped since the last state change to READY or a flushing operation.

function.name: gst_message_parse_qos_values
function.description:
Extract the QoS values that have been calculated/analysed from the QoS data
MT safe.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: The difference of the running-time against the deadline.

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: Long term prediction of the ideal rate relative to normal rate to get optimal quality.

parameter.name: quality
parameter.parameter_description: An element dependent integer value that specifies the current quality level of the element. The default maximum quality is 1000000.

function.name: gst_message_parse_request_state
function.description:
Extract the requested state from the request_state message.
MT safe.

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the requested state or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_segment_done
function.description:
Extracts the position and format from the segment start message.
MT safe.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the format, or NULL

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the position, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_segment_start
function.description:
Extracts the position and format from the segment start message.
MT safe.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the format, or NULL

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: Result location for the position, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_parse_state_changed
gst_message_parse_step_done
function.description:
Extract the values the step_done message.
MT safe.

parameter.name: flush
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the flush flag

parameter.name: intermediate
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the intermediate flag

parameter.name: eos
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the EOS flag

function.name: gst_message_parse_step_start
function.description:
Extract the values from step_start message.
MT safe.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the active flag

parameter.name: flush
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the flush flag

parameter.name: intermediate
parameter.parameter_description: result location for the intermediate flag

function.name: gst_message_parse_stream_status
function.description:
Extracts the stream status type and owner the GstMessage. The returned owner remains valid for as long as the reference to @message is valid and should thus not be unreffed.
MT safe.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to hold the status type

parameter.name: owner
parameter.parameter_description: The owner element of the message source

function.name: gst_message_parse_structure_change
function.description:
Extracts the change type and completion status from the GstMessage.
MT safe.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to hold the change type

parameter.name: owner
parameter.parameter_description: The owner element of the message source

parameter.name: busy
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold whether the change is in progress or has been completed

function.name: gst_message_parse_tag
gst_message_parse_tag_full
function.description:
Extracts the tag list from the GstMessage. The tag list returned in the output argument is a copy; the caller must free it when done.
MT safe.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: location where the originating pad is stored, unref after usage

function.name: gst_message_parse_warning
function.description:
Extracts the GError and debug string from the GstMessage. The values returned in the output arguments are copies; the caller must free them when done.
MT safe.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: location for the debug message, or NULL

function.name: gst_message_set_buffering_stats
function.description: Configures the buffering stats values in @message.

parameter.name: buffering_left
parameter.parameter_description: amount of buffering time left in milliseconds

function.name: gst_message_set_qos_stats
function.description:
Set the QoS stats representing the history of the current continuous pipeline playback period.
When @format is @GST_FORMAT_UNDEFINED both @dropped and @processed are invalid. Values of -1 for either @processed or @dropped mean unknown values.
MT safe.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: Units of the 'processed' and 'dropped' fields. Video sinks and video filters will use GST_FORMAT_BUFFERS (frames). Audio sinks and audio filters will likely use GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT (samples).

parameter.name: processed
parameter.parameter_description: Total number of units correctly processed since the last state change to READY or a flushing operation.

parameter.name: dropped
parameter.parameter_description: Total number of units dropped since the last state change to READY or a flushing operation.

function.name: gst_message_set_qos_values
function.description:
Set the QoS values that have been calculated/analysed from the QoS data
MT safe.

parameter.name: jitter
parameter.parameter_description: The difference of the running-time against the deadline.

parameter.name: proportion
parameter.parameter_description: Long term prediction of the ideal rate relative to normal rate to get optimal quality.

parameter.name: quality
parameter.parameter_description: An element dependent integer value that specifies the current quality level of the element. The default maximum quality is 1000000.

function.name: gst_message_set_seqnum
function.description:
Set the sequence number of a message.
This function might be called by the creator of a message to indicate that the message relates to other messages or events. See gst_message_get_seqnum() for more information.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_message_set_stream_status_object
function.description: Configures the object handling the streaming thread. This is usually a GstTask object but other objects might be added in the future.

function.name: gst_message_type_get_name
function.description: Get a printable name for the given message type. Do not modify or free.
function.return: a reference to the static name of the message.

function.name: gst_message_type_to_quark
function.description: Get the unique quark for the given message type.
function.return: the quark associated with the message type

function.name: gst_mini_object_copy
function.description:
Creates a copy of the mini-object.
MT safe
function.return: the new mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_is_writable
function.description:
Checks if a mini-object is writable. A mini-object is writable if the reference count is one and the #GST_MINI_OBJECT_FLAG_READONLY flag is not set. Modification of a mini-object should only be done after verifying that it is writable.
MT safe
function.return: TRUE if the object is writable.

function.name: gst_mini_object_make_writable
function.description:
Checks if a mini-object is writable. If not, a writable copy is made and returned. This gives away the reference to the original mini object, and returns a reference to the new object.
MT safe
function.return: a mini-object (possibly the same pointer) that is writable.

function.name: gst_mini_object_new
function.description:
Creates a new mini-object of the desired type.
MT safe

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the #GType of the mini-object to create

function.return: the new mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_ref
function.description:
Increase the reference count of the mini-object.
Note that the refcount affects the writeability of @mini-object, see gst_mini_object_is_writable(). It is important to note that keeping additional references to GstMiniObject instances can potentially increase the number of memcpy operations in a pipeline, especially if the miniobject is a #GstBuffer.
function.return: the mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_replace
function.description: Modifies a pointer to point to a new mini-object. The modification is done atomically, and the reference counts are updated correctly. Either @newdata and the value pointed to by @olddata may be NULL.

parameter.name: olddata
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a pointer to a mini-object to be replaced

function.name: gst_mini_object_unref
function.description: Decreases the reference count of the mini-object, possibly freeing the mini-object.

function.name: gst_mini_object_weak_ref
function.description: Adds a weak reference callback to a mini object. Weak references are used for notification when a mini object is finalized. They are called "weak references" because they allow you to safely hold a pointer to the mini object without calling gst_mini_object_ref() (gst_mini_object_ref() adds a strong reference, that is, forces the object to stay alive).

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: callback to invoke before the mini object is freed

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: extra data to pass to notify

function.name: gst_mini_object_weak_unref
function.description: Removes a weak reference callback to a mini object.

parameter.name: mini_object
parameter.parameter_description: #GstMiniObject to remove a weak reference from

function.name: gst_missing_decoder_installer_detail_new
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

parameter.name: decode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which a decoder element is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_decoder_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a decoder element for a particular set of (fixed) caps is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: decode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which a decoder element is needed

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_missing_element_installer_detail_new
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

parameter.name: factory_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the missing element (element factory), e.g. "videoscale" or "cdparanoiasrc"

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_element_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a certain required element is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: factory_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the missing element (element factory), e.g. "videoscale" or "cdparanoiasrc"

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_missing_encoder_installer_detail_new
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

parameter.name: encode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which an encoder element is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_encoder_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that an encoder element for a particular set of (fixed) caps is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: encode_caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) caps for which an encoder element is needed

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description
function.description:
Returns a localised string describing the missing feature, for use in error dialogs and the like. Should never return NULL unless @msg is not a valid missing-plugin message.
This function is mainly for applications that need a human-readable string describing a missing plugin, given a previously collected missing-plugin message
function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_plugin_message_get_installer_detail
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions.
function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_uri_sink_installer_detail_new
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the URI protocol the missing source needs to implement, e.g. "http" or "mms"

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_uri_sink_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a sink element for a particular URI protocol is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the URI protocol the missing sink needs to implement, e.g. "http" or "smb"

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_missing_uri_source_installer_detail_new
function.description:
Returns an opaque string containing all the details about the missing element to be passed to an external installer called via gst_install_plugins_async() or gst_install_plugins_sync().
This function is mainly for applications that call external plugin installation mechanisms using one of the two above-mentioned functions in the case where the application knows exactly what kind of plugin it is missing.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the URI protocol the missing source needs to implement, e.g. "http" or "mms"

function.return: a newly-allocated detail string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_missing_uri_source_message_new
function.description: Creates a missing-plugin message for @element to notify the application that a source element for a particular URI protocol is missing. This function is mainly for use in plugins.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the URI protocol the missing source needs to implement, e.g. "http" or "mms"

function.return: a new #GstMessage, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_mixer_get_mixer_flags
function.description: Get the set of supported flags for this mixer implementation.
function.return: A set of or-ed GstMixerFlags for supported features.

function.name: gst_mixer_get_mixer_type
function.description: Get the #GstMixerType of this mixer implementation.
function.return: A the #GstMixerType.

function.name: gst_mixer_get_option
function.description: Get the current value of a name/value option in the mixer.
function.return: current value of the name/value option.

function.name: gst_mixer_get_volume
