function.description: Get the current volume(s) on the given track.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerTrack to get the volume from.

parameter.name: volumes
parameter.parameter_description: a pre-allocated array of integers (of size track->num_channels) to store the current volume of each channel in the given track in.

function.name: gst_mixer_list_tracks
function.description: Returns a list of available tracks for this mixer/element. Note that it is allowed for sink (output) elements to only provide the output tracks in this list. Likewise, for sources (inputs), it is allowed to only provide input elements in this list.

parameter.name: mixer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstMixer (a #GstElement) to get the tracks from.

function.return: A #GList consisting of zero or more #GstMixerTracks. The list is owned by the #GstMixer instance and must not be freed or modified.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_get_type
function.description: Check a bus message to see if it is a GstMixer notification message and return the GstMixerMessageType identifying which type of notification it is.
function.return: The type of the GstMixerMessage, or GST_MIXER_MESSAGE_INVALID if the message is not a GstMixer notification.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_mute_toggled
function.description:
Extracts the contents of a mute-toggled bus message. Reads the GstMixerTrack that has changed, and the new value of the mute flag.
The GstMixerTrack remains valid until the message is freed.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerTrack object, or NULL.

parameter.name: mute
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a gboolean variable, or NULL.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_option_changed
function.description:
Extracts the GstMixerOptions and new value from a option-changed bus notification message.
The options and value returned remain valid until the message is freed.

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerOptions object, or NULL.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Result location to receive the new options value, or NULL.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_options_list_changed
function.description:
Extracts the GstMixerOptions whose value list has changed from an options-list-changed bus notification message.
The options object returned remains valid until the message is freed. You do not need to unref it.

parameter.name: options
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerOptions object, or NULL.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_record_toggled
function.description:
Extracts the contents of a record-toggled bus message. Reads the GstMixerTrack that has changed, and the new value of the recording flag.
The GstMixerTrack remains valid until the message is freed.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerTrack object, or NULL.

parameter.name: record
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a gboolean variable, or NULL.

function.name: gst_mixer_message_parse_volume_changed
function.description:
Parses a volume-changed notification message and extracts the track object it refers to, as well as an array of volumes and the size of the volumes array.
The track object remains valid until the message is freed.
The caller must free the array returned in the volumes parameter using g_free when they are done with it.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to hold a GstMixerTrack object, or NULL.

parameter.name: volumes
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to receive an array of gint values, or NULL.

parameter.name: num_channels
parameter.parameter_description: Result location to receive the number of channels, or NULL.

function.name: gst_mixer_mixer_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the list of available mixer tracks for a given mixer object has changed. Applications should rebuild their interface when they receive this message.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

function.name: gst_mixer_mute_toggled
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the given track has changed mute state.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerTrack that has change mute state.

parameter.name: mute
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the mute flag on the track

function.name: gst_mixer_option_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the given options object has changed state.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: opts
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerOptions that has changed value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value of the GstMixerOptions.

function.name: gst_mixer_options_get_values
function.description: Get the values for the mixer option.

parameter.name: mixer_options
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstMixerOptions item that owns the values.

function.return: A list of strings with all the possible values for the mixer option. You must not free or modify the list or its contents, it belongs to the @mixer_options object.

function.name: gst_mixer_options_list_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the list of possible options of a given options object has changed.
The new options are not contained in the message on purpose. Applications should call gst_mixer_option_get_values() on @opts to make @opts update its internal state and obtain the new list of values.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus for this to work.

parameter.name: opts
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerOptions whose list of values has changed

function.name: gst_mixer_record_toggled
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the given track has changed recording state.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: the GstMixerTrack that has changed recording state.

parameter.name: record
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the record flag on the track

function.name: gst_mixer_set_mute
function.description: Mutes or unmutes the given channel. To find out whether a track is currently muted, use GST_MIXER_TRACK_HAS_FLAG ().

parameter.name: mute
parameter.parameter_description: a boolean value indicating whether to turn on or off muting.

function.name: gst_mixer_set_option
function.description: Sets a name/value option in the mixer to the requested value.

function.name: gst_mixer_set_record
function.description: Enables or disables recording on the given track. Note that this is only possible on input tracks, not on output tracks (see GST_MIXER_TRACK_HAS_FLAG () and the GST_MIXER_TRACK_INPUT flag).

parameter.name: record
parameter.parameter_description: a boolean value that indicates whether to turn on or off recording.

function.name: gst_mixer_set_volume
function.description: Sets the volume on each channel in a track. Short note about naming: a track is defined as one separate stream owned by the mixer/element, such as 'Line-in' or 'Microphone'. A channel is said to be a mono-stream inside this track. A stereo track thus contains two channels.

parameter.name: track
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstMixerTrack to set the volume on.

parameter.name: volumes
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers (of size track->num_channels) that gives the wanted volume for each channel in this track.

function.name: gst_mixer_volume_changed
function.description:
This function is called by the mixer implementation to produce a notification message on the bus indicating that the volume(s) for the given track have changed.
This function only works for GstElements that are implementing the GstMixer interface, and the element needs to have been provided a bus.

parameter.name: volumes
parameter.parameter_description: Array of volume values, one per channel on the mixer track.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_get_type
function.description: Inspect a #GstEvent and return the #GstNavigationEventType of the event, or #GST_NAVIGATION_EVENT_INVALID if the event is not a #GstNavigation event.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_parse_command
function.description: Inspect a #GstNavigation command event and retrieve the enum value of the associated command.

parameter.name: command
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to GstNavigationCommand to receive the type of the navigation event.

function.return: TRUE if the navigation command could be extracted, otherwise FALSE.

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a location to receive the string identifying the key press. The returned string is owned by the event, and valid only until the event is unreffed.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_button_event
function.description: Retrieve the details of either a #GstNavigation mouse button press event or a mouse button release event. Determine which type the event is using gst_navigation_event_get_type() to retrieve the #GstNavigationEventType.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gint that will receive the button number associated with the event.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gdouble to receive the x coordinate of the mouse button event.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gdouble to receive the y coordinate of the mouse button event.

function.return: TRUE if the button number and both coordinates could be extracted, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_navigation_event_parse_mouse_move_event
function.description: Inspect a #GstNavigation mouse movement event and extract the coordinates of the event.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gdouble to receive the x coordinate of the mouse movement.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a gdouble to receive the y coordinate of the mouse movement.

function.return: TRUE if both coordinates could be extracted, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_get_type
function.description: Check a bus message to see if it is a #GstNavigation event, and return the #GstNavigationMessageType identifying the type of the message if so.
function.return: The type of the #GstNavigationMessage, or #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_INVALID if the message is not a #GstNavigation notification.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_angles_changed
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_ANGLES_CHANGED for notifying an application that the current angle, or current number of angles available in a multiangle video has changed.

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: The number of viewing angles now available.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_commands_changed
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_COMMANDS_CHANGED

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_new_mouse_over
function.description: Creates a new #GstNavigation message with type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_MOUSE_OVER.

parameter.name: src
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject to set as source of the new message.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the mouse has entered a clickable area of the display. %FALSE if it over a non-clickable area.

function.return: The new #GstMessage.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_parse_angles_changed
function.description: Parse a #GstNavigation message of type GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_ANGLES_CHANGED and extract the @cur_angle and @n_angles parameters.

parameter.name: cur_angle
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #guint to receive the new current angle number, or NULL

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #guint to receive the new angle count, or NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the message could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_message_parse_mouse_over
function.description: Parse a #GstNavigation message of type #GST_NAVIGATION_MESSAGE_MOUSE_OVER and extract the active/inactive flag. If the mouse over event is marked active, it indicates that the mouse is over a clickable area.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a gboolean to receive the active/inactive state, or NULL.

function.return: %TRUE if the message could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_get_type
function.description: Inspect a #GstQuery and return the #GstNavigationQueryType associated with it if it is a #GstNavigation query.
function.return: The #GstNavigationQueryType of the query, or #GST_NAVIGATION_QUERY_INVALID

function.name: gst_navigation_query_new_angles
function.description: Create a new #GstNavigation angles query. When executed, it will query the pipeline for the set of currently available angles, which may be greater than one in a multiangle video.
function.return: The new query.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_new_commands
function.description: Create a new #GstNavigation commands query. When executed, it will query the pipeline for the set of currently available commands.
function.return: The new query.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_parse_angles
function.description: Parse the current angle number in the #GstNavigation angles @query into the #guint pointed to by the @cur_angle variable, and the number of available angles into the #guint pointed to by the @n_angles variable.

parameter.name: cur_angle
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint into which to store the currently selected angle value from the query, or NULL

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to a #guint into which to store the number of angles value from the query, or NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_parse_commands_length
function.description: Parse the number of commands in the #GstNavigation commands @query.

parameter.name: n_cmds
parameter.parameter_description: the number of commands in this query.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_parse_commands_nth
function.description: Parse the #GstNavigation command query and retrieve the @nth command from it into @cmd. If the list contains less elements than @nth, @cmd will be set to #GST_NAVIGATION_COMMAND_INVALID.

parameter.name: cmd
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to store the nth command into.

function.return: %TRUE if the query could be successfully parsed. %FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_set_angles
function.description: Set the #GstNavigation angles query result field in @query.

parameter.name: cur_angle
parameter.parameter_description: the current viewing angle to set.

parameter.name: n_angles
parameter.parameter_description: the number of viewing angles to set.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_set_commands
function.description: Set the #GstNavigation command query result fields in @query. The number of commands passed must be equal to @n_commands.

parameter.name: n_cmds
parameter.parameter_description: the number of commands to set.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: A list of @GstNavigationCommand values, @n_cmds entries long.

function.name: gst_navigation_query_set_commandsv
function.description: Set the #GstNavigation command query result fields in @query. The number of commands passed must be equal to @n_commands.

parameter.name: n_cmds
parameter.parameter_description: the number of commands to set.

function.name: gst_navigation_send_command
function.description: Sends the indicated command to the navigation interface.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: The type of the key event. Recognised values are "key-press" and "key-release"

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: Character representation of the key. This is typically as produced by XKeysymToString.

function.name: gst_navigation_send_mouse_event
function.description: Sends a mouse event to the navigation interface. Mouse event coordinates are sent relative to the display space of the related output area. This is usually the size in pixels of the window associated with the element implementing the #GstNavigation interface.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: The type of mouse event, as a text string. Recognised values are "mouse-button-press", "mouse-button-release" and "mouse-move".

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: The button number of the button being pressed or released. Pass 0 for mouse-move events.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The x coordinate of the mouse event.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The y coordinate of the mouse event.

function.name: gst_net_client_clock_new

parameter.name: remote_address
parameter.parameter_description: the address of the remote clock provider

parameter.name: remote_port
parameter.parameter_description: the port of the remote clock provider

function.return: a new #GstClock that receives a time from the remote clock.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstNetTimePacket from a buffer received over the network. The caller is responsible for ensuring that @buffer is at least #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes long.
If @buffer is #NULL, the local and remote times will be set to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (g_free to free).

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a buffer from which to construct the packet, or NULL

function.return: The new #GstNetTimePacket.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_receive
function.description:
Receives a #GstNetTimePacket over a socket. Handles interrupted system calls, but otherwise returns NULL on error. See recvfrom(2) for more information on how to interpret @sockaddr.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (g_free to free).

parameter.name: fd
parameter.parameter_description: a file descriptor created by socket(2)

parameter.name: addr
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a sockaddr to hold the address of the sender

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the size of the data pointed to by @addr

function.return: The new #GstNetTimePacket.

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_send
function.description:
Sends a #GstNetTimePacket over a socket. Essentially a thin wrapper around sendto(2) and gst_net_time_packet_serialize().
MT safe.

parameter.name: fd
parameter.parameter_description: a file descriptor created by socket(2)

parameter.name: addr
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a sockaddr to hold the address of the sender

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the data pointed to by @addr

function.return: The return value of sendto(2).

function.name: gst_net_time_packet_serialize
function.description:
Serialized a #GstNetTimePacket into a newly-allocated sequence of #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes, in network byte order. The value returned is suitable for passing to write(2) or sendto(2) for communication over the network.
MT safe. Caller owns return value (g_free to free).
function.return: A newly allocated sequence of #GST_NET_TIME_PACKET_SIZE bytes.

function.name: gst_net_time_provider_new
function.description: Allows network clients to get the current time of @clock.

parameter.name: clock
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstClock to export over the network

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: an address to bind on as a dotted quad (xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx), or NULL to bind to all addresses

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a port to bind on, or 0 to let the kernel choose

function.return: the new #GstNetTimeProvider, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_netaddress_equal
function.description: Compare two #GstNetAddress structures
function.return: TRUE if they are identical, FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_netaddress_get_address_bytes
function.description:
Get just the address bytes stored in @naddr into @address.
Note that @port is expressed in network byte order, use g_ntohs() to convert it to host order. IP4 addresses are also stored in network byte order.

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the result.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the port.

function.return: number of bytes actually copied

function.name: gst_netaddress_get_ip4_address
function.description:
Get the IPv4 address stored in @naddr into @address. This function requires that the address type of @naddr is of type #GST_NET_TYPE_IP4.
Note that @port and @address are expressed in network byte order, use g_ntohs() and g_ntohl() to convert them to host order.

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the address.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the port.

function.return: TRUE if the address could be retrieved.

function.name: gst_netaddress_get_ip6_address
function.description:
Get the IPv6 address stored in @naddr into @address.
If @naddr is of type GST_NET_TYPE_IP4, the transitional IP6 address is returned.
Note that @port is expressed in network byte order, use g_ntohs() to convert it to host order.

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the result.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the port.

function.return: TRUE if the address could be retrieved.

function.name: gst_netaddress_get_net_type
function.description: Get the type of address stored in @naddr.
function.return: the network type stored in @naddr.

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_address_bytes
function.description:
Set just the address bytes stored in @naddr into @address.
Note that @port must be expressed in network byte order, use g_htons() to convert it to network byte order order. IP4 address bytes must also be stored in network byte order.

parameter.name: address
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the result.

parameter.name: port
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the port.

function.return: number of bytes actually copied

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_ip4_address
function.description:
Set @naddr with the IPv4 @address and @port pair.
Note that @port and @address must be expressed in network byte order, use g_htons() and g_htonl() to convert them to network byte order.

function.name: gst_netaddress_set_ip6_address
function.description:
Set @naddr with the IPv6 @address and @port pair.
Note that @port must be expressed in network byte order, use g_htons() to convert it to network byte order.

function.name: gst_netaddress_to_string
function.description: Copies a string representation of @naddr into @dest. Up to @len bytes are copied.
function.return: the number of bytes which would be produced if the buffer was large enough

function.name: gst_netbuffer_new
function.description: Create a new network buffer.
function.return: a new #GstNetBuffer.

function.name: gst_object_check_uniqueness
function.description: Checks to see if there is any object named @name in @list. This function does not do any locking of any kind. You might want to protect the provided list with the lock of the owner of the list. This function will lock each #GstObject in the list to compare the name, so be carefull when passing a list with a locked object.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: a list of #GstObject to check through

function.return:
TRUE if a #GstObject named @name does not appear in @list, FALSE if it does.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the LOCK of each object in the list.

function.name: gst_object_control_properties
function.description:
Convenience function for GObject
Creates a GstController that allows you to dynamically control one, or more, GObject properties. If the given GObject already has a GstController, it adds the given properties to the existing controller and returns that controller.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object of which some properties should be controlled

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL terminated list of property names that should be controlled

function.return: The GstController with which the user can control the given properties dynamically or NULL if one or more of the given properties aren't available, or cannot be controlled, for the given element.

function.name: gst_object_default_deep_notify
function.description:
A default deep_notify signal callback for an object. The user data should contain a pointer to an array of strings that should be excluded from the notify. The default handler will print the new value of the property using g_print.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK for getting its path string.

parameter.name: excluded_props
parameter.parameter_description: (array zero-terminated=1) (element-type gchar*) (allow-none):a set of user-specified properties to exclude or NULL to show all changes.

function.name: gst_object_default_error
function.description:
A default error function.
The default handler will simply print the error string using g_print.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.parameter_description: an additional debug information string, or NULL

function.name: gst_object_get_control_rate
function.description:
Obtain the control-rate for this @object. Audio processing #GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to @control-rate nanoseconds.
If the @object is not under property control, this will return %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE. This allows the element to avoid the sub-dividing.
The control-rate is not expected to change if the element is in %GST_STATE_PAUSED or %GST_STATE_PLAYING.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: the control rate in nanoseconds

function.name: gst_object_get_control_source
function.description: Gets the corresponding #GstControlSource for the property. This should be unreferenced again after use.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property for which the #GstControlSource should be get

function.return: the #GstControlSource for @property_name or NULL if the property is not controlled by this controller or no #GstControlSource was assigned yet.

function.name: gst_object_get_controller
function.description: Gets the controller for the given GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: the controller handling some of the given element's properties, %NULL if no controller

function.name: gst_object_get_name
function.description:
Returns a copy of the name of @object. Caller should g_free() the return value after usage. For a nameless object, this returns NULL, which you can safely g_free() as well.
Free-function: g_free
function.return:
the name of @object. g_free() after usage.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_get_name_prefix
function.description:
Returns a copy of the name prefix of @object. Caller should g_free() the return value after usage. For a prefixless object, this returns NULL, which you can safely g_free() as well.
Deprecated: deprecated because the name prefix has never actually been used for anything.
function.return:
the name prefix of @object. g_free() after usage.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_get_parent
function.description: Returns the parent of @object. This function increases the refcount of the parent object so you should gst_object_unref() it after usage.
function.return:
parent of @object, this can be NULL if @object has no parent. unref after usage.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_get_path_string
function.description:
Generates a string describing the path of @object in the object hierarchy. Only useful (or used) for debugging.
Free-function: g_free
function.return:
a string describing the path of @object. You must g_free() the string after usage.
MT safe. Grabs and releases the #GstObject's LOCK for all objects in the hierarchy.

function.name: gst_object_get_value_array
function.description:
Function to be able to get an array of values for one element properties
If the GstValueArray->values array is NULL, it will be created by the function. The type of the values in the array are the same as the property's type.
The g_object_* functions are just convenience functions for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

function.return: %TRUE if the given array(s) could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_get_value_arrays
function.description:
Function to be able to get an array of values for one or more given element properties.
If the GstValueArray->values array in list nodes is NULL, it will be created by the function. The type of the values in the array are the same as the property's type.
The g_object_* functions are just convenience functions for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

parameter.name: value_arrays
parameter.parameter_description: list to return the control-values in

function.return: %TRUE if the given array(s) could be filled, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_has_ancestor
function.description: Check if @object has an ancestor @ancestor somewhere up in the hierarchy. One can e.g. check if a #GstElement is inside a #GstPipeline.
function.return:
TRUE if @ancestor is an ancestor of @object.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's locks.

function.name: gst_object_ref
function.description:
Increments the reference count on @object. This function does not take the lock on @object because it relies on atomic refcounting.
This object returns the input parameter to ease writing constructs like : result = gst_object_ref (object->parent);
function.return: A pointer to @object

function.name: gst_object_ref_sink
function.description:
Increase the reference count of @object, and possibly remove the floating reference, if @object has a floating reference.
In other words, if the object is floating, then this call "assumes ownership" of the floating reference, converting it to a normal reference by clearing the floating flag while leaving the reference count unchanged. If the object is not floating, then this call adds a new normal reference increasing the reference count by one.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object lock.

function.name: gst_object_replace
function.description:
Unrefs the #GstObject pointed to by @oldobj, refs @newobj and puts @newobj in *@oldobj. Be carefull when calling this function, it does not take any locks. You might want to lock the object owning @oldobj pointer before calling this function.
Make sure not to LOCK @oldobj because it might be unreffed which could cause a deadlock when it is disposed.

parameter.name: oldobj
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a place of a #GstObject to replace

function.name: gst_object_restore_thyself
function.description: Restores @object with the data from the parent XML node.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: The XML node to load @object from

function.name: gst_object_save_thyself
function.description: Saves @object into the parent XML node.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: The parent XML node to save @object into

function.return: the new xmlNodePtr with the saved object

function.name: gst_object_set_control_rate
function.description:
Change the control-rate for this @object. Audio processing #GstElement objects will use this rate to sub-divide their processing loop and call gst_object_sync_values() inbetween. The length of the processing segment should be up to @control-rate nanoseconds.
The control-rate should not change if the element is in %GST_STATE_PAUSED or %GST_STATE_PLAYING.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.name: gst_object_set_control_source
function.description: Sets the #GstControlSource for @property_name. If there already was a #GstControlSource for this property it will be unreferenced.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the property for which the #GstControlSource should be set

parameter.name: csource
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstControlSource that should be used for the property

function.return: %FALSE if the given property isn't handled by the controller or the new #GstControlSource couldn't be bound to the property, %TRUE if everything worked as expected.

function.name: gst_object_set_controller
function.description: Sets the controller on the given GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that should get the controller

parameter.name: controller
parameter.parameter_description: the controller object to plug in

function.return: %FALSE if the GObject already has an controller, %TRUE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of @object, or gives @object a guaranteed unique name (if @name is NULL). This function makes a copy of the provided name, so the caller retains ownership of the name it sent.
function.return:
TRUE if the name could be set. Since Objects that have a parent cannot be renamed, this function returns FALSE in those cases.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_set_name_prefix
function.description:
Sets the name prefix of @object to @name_prefix. This function makes a copy of the provided name prefix, so the caller retains ownership of the name prefix it sent.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object's LOCK.
Deprecated: deprecated because the name prefix has never actually been used for anything.

function.name: gst_object_set_parent
function.description:
Sets the parent of @object to @parent. The object's reference count will be incremented, and any floating reference will be removed (see gst_object_sink()).
This function causes the parent-set signal to be emitted when the parent was successfully set.
function.return:
TRUE if @parent could be set or FALSE when @object already had a parent or @object and @parent are the same.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's LOCK.

function.name: gst_object_sink
function.description:
If @object was floating, the #GST_OBJECT_FLOATING flag is removed and @object is unreffed. When @object was not floating, this function does nothing.
Any newly created object has a refcount of 1 and is floating. This function should be used when creating a new object to symbolically 'take ownership' of @object. This done by first doing a gst_object_ref() to keep a reference to @object and then gst_object_sink() to remove and unref any floating references to @object. Use gst_object_set_parent() to have this done for you.
MT safe. This function grabs and releases @object lock.

function.name: gst_object_suggest_next_sync
function.description: Convenience function for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

function.return: same thing as gst_controller_suggest_next_sync()

function.name: gst_object_sync_values
function.description: Convenience function for GObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object that has controlled properties

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: the time that should be processed

function.return: same thing as gst_controller_sync_values()

function.name: gst_object_uncontrol_properties
function.description:
Convenience function for GObject
Removes the given element's properties from it's controller

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object of which some properties should not be controlled anymore

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL terminated list of property names that should be controlled

function.return: %FALSE if one of the given property names isn't handled by the controller, %TRUE otherwise

function.name: gst_object_unparent
function.description:
Clear the parent of @object, removing the associated reference. This function decreases the refcount of @object.
MT safe. Grabs and releases @object's lock.

function.name: gst_object_unref
function.description:
Decrements the reference count on @object. If reference count hits zero, destroy @object. This function does not take the lock on @object as it relies on atomic refcounting.
The unref method should never be called with the LOCK held since this might deadlock the dispose function.

function.name: gst_pad_accept_caps
function.description: Check if the given pad accepts the caps.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstCaps to check on the pad

function.return: TRUE if the pad can accept the caps.

function.name: gst_pad_activate_pull
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad in pull mode via dispatching to the pad's activatepullfunc. For use from within pad activation functions only. When called on sink pads, will first proxy the call to the peer pad, which is expected to activate its internally linked pads from within its activate_pull function.
If you don't know what this is, you probably don't want to call it.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not the pad should be active.

function.return:
TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_activate_push
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad in push mode via dispatching to the pad's activatepushfunc. For use from within pad activation functions only.
If you don't know what this is, you probably don't want to call it.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether the pad should be active or not.

function.return:
%TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_add_buffer_probe
function.description: Adds a probe that will be called for all buffers passing through a pad. See gst_pad_add_data_probe() for more information.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the buffer probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when buffers are passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler

function.return: The handler id

function.name: gst_pad_add_buffer_probe_full
function.description:
Adds a probe that will be called for all buffers passing through a pad. See gst_pad_add_data_probe() for more information.
The @notify function is called when the probe is disconnected and usually used to free @data.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the buffer probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when buffer are passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the probe is disconnected, or NULL

function.return: The handler id

function.name: gst_pad_add_data_probe
function.description:
Adds a "data probe" to a pad. This function will be called whenever data passes through a pad. In this case data means both events and buffers. The probe will be called with the data as an argument, meaning @handler should have the same callback signature as the #GstPad::have-data signal. Note that the data will have a reference count greater than 1, so it will be immutable -- you must not change it.
For source pads, the probe will be called after the blocking function, if any (see gst_pad_set_blocked_async()), but before looking up the peer to chain to. For sink pads, the probe function will be called before configuring the sink with new caps, if any, and before calling the pad's chain function.
Your data probe should return TRUE to let the data continue to flow, or FALSE to drop it. Dropping data is rarely useful, but occasionally comes in handy with events.
Although probes are implemented internally by connecting @handler to the have-data signal on the pad, if you want to remove a probe it is insufficient to only call g_signal_handler_disconnect on the returned handler id. To remove a probe, use the appropriate function, such as gst_pad_remove_data_probe().

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the data probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when data is passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler

function.return: The handler id.

function.name: gst_pad_add_data_probe_full
function.description:
Adds a "data probe" to a pad. This function will be called whenever data passes through a pad. In this case data means both events and buffers. The probe will be called with the data as an argument, meaning @handler should have the same callback signature as the #GstPad::have-data signal. Note that the data will have a reference count greater than 1, so it will be immutable -- you must not change it.
For source pads, the probe will be called after the blocking function, if any (see gst_pad_set_blocked_async()), but before looking up the peer to chain to. For sink pads, the probe function will be called before configuring the sink with new caps, if any, and before calling the pad's chain function.
Your data probe should return TRUE to let the data continue to flow, or FALSE to drop it. Dropping data is rarely useful, but occasionally comes in handy with events.
Although probes are implemented internally by connecting @handler to the have-data signal on the pad, if you want to remove a probe it is insufficient to only call g_signal_handler_disconnect on the returned handler id. To remove a probe, use the appropriate function, such as gst_pad_remove_data_probe().
The @notify function is called when the probe is disconnected and usually used to free @data.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the data probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when data is passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the probe is disconnected, or NULL

function.return: The handler id.

function.name: gst_pad_add_event_probe
function.description: Adds a probe that will be called for all events passing through a pad. See gst_pad_add_data_probe() for more information.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the event probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when events are passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler

function.return: The handler id

function.name: gst_pad_add_event_probe_full
function.description:
Adds a probe that will be called for all events passing through a pad. See gst_pad_add_data_probe() for more information.
The @notify function is called when the probe is disconnected and usually used to free @data.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to add the event probe handler to

parameter.name: handler
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when events are passed over pad

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass along with the handler, or NULL

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when probe is disconnected, or NULL

function.return: The handler id

function.name: gst_pad_alloc_buffer
function.description:
Allocates a new, empty buffer optimized to push to pad @pad. This function only works if @pad is a source pad and has a peer.
A new, empty #GstBuffer will be put in the @buf argument. You need to check the caps of the buffer after performing this function and renegotiate to the format if needed. If the caps changed, it is possible that the buffer returned in @buf is not of the right size for the new format, @buf needs to be unreffed and reallocated if this is the case.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset of the new buffer in the stream

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the new buffer

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the caps of the new buffer

function.return:
a result code indicating success of the operation. Any result code other than #GST_FLOW_OK is an error and @buf should not be used. An error can occur if the pad is not connected or when the downstream peer elements cannot provide an acceptable buffer.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_alloc_buffer_and_set_caps
function.description:
In addition to the function gst_pad_alloc_buffer(), this function automatically calls gst_pad_set_caps() when the caps of the newly allocated buffer are different from the @pad caps.
After a renegotiation, the size of the new buffer returned in @buf could be of the wrong size for the new format and must be unreffed an reallocated in that case.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset of the new buffer in the stream

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the new buffer

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the caps of the new buffer

function.return:
a result code indicating success of the operation. Any result code other than #GST_FLOW_OK is an error and @buf should not be used. An error can occur if the pad is not connected or when the downstream peer elements cannot provide an acceptable buffer.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_can_link
function.description: Checks if the source pad and the sink pad are compatible so they can be linked.
function.return: TRUE if the pads can be linked.

function.name: gst_pad_chain
function.description:
Chain a buffer to @pad.
The function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE if the pad was flushing.
If the caps on @buffer are different from the current caps on @pad, this function will call any setcaps function (see gst_pad_set_setcaps_function()) installed on @pad. If the new caps are not acceptable for @pad, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling the chain function installed on @pad (see gst_pad_set_chain_function()) and the return value of that function is returned to the caller. #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED is returned if @pad has no chain function.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @buffer after calling this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBuffer to send, return GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_chain_list
function.description:
Chain a bufferlist to @pad.
The function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE if the pad was flushing.
If the caps on the first buffer of @list are different from the current caps on @pad, this function will call any setcaps function (see gst_pad_set_setcaps_function()) installed on @pad. If the new caps are not acceptable for @pad, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling the chainlist function installed on @pad (see gst_pad_set_chain_list_function()) and the return value of that function is returned to the caller. #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED is returned if @pad has no chainlist function.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @list after calling this function.
MT safe.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBufferList to send, return GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return: a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_check_pull_range
function.description:
Checks if a gst_pad_pull_range() can be performed on the peer source pad. This function is used by plugins that want to check if they can use random access on the peer source pad.
The peer sourcepad can implement a custom #GstPadCheckGetRangeFunction if it needs to perform some logic to determine if pull_range is possible.
function.return:
a gboolean with the result.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_dispatcher
function.description: Invokes the given dispatcher function on each respective peer of all pads that are internally linked to the given pad. The GstPadDispatcherFunction should return TRUE when no further pads need to be processed.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: gpointer user data passed to the dispatcher function.

function.return: TRUE if one of the dispatcher functions returned TRUE.

function.name: gst_pad_event_default
function.description: Invokes the default event handler for the given pad. End-of-stream and discontinuity events are handled specially, and then the event is sent to all pads internally linked to @pad. Note that if there are many possible sink pads that are internally linked to @pad, only one will be sent an event. Multi-sinkpad elements should implement custom event handlers.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to call the default event handler on.

function.return: TRUE if the event was sent succesfully.

function.name: gst_pad_fixate_caps
function.description: Fixate a caps on the given pad. Modifies the caps in place, so you should make sure that the caps are actually writable (see gst_caps_make_writable()).

function.name: gst_pad_get_allowed_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities of the allowed media types that can flow through @pad and its peer.
The allowed capabilities is calculated as the intersection of the results of calling gst_pad_get_caps() on @pad and its peer. The caller owns a reference on the resulting caps.
function.return:
the allowed #GstCaps of the pad link. Unref the caps when you no longer need it. This function returns NULL when @pad has no peer.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities this pad can produce or consume. Note that this method doesn't necessarily return the caps set by gst_pad_set_caps() - use GST_PAD_CAPS() for that instead. gst_pad_get_caps returns all possible caps a pad can operate with, using the pad's get_caps function; this returns the pad template caps if not explicitly set.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the capabilities of.

function.return:
a newly allocated copy of the #GstCaps of this pad
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_caps_reffed
function.description: Gets the capabilities this pad can produce or consume. Preferred function if one only wants to read or intersect the caps.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the capabilities of.

function.return: the caps of the pad with incremented ref-count.

function.name: gst_pad_get_direction
function.description: Gets the direction of the pad. The direction of the pad is decided at construction time so this function does not take the LOCK.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the direction of.

function.return:
the #GstPadDirection of the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_element_private
function.description: Gets the private data of a pad. No locking is performed in this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the private data of.

function.return: a #gpointer to the private data.

function.name: gst_pad_get_fixed_caps_func
function.description:
A helper function you can use as a GetCaps function that will return the currently negotiated caps or the padtemplate when NULL.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref
function.return: the currently negotiated caps or the padtemplate.

function.name: gst_pad_get_internal_links
function.description:
Gets a list of pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element. The caller must free this list after use.
Not MT safe.
Deprecated: This function does not ref the pads in the list so that they could become invalid by the time the application accesses them. It's also possible that the list changes while handling the pads, which the caller of this function is unable to know. Use the thread-safe gst_pad_iterate_internal_links() instead.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return: a newly allocated #GList of pads, free with g_list_free().

function.name: gst_pad_get_internal_links_default
function.description:
Gets a list of pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element. This is the default handler, and thus returns a list of all of the pads inside the parent element with opposite direction.
The caller must free this list after use with g_list_free().
Deprecated: This function does not ref the pads in the list so that they could become invalid by the time the application accesses them. It's also possible that the list changes while handling the pads, which the caller of this function is unable to know. Use the thread-safe gst_pad_iterate_internal_links_default() instead.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return:
a newly allocated #GList of pads, or NULL if the pad has no parent.
Not MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_negotiated_caps
function.description:
Gets the capabilities of the media type that currently flows through @pad and its peer.
This function can be used on both src and sinkpads. Note that srcpads are always negotiated before sinkpads so it is possible that the negotiated caps on the srcpad do not match the negotiated caps of the peer.
function.return:
the negotiated #GstCaps of the pad link. Unref the caps when you no longer need it. This function returns NULL when the @pad has no peer or is not negotiated yet.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_pad_template
function.description: Gets the template for @pad.
function.return:
the #GstPadTemplate from which this pad was instantiated, or %NULL if this pad has no template.
FIXME: currently returns an unrefcounted padtemplate.

function.name: gst_pad_get_pad_template_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities for @pad's template.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the template capabilities from.

function.return: the #GstCaps of this pad template. If you intend to keep a reference on the caps, make a copy (see gst_caps_copy ()).

function.name: gst_pad_get_parent_element
function.description: Gets the parent of @pad, cast to a #GstElement. If a @pad has no parent or its parent is not an element, return NULL.
function.return:
the parent of the pad. The caller has a reference on the parent, so unref when you're finished with it.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_peer
function.description: Gets the peer of @pad. This function refs the peer pad so you need to unref it after use.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the peer of.

function.return:
the peer #GstPad. Unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_get_query_types
function.description: Get an array of supported queries that can be performed on this pad.
function.return: a zero-terminated array of #GstQueryType.

function.name: gst_pad_get_query_types_default
function.description: Invoke the default dispatcher for the query types on the pad.
function.return: a zero-terminated array of #GstQueryType, or NULL if none of the internally-linked pads has a query types function.

function.name: gst_pad_get_range
function.description:
When @pad is flushing this function returns #GST_FLOW_WRONG_STATE immediatly and @buffer is %NULL.
Calls the getrange function of @pad, see #GstPadGetRangeFunction for a description of a getrange function. If @pad has no getrange function installed (see gst_pad_set_getrange_function()) this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_SUPPORTED.
This is a lowlevel function. Usualy gst_pad_pull_range() is used.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: The start offset of the buffer

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the #GstBuffer, returns #GST_FLOW_ERROR if %NULL.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_active
function.description: Query if a pad is active
function.return:
TRUE if the pad is active.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_blocked
function.description: Checks if the pad is blocked or not. This function returns the last requested state of the pad. It is not certain that the pad is actually blocking at this point (see gst_pad_is_blocking()).
function.return:
TRUE if the pad is blocked.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_blocking
function.description: Checks if the pad is blocking or not. This is a guaranteed state of whether the pad is actually blocking on a #GstBuffer or a #GstEvent.
function.return:
TRUE if the pad is blocking.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_is_linked
function.description: Checks if a @pad is linked to another pad or not.
function.return:
TRUE if the pad is linked, FALSE otherwise.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_iterate_internal_links
function.description:
Gets an iterator for the pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element.
Each #GstPad element yielded by the iterator will have its refcount increased, so unref after use.
Free-function: gst_iterator_free

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return: a new #GstIterator of #GstPad or %NULL when the pad does not have an iterator function configured. Use gst_iterator_free() after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_iterate_internal_links_default
function.description:
Iterate the list of pads to which the given pad is linked to inside of the parent element. This is the default handler, and thus returns an iterator of all of the pads inside the parent element with opposite direction.
The caller must free this iterator after use with gst_iterator_free().

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to get the internal links of.

function.return: a #GstIterator of #GstPad, or NULL if @pad has no parent. Unref each returned pad with gst_object_unref().

function.name: gst_pad_link
function.description: Links the source pad and the sink pad.
function.return:
A result code indicating if the connection worked or what went wrong.
MT Safe.

function.name: gst_pad_link_full
function.description:
Links the source pad and the sink pad.
This variant of #gst_pad_link provides a more granular control on the checks being done when linking. While providing some considerable speedups the caller of this method must be aware that wrong usage of those flags can cause severe issues. Refer to the documentation of #GstPadLinkCheck for more information.
MT Safe.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the checks to validate when linking

function.return: A result code indicating if the connection worked or what went wrong.

function.name: gst_pad_load_and_link
function.description: Reads the pad definition from the XML node and links the given pad in the element to a pad of an element up in the hierarchy.

parameter.name: self
parameter.parameter_description: an #xmlNodePtr to read the description from.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstObject element that owns the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_new
function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name in the given direction. If name is NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the new pad.

function.return:
a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_new_from_static_template
function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name from the given static template. If name is NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.
function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_pad_new_from_template
function.description: Creates a new pad with the given name from the given template. If name is NULL, a guaranteed unique name (across all pads) will be assigned. This function makes a copy of the name so you can safely free the name.
function.return: a new #GstPad, or NULL in case of an error.

function.name: gst_pad_pause_task
function.description: Pause the task of @pad. This function will also wait until the function executed by the task is finished if this function is not called from the task function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to pause the task of

function.return: a TRUE if the task could be paused or FALSE when the pad has no task.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_accept_caps
function.description: Check if the peer of @pad accepts @caps. If @pad has no peer, this function returns TRUE.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to check the peer of

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstCaps to check on the pad

function.return: TRUE if the peer of @pad can accept the caps or @pad has no peer.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_get_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities of the peer connected to this pad. Similar to gst_pad_get_caps().

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the peer capabilities of.

function.return: a newly allocated copy of the #GstCaps of the peer pad. Use gst_caps_unref() to get rid of it. This function returns %NULL if there is no peer pad.

function.name: gst_pad_peer_get_caps_reffed
function.description: Gets the capabilities of the peer connected to this pad. Preferred function if one only wants to read or intersect the caps.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to get the capabilities of.

function.return: the caps of the pad with incremented ref-count

function.name: gst_pad_peer_query
function.description:
Performs gst_pad_query() on the peer of @pad.
The caller is responsible for both the allocation and deallocation of the query structure.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the peer query on.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed. This function returns %FALSE if @pad has no peer.

function.name: gst_pad_proxy_getcaps
function.description:
Calls gst_pad_get_allowed_caps() for every other pad belonging to the same element as @pad, and returns the intersection of the results.
This function is useful as a default getcaps function for an element that can handle any stream format, but requires all its pads to have the same caps. Two such elements are tee and adder.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref
function.return: the intersection of the other pads' allowed caps.

function.name: gst_pad_proxy_setcaps
function.description: Calls gst_pad_set_caps() for every other pad belonging to the same element as @pad. If gst_pad_set_caps() fails on any pad, the proxy setcaps fails. May be used only during negotiation.
function.return: TRUE if sucessful

function.name: gst_pad_pull_range
function.description:
Pulls a @buffer from the peer pad.
This function will first trigger the pad block signal if it was installed.
When @pad is not linked #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED is returned else this function returns the result of gst_pad_get_range() on the peer pad. See gst_pad_get_range() for a list of return values and for the semantics of the arguments of this function.
@buffer's caps must either be unset or the same as what is already configured on @pad. Renegotiation within a running pull-mode pipeline is not supported.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a sink #GstPad, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: The start offset of the buffer

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to hold the #GstBuffer, returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if %NULL.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad. When this function returns #GST_FLOW_OK, @buffer will contain a valid #GstBuffer that should be freed with gst_buffer_unref() after usage. @buffer may not be used or freed when any other return value than #GST_FLOW_OK is returned.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_push
function.description:
Pushes a buffer to the peer of @pad.
This function will call an installed pad block before triggering any installed pad probes.
If the caps on @buffer are different from the currently configured caps on @pad, this function will call any installed setcaps function on @pad (see gst_pad_set_setcaps_function()). In case of failure to renegotiate the new format, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
The function proceeds calling gst_pad_chain() on the peer pad and returns the value from that function. If @pad has no peer, #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED will be returned.
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @buffer after calling this function.

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBuffer to push returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_push_event
function.description:
Sends the event to the peer of the given pad. This function is mainly used by elements to send events to their peer elements.
This function takes owership of the provided event so you should gst_event_ref() it if you want to reuse the event after this call.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to push the event to.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEvent to send to the pad.

function.return:
TRUE if the event was handled.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_push_list
function.description:
Pushes a buffer list to the peer of @pad.
This function will call an installed pad block before triggering any installed pad probes.
If the caps on the first buffer in the first group of @list are different from the currently configured caps on @pad, this function will call any installed setcaps function on @pad (see gst_pad_set_setcaps_function()). In case of failure to renegotiate the new format, this function returns #GST_FLOW_NOT_NEGOTIATED.
If there are any probes installed on @pad every group of the buffer list will be merged into a normal #GstBuffer and pushed via gst_pad_push and the buffer list will be unreffed.
The function proceeds calling the chain function on the peer pad and returns the value from that function. If @pad has no peer, #GST_FLOW_NOT_LINKED will be returned. If the peer pad does not have any installed chainlist function every group buffer of the list will be merged into a normal #GstBuffer and chained via gst_pad_chain().
In all cases, success or failure, the caller loses its reference to @list after calling this function.

parameter.name: list
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstBufferList to push returns GST_FLOW_ERROR if not.

function.return:
a #GstFlowReturn from the peer pad.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_query
function.description:
Dispatches a query to a pad. The query should have been allocated by the caller via one of the type-specific allocation functions. The element that the pad belongs to is responsible for filling the query with an appropriate response, which should then be parsed with a type-specific query parsing function.
Again, the caller is responsible for both the allocation and deallocation of the query structure.
Please also note that some queries might need a running pipeline to work.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the default query on.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_convert
function.description: Queries a pad to convert @src_val in @src_format to @dest_format.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the convert query on.

parameter.name: dest_format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat to convert to.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_default
function.description: Invokes the default query handler for the given pad. The query is sent to all pads internally linked to @pad. Note that if there are many possible sink pads that are internally linked to @pad, only one will be sent the query. Multi-sinkpad elements should implement custom query handlers.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to call the default query handler on.

function.return: TRUE if the query was performed succesfully.

function.name: gst_pad_query_duration
function.description: Queries a pad for the total stream duration.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the duration query on.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat asked for. On return contains the #GstFormat used.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the total duration, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_peer_convert
function.description: Queries the peer pad of a given sink pad to convert @src_val in @src_format to @dest_format.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad, on whose peer pad to invoke the convert query on. Must be a sink pad.

parameter.name: dest_format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat to convert to.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_peer_duration
function.description: Queries the peer pad of a given sink pad for the total stream duration.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad on whose peer pad to invoke the duration query on. Must be a sink pad.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat asked for. On return contains the #GstFormat used.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the total duration, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_peer_position
function.description: Queries the peer of a given sink pad for the stream position.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad on whose peer to invoke the position query on. Must be a sink pad.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat asked for. On return contains the #GstFormat used.

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: a location in which to store the current position, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_query_position
function.description: Queries a pad for the stream position.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to invoke the position query on.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the #GstFormat asked for. On return contains the #GstFormat used.

parameter.name: cur
parameter.parameter_description: A location in which to store the current position, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE if the query could be performed.

function.name: gst_pad_remove_buffer_probe
function.description: Removes a buffer probe from @pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to remove the buffer probe handler from

function.name: gst_pad_remove_data_probe
function.description: Removes a data probe from @pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to remove the data probe handler from

function.name: gst_pad_remove_event_probe
function.description: Removes an event probe from @pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: pad to remove the event probe handler from

function.name: gst_pad_save_thyself
function.description: Saves the pad into an xml representation.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the parent #xmlNodePtr to save the description in.

function.return: the #xmlNodePtr representation of the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_send_event
function.description:
Sends the event to the pad. This function can be used by applications to send events in the pipeline.
If @pad is a source pad, @event should be an upstream event. If @pad is a sink pad, @event should be a downstream event. For example, you would not send a #GST_EVENT_EOS on a src pad; EOS events only propagate downstream. Furthermore, some downstream events have to be serialized with data flow, like EOS, while some can travel out-of-band, like #GST_EVENT_FLUSH_START. If the event needs to be serialized with data flow, this function will take the pad's stream lock while calling its event function.
To find out whether an event type is upstream, downstream, or downstream and serialized, see #GstEventTypeFlags, gst_event_type_get_flags(), #GST_EVENT_IS_UPSTREAM, #GST_EVENT_IS_DOWNSTREAM, and #GST_EVENT_IS_SERIALIZED. Note that in practice that an application or plugin doesn't need to bother itself with this information; the core handles all necessary locks and checks.
This function takes owership of the provided event so you should gst_event_ref() it if you want to reuse the event after this call.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to send the event to.

parameter.name: event
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstEvent to send to the pad.

function.return: TRUE if the event was handled.

function.name: gst_pad_set_acceptcaps_function
function.description: Sets the given acceptcaps function for the pad. The acceptcaps function will be called to check if the pad can accept the given caps. Setting the acceptcaps function to NULL restores the default behaviour of allowing any caps that matches the caps from gst_pad_get_caps().

function.name: gst_pad_set_activate_function
function.description:
Sets the given activate function for @pad. The activate function will dispatch to gst_pad_activate_push() or gst_pad_activate_pull() to perform the actual activation. Only makes sense to set on sink pads.
Call this function if your sink pad can start a pull-based task.

function.name: gst_pad_set_activatepull_function
function.description: Sets the given activate_pull function for the pad. An activate_pull function prepares the element and any upstream connections for pulling. See XXX part-activation.txt for details.

function.name: gst_pad_set_activatepush_function
function.description: Sets the given activate_push function for the pad. An activate_push function prepares the element for pushing. See XXX part-activation.txt for details.

function.name: gst_pad_set_active
function.description:
Activates or deactivates the given pad. Normally called from within core state change functions.
If @active, makes sure the pad is active. If it is already active, either in push or pull mode, just return. Otherwise dispatches to the pad's activate function to perform the actual activation.
If not @active, checks the pad's current mode and calls gst_pad_activate_push() or gst_pad_activate_pull(), as appropriate, with a FALSE argument.

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not the pad should be active.

function.return:
#TRUE if the operation was successful.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_blocked
function.description:
Blocks or unblocks the dataflow on a pad. This function is a shortcut for gst_pad_set_blocked_async() with a NULL callback.
<note> Pad blocks are only possible for source pads in push mode and sink pads in pull mode. </note>

parameter.name: blocked
parameter.parameter_description: boolean indicating we should block or unblock

function.return:
TRUE if the pad could be blocked. This function can fail if the wrong parameters were passed or the pad was already in the requested state.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_blocked_async
function.description:
Blocks or unblocks the dataflow on a pad. The provided callback is called when the operation succeeds; this happens right before the next attempt at pushing a buffer on the pad.
This can take a while as the pad can only become blocked when real dataflow is happening. When the pipeline is stalled, for example in PAUSED, this can take an indeterminate amount of time. You can pass NULL as the callback to make this call block. Be careful with this blocking call as it might not return for reasons stated above.
<note> Pad block handlers are only called for source pads in push mode and sink pads in pull mode. </note>

parameter.name: blocked
parameter.parameter_description: boolean indicating whether the pad should be blocked or unblocked

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPadBlockCallback that will be called when the operation succeeds

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callback

function.return:
TRUE if the pad could be blocked. This function can fail if the wrong parameters were passed or the pad was already in the requested state.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_blocked_async_full
function.description:
Blocks or unblocks the dataflow on a pad. The provided callback is called when the operation succeeds; this happens right before the next attempt at pushing a buffer on the pad.
This can take a while as the pad can only become blocked when real dataflow is happening. When the pipeline is stalled, for example in PAUSED, this can take an indeterminate amount of time. You can pass NULL as the callback to make this call block. Be careful with this blocking call as it might not return for reasons stated above.
