<note> Pad block handlers are only called for source pads in push mode and sink pads in pull mode. </note>

parameter.name: blocked
parameter.parameter_description: boolean indicating whether the pad should be blocked or unblocked

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: #GstPadBlockCallback that will be called when the operation succeeds

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callback

function.return:
TRUE if the pad could be blocked. This function can fail if the wrong parameters were passed or the pad was already in the requested state.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_bufferalloc_function
function.description: Sets the given bufferalloc function for the pad. Note that the bufferalloc function can only be set on sinkpads.

function.name: gst_pad_set_caps
function.description: Sets the capabilities of this pad. The caps must be fixed. Any previous caps on the pad will be unreffed. This function refs the caps so you should unref if as soon as you don't need it anymore. It is possible to set NULL caps, which will make the pad unnegotiated again.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstPad to set the capabilities of.

function.return:
TRUE if the caps could be set. FALSE if the caps were not fixed or bad parameters were provided to this function.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_function
function.description: Sets the given chain function for the pad. The chain function is called to process a #GstBuffer input buffer. see #GstPadChainFunction for more details.

function.name: gst_pad_set_chain_list_function
function.description: Sets the given chain list function for the pad. The chainlist function is called to process a #GstBufferList input buffer list. See #GstPadChainListFunction for more details.

function.name: gst_pad_set_checkgetrange_function
function.description: Sets the given checkgetrange function for the pad. Implement this function on a pad if you dynamically support getrange based scheduling on the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_element_private
function.description: Set the given private data gpointer on the pad. This function can only be used by the element that owns the pad. No locking is performed in this function.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to set the private data of.

parameter.name: priv
parameter.parameter_description: The private data to attach to the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_event_function
function.description: Sets the given event handler for the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_fixatecaps_function
function.description: Sets the given fixatecaps function for the pad. The fixatecaps function will be called whenever the default values for a GstCaps needs to be filled in.

function.name: gst_pad_set_getcaps_function
function.description:
Sets the given getcaps function for the pad. @getcaps should return the allowable caps for a pad in the context of the element's state, its link to other elements, and the devices or files it has opened. These caps must be a subset of the pad template caps. In the NULL state with no links, @getcaps should ideally return the same caps as the pad template. In rare circumstances, an object property can affect the caps returned by @getcaps, but this is discouraged.
You do not need to call this function if @pad's allowed caps are always the same as the pad template caps. This can only be true if the padtemplate has fixed simple caps.
For most filters, the caps returned by @getcaps is directly affected by the allowed caps on other pads. For demuxers and decoders, the caps returned by the srcpad's getcaps function is directly related to the stream data. Again, @getcaps should return the most specific caps it reasonably can, since this helps with autoplugging.
Note that the return value from @getcaps is owned by the caller, so the caller should unref the caps after usage.

function.name: gst_pad_set_getrange_function
function.description: Sets the given getrange function for the pad. The getrange function is called to produce a new #GstBuffer to start the processing pipeline. see #GstPadGetRangeFunction for a description of the getrange function.

function.name: gst_pad_set_internal_link_function
function.description:
Sets the given internal link function for the pad.
Deprecated: Use the thread-safe gst_pad_set_iterate_internal_links_function()

function.name: gst_pad_set_iterate_internal_links_function
function.description: Sets the given internal link iterator function for the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_link_function
function.description:
Sets the given link function for the pad. It will be called when the pad is linked with another pad.
The return value #GST_PAD_LINK_OK should be used when the connection can be made.
The return value #GST_PAD_LINK_REFUSED should be used when the connection cannot be made for some reason.
If @link is installed on a source pad, it should call the #GstPadLinkFunction of the peer sink pad, if present.

function.name: gst_pad_set_query_function
function.description: Set the given query function for the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_query_type_function
function.description: Set the given query type function for the pad.

function.name: gst_pad_set_setcaps_function
function.description: Sets the given setcaps function for the pad. The setcaps function will be called whenever a buffer with a new media type is pushed or pulled from the pad. The pad/element needs to update its internal structures to process the new media type. If this new type is not acceptable, the setcaps function should return FALSE.

function.name: gst_pad_set_unlink_function
function.description: Sets the given unlink function for the pad. It will be called when the pad is unlinked.

function.name: gst_pad_start_task
function.description: Starts a task that repeatedly calls @func with @data. This function is mostly used in pad activation functions to start the dataflow. The #GST_PAD_STREAM_LOCK of @pad will automatically be acquired before @func is called.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to start the task of

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data passed to the task function

function.return: a %TRUE if the task could be started.

function.name: gst_pad_stop_task
function.description:
Stop the task of @pad. This function will also make sure that the function executed by the task will effectively stop if not called from the GstTaskFunction.
This function will deadlock if called from the GstTaskFunction of the task. Use gst_task_pause() instead.
Regardless of whether the pad has a task, the stream lock is acquired and released so as to ensure that streaming through this pad has finished.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPad to stop the task of

function.return: a TRUE if the task could be stopped or FALSE on error.

function.name: gst_pad_template_get_caps
function.description: Gets the capabilities of the pad template.
function.return: the #GstCaps of the pad template. If you need to keep a reference to the caps, take a ref (see gst_caps_ref ()).

function.name: gst_pad_template_new
function.description: Creates a new pad template with a name according to the given template and with the given arguments. This functions takes ownership of the provided caps, so be sure to not use them afterwards.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstCaps set for the template. The caps are taken ownership of.

function.return: a new #GstPadTemplate.

function.name: gst_pad_template_pad_created
function.description: Emit the pad-created signal for this template when created by this pad.

function.name: gst_pad_unlink
function.description: Unlinks the source pad from the sink pad. Will emit the #GstPad::unlinked signal on both pads.
function.return:
TRUE if the pads were unlinked. This function returns FALSE if the pads were not linked together.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pad_use_fixed_caps
function.description:
A helper function you can use that sets the @gst_pad_get_fixed_caps_func as the getcaps function for the pad. This way the function will always return the negotiated caps or in case the pad is not negotiated, the padtemplate caps.
Use this function on a pad that, once gst_pad_set_caps() has been called on it, cannot be renegotiated to something else.

function.name: gst_param_spec_fraction
function.description: This function creates a fraction GParamSpec for use by objects/elements that want to expose properties of fraction type. This function is typically used in connection with g_object_class_install_property() in a GObjects's instance_init function.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: canonical name of the property specified

parameter.name: nick
parameter.parameter_description: nick name for the property specified

function.return: a newly created parameter specification

function.name: gst_param_spec_mini_object
function.description: Creates a new #GParamSpec instance that hold #GstMiniObject references.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the canonical name of the property

parameter.name: blurb
parameter.parameter_description: a short description of the property

function.return: a newly allocated #GParamSpec instance

function.name: gst_parse_bin_from_description
function.description: This is a convenience wrapper around gst_parse_launch() to create a #GstBin from a gst-launch-style pipeline description. See gst_parse_launch() and the gst-launch man page for details about the syntax. Ghost pads on the bin for unlinked source or sink pads within the bin can automatically be created (but only a maximum of one ghost pad for each direction will be created; if you expect multiple unlinked source pads or multiple unlinked sink pads and want them all ghosted, you will have to create the ghost pads yourself).

parameter.name: ghost_unlinked_pads
parameter.parameter_description: whether to automatically create ghost pads for unlinked source or sink pads within the bin

parameter.name: err
parameter.parameter_description: where to store the error message in case of an error, or NULL

function.return: a newly-created bin, or NULL if an error occurred.

function.name: gst_parse_bin_from_description_full
function.description: This is a convenience wrapper around gst_parse_launch() to create a #GstBin from a gst-launch-style pipeline description. See gst_parse_launch() and the gst-launch man page for details about the syntax. Ghost pads on the bin for unlinked source or sink pads within the bin can automatically be created (but only a maximum of one ghost pad for each direction will be created; if you expect multiple unlinked source pads or multiple unlinked sink pads and want them all ghosted, you will have to create the ghost pads yourself).

parameter.name: ghost_unlinked_pads
parameter.parameter_description: whether to automatically create ghost pads for unlinked source or sink pads within the bin

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: a parse context allocated with gst_parse_context_new(), or %NULL

parameter.name: err
parameter.parameter_description: where to store the error message in case of an error, or NULL

function.return: a newly-created bin, or NULL if an error occurred.

function.name: gst_parse_context_free
function.description: Frees a parse context previously allocated with gst_parse_context_new().

function.name: gst_parse_context_get_missing_elements
function.description: Retrieve missing elements from a previous run of gst_parse_launch_full() or gst_parse_launchv_full(). Will only return results if an error code of %GST_PARSE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_ELEMENT was returned.
function.return: a NULL-terminated array of element factory name strings of missing elements. Free with g_strfreev() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_parse_context_new
function.description:
Allocates a parse context for use with gst_parse_launch_full() or gst_parse_launchv_full().
Free-function: gst_parse_context_free
function.return: a newly-allocated parse context. Free with gst_parse_context_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gst_parse_error_quark
function.description: Get the error quark used by the parsing subsystem.
function.return: the quark of the parse errors.

function.name: gst_parse_launch
function.description: Create a new pipeline based on command line syntax. Please note that you might get a return value that is not %NULL even though the @error is set. In this case there was a recoverable parsing error and you can try to play the pipeline.

parameter.name: pipeline_description
parameter.parameter_description: the command line describing the pipeline

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: the error message in case of an erroneous pipeline.

function.return: a new element on success, %NULL on failure. If more than one toplevel element is specified by the @pipeline_description, all elements are put into a #GstPipeline, which than is returned.

function.name: gst_parse_launch_full
function.description: Create a new pipeline based on command line syntax. Please note that you might get a return value that is not %NULL even though the @error is set. In this case there was a recoverable parsing error and you can try to play the pipeline.

parameter.name: pipeline_description
parameter.parameter_description: the command line describing the pipeline

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: a parse context allocated with gst_parse_context_new(), or %NULL

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: the error message in case of an erroneous pipeline.

function.return: a new element on success, %NULL on failure. If more than one toplevel element is specified by the @pipeline_description, all elements are put into a #GstPipeline, which then is returned.

function.name: gst_parse_launchv
function.return: a new element on success and %NULL on failure.

function.name: gst_parse_launchv_full

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: a parse context allocated with gst_parse_context_new(), or %NULL

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GError (which must be initialised to %NULL)

function.return: a new element on success; on failure, either %NULL or a partially-constructed bin or element will be returned and @error will be set (unless you passed #GST_PARSE_FLAG_FATAL_ERRORS in @flags, then %NULL will always be returned on failure)

function.name: gst_pb_utils_add_codec_description_to_tag_list
function.description: Adds a codec tag describing the format specified by @caps to @taglist.

parameter.name: codec_tag
parameter.parameter_description: a GStreamer codec tag such as #GST_TAG_AUDIO_CODEC, #GST_TAG_VIDEO_CODEC or #GST_TAG_CODEC

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) #GstCaps for which a codec tag should be added.

function.return: TRUE if a codec tag was added, FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_codec_description
function.description:
Returns a localised (as far as this is possible) string describing the media format specified in @caps, for use in error dialogs or other messages to be seen by the user. Should never return NULL unless @caps is invalid.
Also see the convenience function gst_pb_utils_add_codec_description_to_tag_list().

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) #GstCaps for which an format description is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_decoder_description
function.description:
Returns a localised string describing an decoder for the format specified in @caps, for use in error dialogs or other messages to be seen by the user. Should never return NULL unless @factory_name or @caps are invalid.
This function is mainly for internal use, applications would typically use gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description() to get a description of a missing feature from a missing-plugin message.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) #GstCaps for which an decoder description is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_element_description
function.description:
Returns a localised string describing the given element, for use in error dialogs or other messages to be seen by the user. Should never return NULL unless @factory_name is invalid.
This function is mainly for internal use, applications would typically use gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description() to get a description of a missing feature from a missing-plugin message.

parameter.name: factory_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the element, e.g. "gnomevfssrc"

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_encoder_description
function.description:
Returns a localised string describing an encoder for the format specified in @caps, for use in error dialogs or other messages to be seen by the user. Should never return NULL unless @factory_name or @caps are invalid.
This function is mainly for internal use, applications would typically use gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description() to get a description of a missing feature from a missing-plugin message.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: the (fixed) #GstCaps for which an encoder description is needed

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_sink_description
function.description:
Returns a localised string describing a sink element handling the protocol specified in @protocol, for use in error dialogs or other messages to be seen by the user. Should never return NULL unless @protocol is invalid.
This function is mainly for internal use, applications would typically use gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description() to get a description of a missing feature from a missing-plugin message.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the protocol the sink element needs to handle, e.g. "http"

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_get_source_description
function.description:
Returns a localised string describing a source element handling the protocol specified in @protocol, for use in error dialogs or other messages to be seen by the user. Should never return NULL unless @protocol is invalid.
This function is mainly for internal use, applications would typically use gst_missing_plugin_message_get_description() to get a description of a missing feature from a missing-plugin message.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: the protocol the source element needs to handle, e.g. "http"

function.return: a newly-allocated description string, or NULL on error. Free string with g_free() when not needed any longer.

function.name: gst_pb_utils_init
function.description:
Initialises the base utils support library. This function is not thread-safe. Applications should call it after calling gst_init(), plugins should call it from their plugin_init function.
This function may be called multiple times. It will do nothing if the library has already been initialised.

function.name: gst_pipeline_auto_clock
function.description:
Let @pipeline select a clock automatically. This is the default behaviour.
Use this function if you previous forced a fixed clock with gst_pipeline_use_clock() and want to restore the default pipeline clock selection algorithm.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_get_auto_flush_bus
function.description: Check if @pipeline will automatically flush messages when going to the NULL state.
function.return:
whether the pipeline will automatically flush its bus when going from READY to NULL state or not.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_get_bus
function.description: Gets the #GstBus of @pipeline. The bus allows applications to receive #GstMessage packets.
function.return:
a #GstBus, unref after usage.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_get_clock
function.description: Gets the current clock used by @pipeline.
function.return: a #GstClock, unref after usage.

function.name: gst_pipeline_get_delay
function.description: Get the configured delay (see gst_pipeline_set_delay()).
function.return:
The configured delay.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_get_last_stream_time
function.description:
Gets the last running time of @pipeline. If the pipeline is PLAYING, the returned time is the running time used to configure the element's base time in the PAUSED->PLAYING state. If the pipeline is PAUSED, the returned time is the running time when the pipeline was paused.
This function returns #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE if the pipeline was configured to not handle the management of the element's base time (see gst_pipeline_set_new_stream_time()).
MT safe.
Deprecated: This function has the wrong name and is equivalent to gst_element_get_start_time().
function.return: a #GstClockTime.

function.name: gst_pipeline_new
function.description: Create a new pipeline with the given name.
function.return:
newly created GstPipeline
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_set_auto_flush_bus
function.description:
Usually, when a pipeline goes from READY to NULL state, it automatically flushes all pending messages on the bus, which is done for refcounting purposes, to break circular references.
This means that applications that update state using (async) bus messages (e.g. do certain things when a pipeline goes from PAUSED to READY) might not get to see messages when the pipeline is shut down, because they might be flushed before they can be dispatched in the main thread. This behaviour can be disabled using this function.
It is important that all messages on the bus are handled when the automatic flushing is disabled else memory leaks will be introduced.
MT safe.

parameter.name: auto_flush
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not to automatically flush the bus when the pipeline goes from READY to NULL state

function.name: gst_pipeline_set_clock
function.description: Set the clock for @pipeline. The clock will be distributed to all the elements managed by the pipeline.
function.return:
TRUE if the clock could be set on the pipeline. FALSE if some element did not accept the clock.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_set_delay
function.description:
Set the expected delay needed for all elements to perform the PAUSED to PLAYING state change. @delay will be added to the base time of the elements so that they wait an additional @delay amount of time before starting to process buffers and cannot be #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE.
This option is used for tuning purposes and should normally not be used.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_pipeline_set_new_stream_time
function.description:
Set the new start time of @pipeline to @time. The start time is used to set the base time on the elements (see gst_element_set_base_time()) in the PAUSED->PLAYING state transition.
Setting @time to #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE will disable the pipeline's management of element base time. The application will then be responsible for performing base time distribution. This is sometimes useful if you want to synchronize capture from multiple pipelines, and you can also ensure that the pipelines have the same clock.
MT safe.
Deprecated: This function has the wrong name and is equivalent to gst_element_set_start_time().

parameter.name: time
parameter.parameter_description: the new running time to set

function.name: gst_pipeline_use_clock
function.description:
Force @pipeline to use the given @clock. The pipeline will always use the given clock even if new clock providers are added to this pipeline.
If @clock is NULL all clocking will be disabled which will make the pipeline run as fast as possible.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_plugin_add_dependency
function.description:
Make GStreamer aware of external dependencies which affect the feature set of this plugin (ie. the elements or typefinders associated with it).
GStreamer will re-inspect plugins with external dependencies whenever any of the external dependencies change. This is useful for plugins which wrap other plugin systems, e.g. a plugin which wraps a plugin-based visualisation library and makes visualisations available as GStreamer elements, or a codec loader which exposes elements and/or caps dependent on what external codec libraries are currently installed.

parameter.name: env_vars
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of environent variables affecting the feature set of the plugin (e.g. an environment variable containing paths where to look for additional modules/plugins of a library), or NULL. Environment variable names may be followed by a path component which will be added to the content of the environment variable, e.g. "HOME/.mystuff/plugins".

parameter.name: paths
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated array of directories/paths where dependent files may be.

parameter.name: names

function.name: gst_plugin_add_dependency_simple
function.description:
Make GStreamer aware of external dependencies which affect the feature set of this plugin (ie. the elements or typefinders associated with it).
GStreamer will re-inspect plugins with external dependencies whenever any of the external dependencies change. This is useful for plugins which wrap other plugin systems, e.g. a plugin which wraps a plugin-based visualisation library and makes visualisations available as GStreamer elements, or a codec loader which exposes elements and/or caps dependent on what external codec libraries are currently installed.
Convenience wrapper function for gst_plugin_add_dependency() which takes simple strings as arguments instead of string arrays, with multiple arguments separated by predefined delimiters (see above).

parameter.name: env_vars
parameter.parameter_description: one or more environent variables (separated by ':', ';' or ','), or NULL. Environment variable names may be followed by a path component which will be added to the content of the environment variable, e.g. "HOME/.mystuff/plugins:MYSTUFF_PLUGINS_PATH"

parameter.name: paths
parameter.parameter_description: one ore more directory paths (separated by ':' or ';' or ','), or NULL. Example: "/usr/lib/mystuff/plugins"

parameter.name: names
parameter.parameter_description: one or more file names or file name suffixes (separated by commas), or NULL

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_check_version
function.description: Checks whether the given plugin feature is at least the required version
function.return: #TRUE if the plugin feature has at least the required version, otherwise #FALSE.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_get_name
function.description: Gets the name of a plugin feature.
function.return: the name

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_get_rank
function.description: Gets the rank of a plugin feature.
function.return: The rank of the feature

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_list
function.description: Runs a filter against all plugin features and returns a GList with the results. If the first flag is set, only the first match is returned (as a list with a single object).

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the filter function

function.return: a GList of features, g_list_free after use.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_list_copy
function.description: Copies the list of features. Caller should call @gst_plugin_feature_list_free when done with the list.
function.return: a copy of @list, with each feature's reference count incremented.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_list_debug
function.description: Debug the plugin feature names in @list.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_list_free
function.description: Unrefs each member of @list, then frees the list.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_load
function.return: a reference to the loaded feature, or NULL on error

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_rank_compare_func
function.description: Compares the two given #GstPluginFeature instances. This function can be used as a #GCompareFunc when sorting by rank and then by name.
function.return: negative value if the rank of p1 > the rank of p2 or the ranks are equal but the name of p1 comes before the name of p2; zero if the rank and names are equal; positive value if the rank of p1 < the rank of p2 or the ranks are equal but the name of p2 comes after the name of p1

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_set_name
function.description: Sets the name of a plugin feature. The name uniquely identifies a feature within all features of the same type. Renaming a plugin feature is not allowed. A copy is made of the name so you should free the supplied @name after calling this function.

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_set_rank
function.description: Specifies a rank for a plugin feature, so that autoplugging uses the most appropriate feature.

parameter.name: rank
parameter.parameter_description: rank value - higher number means more priority rank

function.name: gst_plugin_feature_type_name_filter
function.description: Compares type and name of plugin feature. Can be used with gst_filter_run().

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: the type and name to check against

function.return: TRUE if equal.

function.name: gst_plugin_find_feature
function.description: Find a feature of the given name and type in the given plugin.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the feature from

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the feature to find

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: The type of the feature to find

function.return: a GstPluginFeature or NULL if the feature was not found.

function.name: gst_plugin_find_feature_by_name
function.description: Find a feature of the given name in the given plugin.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the feature from

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the feature to find

function.return: a GstPluginFeature or NULL if the feature was not found.

function.description: Gets the plugin specific data cache. If it is %NULL there is no cached data stored. This is the case when the registry is getting rebuilt.
function.return: The cached data as a #GstStructure or %NULL.

function.name: gst_plugin_get_description

parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the filename of

function.return: the filename of the plugin

parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the license of

function.return: the license of the plugin

function.name: gst_plugin_get_module
function.description: Gets the #GModule of the plugin. If the plugin isn't loaded yet, NULL is returned.
function.return: module belonging to the plugin or NULL if the plugin isn't loaded yet.

function.name: gst_plugin_get_name
function.description: Get the short name of the plugin

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the name of

function.return: the name of the plugin

parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the source of

function.name: gst_plugin_get_version
function.description: get the version of the plugin

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: plugin to get the version of

function.return: the version of the plugin

function.name: gst_plugin_is_loaded
function.description: queries if the plugin is loaded into memory
function.return: TRUE is loaded, FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_plugin_list_feature_filter
function.description: Runs a filter against all plugin features of the plugins in the given list and returns a GList with the results. If the first flag is set, only the first match is returned (as a list with a single object).

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the filter function

function.return: a GList of features, g_list_free after use.

function.description: Unrefs each member of @list, then frees the list.

function.name: gst_plugin_load
function.return: a reference to a loaded plugin, or NULL on error.

function.name: gst_plugin_load_by_name
function.description: Load the named plugin. Refs the plugin.
function.return: a reference to a loaded plugin, or NULL on error.

function.name: gst_plugin_load_file
function.description: Loads the given plugin and refs it. Caller needs to unref after use.
function.return: a reference to the existing loaded GstPlugin, a reference to the newly-loaded GstPlugin, or NULL if an error occurred.

function.name: gst_plugin_name_filter
function.description: A standard filter that returns TRUE when the plugin is of the given name.
function.return: TRUE if the plugin is of the given name.

function.name: gst_plugin_register_static
function.description:
Registers a static plugin, ie. a plugin which is private to an application or library and contained within the application or library (as opposed to being shipped as a separate module file).
You must make sure that GStreamer has been initialised (with gst_init() or via gst_init_get_option_group()) before calling this function.

parameter.name: major_version
parameter.parameter_description: the major version number of the GStreamer core that the plugin was compiled for, you can just use GST_VERSION_MAJOR here

parameter.name: minor_version
parameter.parameter_description: the minor version number of the GStreamer core that the plugin was compiled for, you can just use GST_VERSION_MINOR here

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: a unique name of the plugin (ideally prefixed with an application- or library-specific namespace prefix in order to avoid name conflicts in case a similar plugin with the same name ever gets added to GStreamer)

parameter.name: init_func
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the init function of this plugin.

parameter.name: license
parameter.parameter_description: effective license of plugin. Must be one of the approved licenses (see #GstPluginDesc above) or the plugin will not be registered.

function.return: TRUE if the plugin was registered correctly, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_plugin_register_static_full
function.description:
Registers a static plugin, ie. a plugin which is private to an application or library and contained within the application or library (as opposed to being shipped as a separate module file) with a #GstPluginInitFullFunc which allows user data to be passed to the callback function (useful for bindings).
You must make sure that GStreamer has been initialised (with gst_init() or via gst_init_get_option_group()) before calling this function.

parameter.name: major_version
parameter.parameter_description: the major version number of the GStreamer core that the plugin was compiled for, you can just use GST_VERSION_MAJOR here

parameter.name: minor_version
parameter.parameter_description: the minor version number of the GStreamer core that the plugin was compiled for, you can just use GST_VERSION_MINOR here

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: a unique name of the plugin (ideally prefixed with an application- or library-specific namespace prefix in order to avoid name conflicts in case a similar plugin with the same name ever gets added to GStreamer)

parameter.name: init_full_func
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the init function with user data of this plugin.

parameter.name: license
parameter.parameter_description: effective license of plugin. Must be one of the approved licenses (see #GstPluginDesc above) or the plugin will not be registered.

function.return: TRUE if the plugin was registered correctly, otherwise FALSE.

function.name: gst_plugin_set_cache_data
function.description:
Adds plugin specific data to cache. Passes the ownership of the structure to the @plugin.
The cache is flushed every time the registry is rebuilt.

parameter.name: cache_data
parameter.parameter_description: a structure containing the data to cache

function.name: gst_plugins_base_version
function.description: Gets the version number of the GStreamer Plugins Base libraries.

parameter.name: major
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the major version number, or %NULL

parameter.name: minor
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the minor version number, or %NULL

parameter.name: micro
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the micro version number, or %NULL

parameter.name: nano
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the nano version number, or %NULL

function.name: gst_plugins_base_version_string
function.description: This function returns a string that is useful for describing this version of GStreamer's gst-plugins-base libraries to the outside world: user agent strings, logging, about dialogs ...
function.return: a newly allocated string describing this version of gst-plugins-base

function.name: gst_poll_add_fd
function.description: Add a file descriptor to the file descriptor set.
function.return: %TRUE if the file descriptor was successfully added to the set.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_can_read
function.description: Check if @fd in @set has data to be read.
function.return: %TRUE if the descriptor has data to be read.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_can_write
function.description: Check if @fd in @set can be used for writing.
function.return: %TRUE if the descriptor can be used for writing.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_ctl_read
function.description: Control whether the descriptor @fd in @set will be monitored for readability.
function.return: %TRUE if the descriptor was successfully updated.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_ctl_write
function.description: Control whether the descriptor @fd in @set will be monitored for writability.
function.return: %TRUE if the descriptor was successfully updated.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_has_closed
function.description: Check if @fd in @set has closed the connection.
function.return: %TRUE if the connection was closed.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_has_error
function.description: Check if @fd in @set has an error.
function.return: %TRUE if the descriptor has an error.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_ignored
function.description:
Mark @fd as ignored so that the next call to gst_poll_wait() will yield the same result for @fd as last time. This function must be called if no operation (read/write/recv/send/etc.) will be performed on @fd before the next call to gst_poll_wait().
The reason why this is needed is because the underlying implementation might not allow querying the fd more than once between calls to one of the re-enabling operations.

function.name: gst_poll_fd_init
function.description: Initializes @fd. Alternatively you can initialize it with #GST_POLL_FD_INIT.

function.name: gst_poll_free
function.description: Free a file descriptor set.

function.name: gst_poll_get_read_gpollfd
function.description: Get a GPollFD for the reading part of the control socket. This is useful when integrating with a GSource and GMainLoop.

function.name: gst_poll_new
function.description:
Create a new file descriptor set. If @controllable, it is possible to restart or flush a call to gst_poll_wait() with gst_poll_restart() and gst_poll_set_flushing() respectively.
Free-function: gst_poll_free

parameter.name: controllable
parameter.parameter_description: whether it should be possible to control a wait.

function.return: a new #GstPoll, or %NULL in case of an error. Free with gst_poll_free().

function.name: gst_poll_new_timer
function.description:
Create a new poll object that can be used for scheduling cancellable timeouts.
A timeout is performed with gst_poll_wait(). Multiple timeouts can be performed from different threads.
Free-function: gst_poll_free
function.return: a new #GstPoll, or %NULL in case of an error. Free with gst_poll_free().

function.name: gst_poll_read_control
function.description: Read a byte from the control socket of the controllable @set. This function is mostly useful for timer #GstPoll objects created with gst_poll_new_timer().
function.return: %TRUE on success. %FALSE when @set is not controllable or when there was no byte to read.

function.name: gst_poll_remove_fd
function.description: Remove a file descriptor from the file descriptor set.
function.return: %TRUE if the file descriptor was successfully removed from the set.

function.name: gst_poll_restart
function.description:
Restart any gst_poll_wait() that is in progress. This function is typically used after adding or removing descriptors to @set.
If @set is not controllable, then this call will have no effect.

function.name: gst_poll_set_controllable
function.description: When @controllable is %TRUE, this function ensures that future calls to gst_poll_wait() will be affected by gst_poll_restart() and gst_poll_set_flushing().
function.return: %TRUE if the controllability of @set could be updated.

function.name: gst_poll_set_flushing
function.description:
When @flushing is %TRUE, this function ensures that current and future calls to gst_poll_wait() will return -1, with errno set to EBUSY.
Unsetting the flushing state will restore normal operation of @set.

function.name: gst_poll_wait
function.description:
Wait for activity on the file descriptors in @set. This function waits up to the specified @timeout. A timeout of #GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE waits forever.
For #GstPoll objects created with gst_poll_new(), this function can only be called from a single thread at a time. If called from multiple threads, -1 will be returned with errno set to EPERM.
This is not true for timer #GstPoll objects created with gst_poll_new_timer(), where it is allowed to have multiple threads waiting simultaneously.
function.return: The number of #GstPollFD in @set that have activity or 0 when no activity was detected after @timeout. If an error occurs, -1 is returned and errno is set.

function.name: gst_poll_write_control
function.description:
Write a byte to the control socket of the controllable @set. This function is mostly useful for timer #GstPoll objects created with gst_poll_new_timer().
It will make any current and future gst_poll_wait() function return with 1, meaning the control socket is set. After an equal amount of calls to gst_poll_read_control() have been performed, calls to gst_poll_wait() will block again until their timeout expired.
function.return: %TRUE on success. %FALSE when @set is not controllable or when the byte could not be written.

function.name: gst_preset_delete_preset
function.description: Delete the given preset.
function.return: %TRUE for success, %FALSE if e.g. there is no preset with that @name

function.name: gst_preset_get_meta
function.description: Gets the @value for an existing meta data @tag. Meta data @tag names can be something like e.g. "comment". Returned values need to be released when done.
function.return: %TRUE for success, %FALSE if e.g. there is no preset with that @name or no value for the given @tag

function.name: gst_preset_get_preset_names
function.description: Get a copy of preset names as a NULL terminated string array.
function.return: list with names, ue g_strfreev() after usage.

function.name: gst_preset_get_property_names
function.description: Get a the names of the GObject properties that can be used for presets.
function.return: an array of property names which should be freed with g_strfreev() after use.

function.name: gst_preset_load_preset
function.description: Load the given preset.
function.return: %TRUE for success, %FALSE if e.g. there is no preset with that @name

function.name: gst_preset_rename_preset
function.description: Renames a preset. If there is already a preset by the @new_name it will be overwritten.
function.return: %TRUE for success, %FALSE if e.g. there is no preset with @old_name

function.name: gst_preset_save_preset
function.description: Save the current object settings as a preset under the given name. If there is already a preset by this @name it will be overwritten.
function.return: %TRUE for success, %FALSE

function.name: gst_preset_set_meta
function.return: %TRUE for success, %FALSE if e.g. there is no preset with that @name

function.name: gst_print_element_args
function.description: Print the element argument in a human readable format in the given GString.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer to print the args in

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: the element to print the args of

function.name: gst_print_pad_caps
function.description: Write the pad capabilities in a human readable format into the given GString.

parameter.name: buf
parameter.parameter_description: the buffer to print the caps in

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad to print the caps from

function.name: gst_property_probe_get_properties
function.description: Get a list of properties for which probing is supported.

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe to get the properties for.

function.return: the list of properties for which probing is supported by this element.

function.name: gst_property_probe_get_property
function.description: Get #GParamSpec for a property for which probing is supported.

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe to get the properties for.

function.return: the #GParamSpec of %NULL.

function.name: gst_property_probe_get_values
function.description: Gets the possible (probed) values for the given property, requires the property to have been probed before.
function.return: A list of valid values for the given property.

function.name: gst_property_probe_get_values_name
function.description: Same as gst_property_probe_get_values ().

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to get values for.

function.return: A list of valid values for the given property.

function.name: gst_property_probe_needs_probe
function.description: Checks whether a property needs a probe. This might be because the property wasn't initialized before, or because host setup changed. This might be, for example, because a new device was added, and thus device probing needs to be refreshed to display the new device.

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe object to which the given property belongs.

parameter.name: pspec
parameter.parameter_description: a #GParamSpec that identifies the property to check.

function.return: TRUE if the property needs a new probe, FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_property_probe_needs_probe_name
function.description: Same as gst_property_probe_needs_probe ().

parameter.name: probe
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstPropertyProbe object to which the given property belongs.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to check.

function.return: TRUE if the property needs a new probe, FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_property_probe_probe_and_get_values
function.description: Check whether the given property requires a new probe. If so, fo the probe. After that, retrieve a value list. Meant as a utility function that wraps the above functions.
function.return: the list of valid values for this property.

function.name: gst_property_probe_probe_and_get_values_name
function.description: Same as gst_property_probe_probe_and_get_values ().

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property to get values for.

function.return: the list of valid values for this property.

function.name: gst_property_probe_probe_property
function.description: Runs a probe on the property specified by @pspec

function.name: gst_property_probe_probe_property_name
function.description: Runs a probe on the property specified by @name.

function.name: gst_proxy_pad_save_thyself
function.description: Saves the ghost pad into an xml representation.

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the parent #xmlNodePtr to save the description in.

function.return: the #xmlNodePtr representation of the pad.

function.name: gst_query_add_buffering_range
function.description: Set the buffering-ranges array field in @query. The current last start position of the array should be inferior to @start.
function.return: a #gboolean indicating if the range was added or not.

function.name: gst_query_get_n_buffering_ranges
function.description: Retrieve the number of values currently stored in the buffered-ranges array of the query's structure.
function.return: the range array size as a #guint.

function.name: gst_query_get_structure
function.description: Get the structure of a query.
function.return: the #GstStructure of the query. The structure is still owned by the query and will therefore be freed when the query is unreffed.

function.name: gst_query_new_application
function.description:
Constructs a new custom application query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it.
Free-function: gst_query_unref
function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_buffering
function.description:
Constructs a new query object for querying the buffering status of a stream.
Free-function: gst_query_new

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the default #GstFormat for the new query

function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_convert
function.description:
Constructs a new convert query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it. A convert query is used to ask for a conversion between one format and another.
Free-function: gst_query_unref

parameter.name: src_format
parameter.parameter_description: the source #GstFormat for the new query

function.return: a #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_duration
function.description:
Constructs a new stream duration query object to query in the given format. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it. A duration query will give the total length of the stream.
Free-function: gst_query_unref
function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_formats
function.description:
Constructs a new query object for querying formats of the stream.
Free-function: gst_query_unref
function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_latency
function.description:
Constructs a new latency query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it. A latency query is usually performed by sinks to compensate for additional latency introduced by elements in the pipeline.
Free-function: gst_query_unref
function.return: a #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_position
function.description:
Constructs a new query stream position query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it. A position query is used to query the current position of playback in the streams, in some format.
Free-function: gst_query_unref

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the default #GstFormat for the new query

function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_seeking
function.description:
Constructs a new query object for querying seeking properties of the stream.
Free-function: gst_query_unref

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the default #GstFormat for the new query

function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_segment
function.description:
Constructs a new segment query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it. A segment query is used to discover information about the currently configured segment for playback.
Free-function: gst_query_unref
function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_new_uri
function.description:
Constructs a new query URI query object. Use gst_query_unref() when done with it. An URI query is used to query the current URI that is used by the source or sink.
Free-function: gst_query_unref
function.return: a new #GstQuery

function.name: gst_query_parse_buffering_percent

function.name: gst_query_set_buffering_percent
function.description: Set the percentage of buffered data. This is a value between 0 and 100. The @busy indicator is %TRUE when the buffering is in progress.

function.name: gst_query_set_buffering_range
function.description: Set the available query result fields in @query.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the format to set for the @start and @stop values

parameter.name: estimated_total
parameter.parameter_description: estimated total amount of download time

function.name: gst_query_set_buffering_stats
function.description: Configures the buffering stats values in @query.

function.name: gst_query_set_convert
function.description: Answer a convert query by setting the requested values.

function.name: gst_query_set_duration
function.description: Answer a duration query by setting the requested value in the given format.

function.description: Set the formats query result fields in @query. The number of formats passed must be equal to @n_formats.

parameter.name: n_formats
parameter.parameter_description: the number of formats to set.

function.name: gst_query_set_formatsv
function.description: Set the formats query result fields in @query. The number of formats passed in the @formats array must be equal to @n_formats.

parameter.name: n_formats
parameter.parameter_description: the number of formats to set.

function.name: gst_query_set_latency
function.description: Answer a latency query by setting the requested values in the given format.

parameter.name: live
parameter.parameter_description: if there is a live element upstream

parameter.name: min_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the minimal latency of the live element

parameter.name: max_latency
parameter.parameter_description: the maximal latency of the live element

function.name: gst_query_set_position
function.description: Answer a position query by setting the requested value in the given format.

function.name: gst_query_set_seeking
function.description: Set the seeking query result fields in @query.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the format to set for the @segment_start and @segment_end values

function.name: gst_query_set_segment

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstFormat of the segment values (@start_value and @stop_value)

function.name: gst_query_set_uri
function.description: Answer a URI query by setting the requested URI.

function.name: gst_query_type_get_by_nick
function.description: Get the query type registered with @nick.
