function.name: gst_task_cleanup_all
function.description:
Wait for all tasks to be stopped. This is mainly used internally to ensure proper cleanup of internal data structures in test suites.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_create
function.description:
Create a new Task that will repeatedly call the provided @func with @data as a parameter. Typically the task will run in a new thread.
The function cannot be changed after the task has been created. You must create a new #GstTask to change the function.
This function will not yet create and start a thread. Use gst_task_start() or gst_task_pause() to create and start the GThread.
Before the task can be used, a #GStaticRecMutex must be configured using the gst_task_set_lock() function. This lock will always be acquired while @func is called.
function.return:
A new #GstTask.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_get_pool
function.description:
Get the #GstTaskPool that this task will use for its streaming threads.
MT safe.
function.return: the #GstTaskPool used by @task. gst_object_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_task_get_state
function.description: Get the current state of the task.
function.return:
The #GstTaskState of the task
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_join
function.description:
Joins @task. After this call, it is safe to unref the task and clean up the lock set with gst_task_set_lock().
The task will automatically be stopped with this call.
This function cannot be called from within a task function as this would cause a deadlock. The function will detect this and print a g_warning.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be joined.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pause
function.description: Pauses @task. This method can also be called on a task in the stopped state, in which case a thread will be started and will remain in the paused state. This function does not wait for the task to complete the paused state.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be paused.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pool_cleanup
function.description:
Wait for all tasks to be stopped. This is mainly used internally to ensure proper cleanup of internal data structures in test suites.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pool_join
function.description: Join a task and/or return it to the pool. @id is the id obtained from gst_task_pool_push().

function.name: gst_task_pool_new
function.description: Create a new default task pool. The default task pool will use a regular GThreadPool for threads.
function.return: a new #GstTaskPool. gst_object_unref() after usage.

function.name: gst_task_pool_prepare
function.description:
Prepare the taskpool for accepting gst_task_pool_push() operations.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_pool_push
function.description: Start the execution of a new thread from @pool.
function.return: a pointer that should be used for the gst_task_pool_join function. This pointer can be NULL, you must check @error to detect errors.

function.name: gst_task_set_lock
function.description:
Set the mutex used by the task. The mutex will be acquired before calling the #GstTaskFunction.
This function has to be called before calling gst_task_pause() or gst_task_start().
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_set_pool
function.description:
Set @pool as the new GstTaskPool for @task. Any new streaming threads that will be created by @task will now use @pool.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_set_priority
function.description:
Changes the priority of @task to @priority.
Note: try not to depend on task priorities.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_set_state
function.description:
Sets the state of @task to @state.
The @task must have a lock associated with it using gst_task_set_lock() when going to GST_TASK_STARTED or GST_TASK_PAUSED or this function will return %FALSE.
MT safe.
function.return: %TRUE if the state could be changed.

function.name: gst_task_set_thread_callbacks
function.description:
Set callbacks which will be executed when a new thread is needed, the thread function is entered and left and when the thread is joined.
By default a thread for @task will be created from a default thread pool.
Objects can use custom GThreads or can perform additional configuration of the threads (such as changing the thread priority) by installing callbacks.
MT safe.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data passed to the callbacks

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: called when @user_data is no longer referenced

function.name: gst_task_start
function.description: Starts @task. The @task must have a lock associated with it using gst_task_set_lock() or this function will return %FALSE.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be started.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_task_stop
function.description: Stops @task. This method merely schedules the task to stop and will not wait for the task to have completely stopped. Use gst_task_join() to stop and wait for completion.
function.return:
%TRUE if the task could be stopped.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_trace_destroy
function.description: Flush an close the previously allocated @trace.

function.name: gst_trace_flush
gst_trace_new
function.description:
Create a ringbuffer of @size in the file with @filename to store trace results in.
Free-function: gst_trace_destroy

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the max size of the file

function.return: a new #GstTrace.

function.name: gst_trace_read_tsc
function.description: Read a platform independent timer value that can be used in benchmarks.

function.name: gst_trace_set_default
function.description: Set the default #GstTrace to @trace.

parameter.name: trace
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTrace to set as the default.

function.name: gst_trace_text_flush
function.description: Flush any pending trace entries in @trace to the trace file, formatted as a text line with timestamp and sequence numbers. @trace can be NULL in which case the default #GstTrace will be flushed.

function.name: gst_tuner_channel_changed
function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the current channel changes. Fires the #GstTuner::channel-changed signal.

function.name: gst_tuner_find_channel_by_name
function.description: Look up a #GstTunerChannel by name.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: A string containing the name of a #GstTunerChannel

function.return: A #GstTunerChannel, or NULL if no channel with the provided name is available.

function.name: gst_tuner_find_norm_by_name
function.description: Look up a #GstTunerNorm by name.

parameter.name: norm
parameter.parameter_description: A string containing the name of a #GstTunerNorm

function.return: A #GstTunerNorm, or NULL if no norm with the provided name is available.

function.name: gst_tuner_frequency_changed
function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the configured frequency changes. Fires the #GstTuner::frequency-changed signal on the tuner, and the #GstTunerChannel::frequency-changed signal on the channel.

function.name: gst_tuner_get_channel
function.description: Retrieve the current channel from the tuner.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the current channel from.

function.return: the current channel of the tuner object.

function.name: gst_tuner_get_frequency
function.description: Retrieve the current frequency from the given channel. As for gst_tuner_set_frequency(), the #GstTunerChannel must support frequency operations, as indicated by the GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY flag.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTunerChannel to retrieve the frequency from.

function.return: The current frequency, or 0 on error.

function.name: gst_tuner_get_norm
function.description: Get the current video norm from the given tuner object for the currently selected channel.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the current norm from.

function.return: the current norm.

function.name: gst_tuner_list_channels
function.description: Retrieve a #GList of #GstTunerChannels available (e.g. 'composite', 's-video', ...) from the given tuner object.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to get the channels from.

function.return: A list of channels available on this tuner. The list is owned by the GstTuner and must not be freed.

function.name: gst_tuner_list_norms
function.description: Retrieve a GList of available #GstTunerNorm settings for the currently tuned channel on the given tuner object.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (*a #GstElement) to get the list of norms from.

function.return: A list of norms available on the current channel for this tuner object. The list is owned by the GstTuner and must not be freed.

function.name: gst_tuner_norm_changed
function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the current norm changes. Fires the #GstTuner::norm-changed signal.

function.name: gst_tuner_set_channel
function.description: Tunes the object to the given channel, which should be one of the channels returned by gst_tuner_list_channels().

function.name: gst_tuner_set_frequency
function.description:
Sets a tuning frequency on the given tuner/channel. Note that this requires the given channel to be a "tuning" channel, which can be checked using GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_HAS_FLAG (), with the proper flag being GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY.
The frequency is in Hz, with minimum steps indicated by the frequency_multiplicator provided in the #GstTunerChannel. The valid range is provided in the min_frequency and max_frequency properties of the #GstTunerChannel.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTunerChannel to set the frequency on.

parameter.name: frequency
parameter.parameter_description: The frequency to tune in to.

function.name: gst_tuner_set_norm
function.description: Changes the video norm on this tuner to the given norm, which should be one of the norms returned by gst_tuner_list_norms().

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) to set the norm on.

parameter.name: norm
parameter.parameter_description: the norm to use for the current channel.

function.name: gst_tuner_signal_changed
function.description: Called by elements implementing the #GstTuner interface when the incoming signal strength changes. Fires the #GstTuner::signal-changed signal on the tuner and the #GstTunerChannel::signal-changed signal on the channel.

function.name: gst_tuner_signal_strength
function.description:
Get the strength of the signal on this channel. Note that this requires the current channel to be a "tuning" channel, i.e. a channel on which frequency can be set. This can be checked using GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_HAS_FLAG (), and the appropriate flag to check for is GST_TUNER_CHANNEL_FREQUENCY.
The valid range of the signal strength is indicated in the min_signal and max_signal properties of the #GstTunerChannel.

parameter.name: tuner
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTuner (a #GstElement) that owns the given channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstTunerChannel to get the signal strength from.

function.return: Signal strength, or 0 on error.

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_call_function
function.description: Calls the #GstTypeFindFunction associated with this factory.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: a properly setup #GstTypeFind entry. The get_data and suggest_type members must be set.

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_get_caps
function.description: Gets the #GstCaps associated with a typefind factory.
function.return: the #GstCaps associated with this factory

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_get_extensions
function.description: Gets the extensions associated with a #GstTypeFindFactory. The returned array should not be changed. If you need to change stuff in it, you should copy it using g_strdupv(). This function may return NULL to indicate a 0-length list.
function.return: a NULL-terminated array of extensions associated with this factory

function.name: gst_type_find_factory_get_list
function.description:
Gets the list of all registered typefind factories. You must free the list using gst_plugin_feature_list_free().
The returned factories are sorted by highest rank first, and then by factory name. (behaviour change since 0.10.26)
Free-function: gst_plugin_feature_list_free
function.return: the list of all registered #GstTypeFindFactory.

function.name: gst_type_find_get_length
function.description: Get the length of the data stream.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind the function was called with

function.return: The length of the data stream, or 0 if it is not available.

function.name: gst_type_find_helper
function.description:
Tries to find what type of data is flowing from the given source #GstPad.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref
function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data stream. Returns #NULL if no #GstCaps matches the data stream.

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_for_buffer
function.description:
Tries to find what type of data is contained in the given #GstBuffer, the assumption being that the buffer represents the beginning of the stream or file.
All available typefinders will be called on the data in order of rank. If a typefinding function returns a probability of #GST_TYPE_FIND_MAXIMUM, typefinding is stopped immediately and the found caps will be returned right away. Otherwise, all available typefind functions will the tried, and the caps with the highest probability will be returned, or #NULL if the content of the buffer could not be identified.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: object doing the typefinding, or NULL (used for logging)

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or #NULL

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data, or #NULL if no type could be found. The caller should free the caps returned with gst_caps_unref().

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_for_extension
function.description:
Tries to find the best #GstCaps associated with @extension.
All available typefinders will be checked against the extension in order of rank. The caps of the first typefinder that can handle @extension will be returned.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: object doing the typefinding, or NULL (used for logging)

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to @extension, or #NULL if no type could be found. The caller should free the caps returned with gst_caps_unref().

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_get_range
function.description:
Utility function to do pull-based typefinding. Unlike gst_type_find_helper() however, this function will use the specified function @func to obtain the data needed by the typefind functions, rather than operating on a given source pad. This is useful mostly for elements like tag demuxers which strip off data at the beginning and/or end of a file and want to typefind the stripped data stream before adding their own source pad (the specified callback can then call the upstream peer pad with offsets adjusted for the tag size, for example).
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject that will be passed as first argument to @func

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A generic #GstTypeFindHelperGetRangeFunction that will be used to access data at random offsets when doing the typefinding

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or #NULL

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data stream. Returns #NULL if no #GstCaps matches the data stream.

function.name: gst_type_find_helper_get_range_ext
function.description:
Utility function to do pull-based typefinding. Unlike gst_type_find_helper() however, this function will use the specified function @func to obtain the data needed by the typefind functions, rather than operating on a given source pad. This is useful mostly for elements like tag demuxers which strip off data at the beginning and/or end of a file and want to typefind the stripped data stream before adding their own source pad (the specified callback can then call the upstream peer pad with offsets adjusted for the tag size, for example).
When @extension is not NULL, this function will first try the typefind functions for the given extension, which might speed up the typefinding in many cases.
Free-function: gst_caps_unref

parameter.name: obj
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstObject that will be passed as first argument to @func

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A generic #GstTypeFindHelperGetRangeFunction that will be used to access data at random offsets when doing the typefinding

parameter.name: prob
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the probability of the found caps, or #NULL

function.return: the #GstCaps corresponding to the data stream. Returns #NULL if no #GstCaps matches the data stream.

function.name: gst_type_find_peek
function.description: Returns the @size bytes of the stream to identify beginning at offset. If offset is a positive number, the offset is relative to the beginning of the stream, if offset is a negative number the offset is relative to the end of the stream. The returned memory is valid until the typefinding function returns and must not be freed.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: The number of bytes to return

function.return: the requested data, or NULL if that data is not available.

function.name: gst_type_find_register
function.description: Registers a new typefind function to be used for typefinding. After registering this function will be available for typefinding. This function is typically called during an element's plugin initialization.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.parameter_description: A #GstPlugin, or NULL for a static typefind function (note that passing NULL only works in GStreamer 0.10.16 and later)

parameter.name: rank
parameter.parameter_description: The rank (or importance) of this typefind function

parameter.name: extensions
parameter.parameter_description: Optional extensions that could belong to this type

parameter.name: possible_caps
parameter.parameter_description: Optionally the caps that could be returned when typefinding succeeds

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: Optional user data. This user data must be available until the plugin is unloaded.

parameter.name: data_notify
parameter.parameter_description: a #GDestroyNotify that will be called on @data when the plugin is unloaded.

function.return: TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_type_find_suggest
function.description: If a #GstTypeFindFunction calls this function it suggests the caps with the given probability. A #GstTypeFindFunction may supply different suggestions in one call. It is up to the caller of the #GstTypeFindFunction to interpret these values.

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: probability
parameter.parameter_description: The probability in percent that the suggestion is right

function.name: gst_type_find_suggest_simple
function.description:
If a #GstTypeFindFunction calls this function it suggests the caps with the given probability. A #GstTypeFindFunction may supply different suggestions in one call. It is up to the caller of the #GstTypeFindFunction to interpret these values.
This function is similar to gst_type_find_suggest(), only that instead of passing a #GstCaps argument you can create the caps on the fly in the same way as you can with gst_caps_new_simple().
Make sure you terminate the list of arguments with a NULL argument and that the values passed have the correct type (in terms of width in bytes when passed to the vararg function - this applies particularly to gdouble and guint64 arguments).

parameter.name: find
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstTypeFind object the function was called with

parameter.name: probability
parameter.parameter_description: The probability in percent that the suggestion is right

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.parameter_description: the media type of the suggested caps

parameter.name: fieldname
parameter.parameter_description: first field of the suggested caps, or NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: additional arguments to the suggested caps in the same format as the arguments passed to gst_structure_new() (ie. triplets of field name, field GType and field value)

function.name: gst_type_register_static_full
function.description:
Helper function which constructs a #GTypeInfo structure and registers a GType, but which generates less linker overhead than a static const #GTypeInfo structure. For further details of the parameters, please see #GTypeInfo in the GLib documentation.
Registers type_name as the name of a new static type derived from parent_type. The value of flags determines the nature (e.g. abstract or not) of the type. It works by filling a GTypeInfo struct and calling g_type_register_static().

parameter.name: parent_type
parameter.parameter_description: The GType of the parent type the newly registered type will derive from

parameter.name: type_name
parameter.parameter_description: NULL-terminated string used as the name of the new type

parameter.name: base_init
parameter.parameter_description: Location of the base initialization function (optional).

parameter.name: base_finalize
parameter.parameter_description: Location of the base finalization function (optional).

parameter.name: class_init
parameter.parameter_description: Location of the class initialization function for class types Location of the default vtable inititalization function for interface types. (optional)

parameter.name: class_finalize
parameter.parameter_description: Location of the class finalization function for class types. Location of the default vtable finalization function for interface types. (optional)

parameter.name: class_data
parameter.parameter_description: User-supplied data passed to the class init/finalize functions.

parameter.name: instance_size
parameter.parameter_description: Size of the instance (object) structure (required for instantiatable types only).

parameter.name: n_preallocs
parameter.parameter_description: The number of pre-allocated (cached) instances to reserve memory for (0 indicates no caching). Ignored on recent GLib's.

parameter.name: instance_init
parameter.parameter_description: Location of the instance initialization function (optional, for instantiatable types only).

parameter.name: value_table
parameter.parameter_description: A GTypeValueTable function table for generic handling of GValues of this type (usually only useful for fundamental types).

function.return: A #GType for the newly-registered type.

function.name: gst_update_registry
function.description:
Forces GStreamer to re-scan its plugin paths and update the default plugin registry.
Applications will almost never need to call this function, it is only useful if the application knows new plugins have been installed (or old ones removed) since the start of the application (or, to be precise, the first call to gst_init()) and the application wants to make use of any newly-installed plugins without restarting the application.
Applications should assume that the registry update is neither atomic nor thread-safe and should therefore not have any dynamic pipelines running (including the playbin and decodebin elements) and should also not create any elements or access the GStreamer registry while the update is in progress.
Note that this function may block for a significant amount of time.
function.return: %TRUE if the registry has been updated successfully (does not imply that there were changes), otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gst_uri_construct
function.description:
Constructs a URI for a given valid protocol and location.
Free-function: g_free
function.return: a new string for this URI. Returns NULL if the given URI protocol is not valid, or the given location is NULL.

function.name: gst_uri_get_location
function.description:
Extracts the location out of a given valid URI, ie. the protocol and "://" are stripped from the URI, which means that the location returned includes the hostname if one is specified. The returned string must be freed using g_free().
Free-function: g_free
function.return: the location for this URI. Returns NULL if the URI isn't valid. If the URI does not contain a location, an empty string is returned.

function.name: gst_uri_get_protocol
function.description: Extracts the protocol out of a given valid URI. The returned string must be freed using g_free().
function.return: The protocol for this URI.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_get_protocols
function.description: Gets the list of protocols supported by @handler. This list may not be modified.
function.return: the supported protocols. Returns NULL if the @handler isn't implemented properly, or the @handler doesn't support any protocols.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_get_uri
function.description: Gets the currently handled URI.
function.return: the URI currently handled by the @handler. Returns NULL if there are no URI currently handled. The returned string must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_get_uri_type
function.description: Gets the type of the given URI handler
function.return: the #GstURIType of the URI handler. Returns #GST_URI_UNKNOWN if the @handler isn't implemented correctly.

function.name: gst_uri_handler_new_uri
function.description: Emits the new-uri signal for a given handler, when that handler has a new URI. This function should only be called by URI handlers themselves.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: new URI or NULL if it was unset

function.name: gst_uri_handler_set_uri
function.description: Tries to set the URI of the given handler.
function.return: TRUE if the URI was set successfully, else FALSE.

function.name: gst_uri_has_protocol
function.description: Checks if the protocol of a given valid URI matches @protocol.
function.return: %TRUE if the protocol matches.

function.name: gst_uri_is_valid
function.description: Tests if the given string is a valid URI identifier. URIs start with a valid scheme followed by ":" and maybe a string identifying the location.
function.return: TRUE if the string is a valid URI

function.name: gst_uri_protocol_is_supported
function.description: Checks if an element exists that supports the given URI protocol. Note that a positive return value does not imply that a subsequent call to gst_element_make_from_uri() is guaranteed to work.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to check for a source or a sink

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: Protocol that should be checked for (e.g. "http" or "smb")

function.return: TRUE

function.name: gst_uri_protocol_is_valid
function.description: Tests if the given string is a valid protocol identifier. Protocols must consist of alphanumeric characters, '+', '-' and '.' and must start with a alphabetic character. See RFC 3986 Section 3.1.
function.return: TRUE if the string is a valid protocol identifier, FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gst_util_array_binary_search
function.description:
Searches inside @array for @search_data by using the comparison function @search_func. @array must be sorted ascending.
As @search_data is always passed as second argument to @search_func it's not required that @search_data has the same type as the array elements.
The complexity of this search function is O(log (num_elements)).

parameter.name: num_elements
parameter.parameter_description: number of elements in the array

parameter.name: element_size
parameter.parameter_description: size of every element in bytes

parameter.name: search_func
parameter.parameter_description: function to compare two elements, @search_data will always be passed as second argument

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: search mode that should be used

function.return: The address of the found element or %NULL if nothing was found

function.name: gst_util_double_to_fraction
function.description: Transforms a #gdouble to a fraction and simplifies the result.

parameter.name: dest_n
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #gint to hold the result numerator

parameter.name: dest_d
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #gint to hold the result denominator

function.name: gst_util_dump_mem
function.description: Dumps the memory block into a hex representation. Useful for debugging.

parameter.name: mem
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the memory to dump

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the memory block to dump

function.name: gst_util_fraction_add
function.description: Adds the fractions @a_n/@a_d and @b_n/@b_d and stores the result in @res_n and @res_d.

parameter.name: res_n
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result numerator

parameter.name: res_d
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result denominator

function.return: %FALSE on overflow, %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_util_fraction_compare
function.description: Compares the fractions @a_n/@a_d and @b_n/@b_d and returns -1 if a < b, 0 if a = b and 1 if a > b.
function.return: -1 if a < b; 0 if a = b; 1 if a > b.

function.name: gst_util_fraction_multiply
function.description: Multiplies the fractions @a_n/@a_d and @b_n/@b_d and stores the result in @res_n and @res_d.

parameter.name: res_n
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result numerator

parameter.name: res_d
parameter.parameter_description: Pointer to #gint to hold the result denominator

function.return: %FALSE on overflow, %TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_util_fraction_to_double
function.description: Transforms a fraction to a #gdouble.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #gdouble for the result

function.name: gst_util_get_timestamp
function.description: Get a timestamp as GstClockTime to be used for interval meassurements. The timestamp should not be interpreted in any other way.
function.return: the timestamp

function.name: gst_util_greatest_common_divisor
function.description: Calculates the greatest common divisor of @a and @b.
function.return: Greatest common divisor of @a and @b

function.name: gst_util_seqnum_compare
function.description:
Compare two sequence numbers, handling wraparound.
The current implementation just returns (gint32)(@s1 - @s2).
function.return: A negative number if @s1 is before @s2, 0 if they are equal, or a positive number if @s1 is after @s2.

function.name: gst_util_seqnum_next
function.description:
Return a constantly incrementing sequence number.
This function is used internally to GStreamer to be able to determine which events and messages are "the same". For example, elements may set the seqnum on a segment-done message to be the same as that of the last seek event, to indicate that event and the message correspond to the same segment.
function.return: A constantly incrementing 32-bit unsigned integer, which might overflow back to 0 at some point. Use gst_util_seqnum_compare() to make sure you handle wraparound correctly.

function.name: gst_util_set_object_arg
function.description:
Convertes the string value to the type of the objects argument and sets the argument with it.
Note that this function silently returns if @object has no property named @name or when @value cannot be converted to the type of the property.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the object to set the argument of

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the argument to set

function.name: gst_util_set_value_from_string
function.description:
Converts the string to the type of the value and sets the value with it.
Note that this function is dangerous as it does not return any indication if the conversion worked or not.

parameter.name: value_str
parameter.parameter_description: the string to get the value from

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale
function.description:
Scale @val by the rational number @num / @denom, avoiding overflows and underflows and without loss of precision.
This function can potentially be very slow if val and num are both greater than G_MAXUINT32.

parameter.name: num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the scale ratio

parameter.name: denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the scale ratio

function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer it is truncated. See also gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil
function.description:
Scale @val by the rational number @num / @denom, avoiding overflows and underflows and without loss of precision.
This function can potentially be very slow if val and num are both greater than G_MAXUINT32.

parameter.name: num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the scale ratio

parameter.name: denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the scale ratio

function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded up. See also gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_int
function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is truncated. See also gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil
function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded up. See also gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round
function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded to the nearest integer (half-way cases are rounded up). See also gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil().

function.name: gst_util_uint64_scale_round
function.description:
Scale @val by the rational number @num / @denom, avoiding overflows and underflows and without loss of precision.
This function can potentially be very slow if val and num are both greater than G_MAXUINT32.

parameter.name: num
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator of the scale ratio

parameter.name: denom
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator of the scale ratio

function.return: @val * @num / @denom. In the case of an overflow, this function returns G_MAXUINT64. If the result is not exactly representable as an integer, it is rounded to the nearest integer (half-way cases are rounded up). See also gst_util_uint64_scale(), gst_util_uint64_scale_ceil(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_round(), gst_util_uint64_scale_int_ceil().

function.name: gst_value_array_append_value
function.description: Appends @append_value to the GstValueArray in @value.

function.name: gst_value_array_get_size
function.description: Gets the number of values contained in @value.
function.return: the number of values

function.name: gst_value_array_get_value
function.description: Gets the value that is a member of the array contained in @value and has the index @index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: index of value to get from the array

function.return: the value at the given index

function.name: gst_value_array_prepend_value
function.description: Prepends @prepend_value to the GstValueArray in @value.

function.name: gst_value_can_compare
function.description: Determines if @value1 and @value2 can be compared.
function.return: TRUE if the values can be compared

function.name: gst_value_can_intersect
function.description: Determines if intersecting two values will produce a valid result. Two values will produce a valid intersection if they have the same type, or if there is a method (registered by gst_value_register_intersect_func()) to calculate the intersection.
function.return: TRUE if the values can intersect

function.name: gst_value_can_subtract
function.description: Checks if it's possible to subtract @subtrahend from @minuend.
function.return: TRUE if a subtraction is possible

function.name: gst_value_can_union
function.description: Determines if @value1 and @value2 can be non-trivially unioned. Any two values can be trivially unioned by adding both of them to a GstValueList. However, certain types have the possibility to be unioned in a simpler way. For example, an integer range and an integer can be unioned if the integer is a subset of the integer range. If there is the possibility that two values can be unioned, this function returns TRUE.
function.return: TRUE if there is a function allowing the two values to be unioned.

function.name: gst_value_compare
function.description: Compares @value1 and @value2. If @value1 and @value2 cannot be compared, the function returns GST_VALUE_UNORDERED. Otherwise, if @value1 is greater than @value2, GST_VALUE_GREATER_THAN is returned. If @value1 is less than @value2, GST_VALUE_LESS_THAN is returned. If the values are equal, GST_VALUE_EQUAL is returned.
function.return: comparison result

function.name: gst_value_deserialize
function.description: Tries to deserialize a string into the type specified by the given GValue. If the operation succeeds, TRUE is returned, FALSE otherwise.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: #GValue to fill with contents of deserialization

function.return: TRUE on success

function.name: gst_value_dup_mini_object
function.description: Get the contents of a %GST_TYPE_MINI_OBJECT derived #GValue, increasing its reference count. If the contents of the #GValue are %NULL, %NULL will be returned.
function.return: mini object contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_fraction_multiply
function.description: Multiplies the two #GValue items containing a #GST_TYPE_FRACTION and sets @product to the product of the two fractions.
function.return: FALSE in case of an error (like integer overflow), TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_value_fraction_subtract
function.description: Subtracts the @subtrahend from the @minuend and sets @dest to the result.
function.return: FALSE in case of an error (like integer overflow), TRUE otherwise.

function.name: gst_value_get_caps
function.description: Gets the contents of @value. The reference count of the returned #GstCaps will not be modified, therefore the caller must take one before getting rid of the @value.
function.return: the contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_get_date
function.description: Gets the contents of @value.
function.return: the contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_get_double_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maxumum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_double_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_fourcc
function.description: Gets the #guint32 fourcc contained in @value.
function.return: the #guint32 fourcc contained in @value.

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_denominator
function.description: Gets the denominator of the fraction specified by @value.
function.return: the denominator of the fraction.

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_numerator
function.description: Gets the numerator of the fraction specified by @value.
function.return: the numerator of the fraction.

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maximum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_fraction_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int64_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maxumum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int64_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int_range_max
function.description: Gets the maximum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the maxumum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_int_range_min
function.description: Gets the minimum of the range specified by @value.
function.return: the minimum of the range

function.name: gst_value_get_mini_object
function.description: Get the contents of a %GST_TYPE_MINI_OBJECT derived #GValue. Does not increase the refcount of the returned object.
function.return: mini object contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_get_structure
function.description: Gets the contents of @value.
function.return: the contents of @value

function.name: gst_value_init_and_copy
function.description: Initialises the target value to be of the same type as source and then copies the contents from source to target.

function.name: gst_value_intersect
function.description: Calculates the intersection of two values. If the values have a non-empty intersection, the value representing the intersection is placed in @dest. If the intersection is non-empty, @dest is not modified.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: a uninitialized #GValue that will hold the calculated intersection value

function.return: TRUE if the intersection is non-empty

function.name: gst_value_is_fixed
function.description: Tests if the given GValue, if available in a GstStructure (or any other container) contains a "fixed" (which means: one value) or an "unfixed" (which means: multiple possible values, such as data lists or data ranges) value.
function.return: true if the value is "fixed".

function.name: gst_value_list_append_value
function.description: Appends @append_value to the GstValueList in @value.

function.name: gst_value_list_concat

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: an uninitialized #GValue to take the result

function.name: gst_value_list_get_size
function.description: Gets the number of values contained in @value.
function.return: the number of values

function.name: gst_value_list_get_value
function.description: Gets the value that is a member of the list contained in @value and has the index @index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: index of value to get from the list

function.return: the value at the given index

function.name: gst_value_list_merge
function.description:
Merges copies of @value1 and @value2. Values that are not of type #GST_TYPE_LIST are treated as if they were lists of length 1.
The result will be put into @dest and will either be a list that will not contain any duplicates, or a non-list type (if @value1 and @value2 were equal).

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: an uninitialized #GValue to take the result

function.name: gst_value_list_prepend_value
function.description: Prepends @prepend_value to the GstValueList in @value.

function.name: gst_value_register
function.description: Registers functions to perform calculations on #GValue items of a given type. Each type can only be added once.

function.name: gst_value_register_intersect_func
function.description:
Registers a function that is called to calculate the intersection of the values having the types @type1 and @type2.
Intersect functions should be registered at startup before any pipelines are started, as gst_value_register_intersect_func() is not thread-safe and cannot be used at the same time as gst_value_intersect() or gst_value_can_intersect().

function.name: gst_value_register_subtract_func
function.description:
Registers @func as a function capable of subtracting the values of @subtrahend_type from values of @minuend_type.
Subtract functions should be registered at startup before any pipelines are started, as gst_value_register_subtract_func() is not thread-safe and cannot be used at the same time as gst_value_subtract().

function.name: gst_value_register_union_func
function.description:
Registers a union function that can create a union between #GValue items of the type @type1 and @type2.
Union functions should be registered at startup before any pipelines are started, as gst_value_register_union_func() is not thread-safe and cannot be used at the same time as gst_value_union() or gst_value_can_union().

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function that implments creating a union between the two types

function.name: gst_value_serialize
function.description:
tries to transform the given @value into a string representation that allows getting back this string later on using gst_value_deserialize().
Free-function: g_free
function.return: the serialization for @value or NULL if none exists

function.name: gst_value_set_caps
function.description: Sets the contents of @value to @caps. A reference to the provided @caps will be taken by the @value.

parameter.name: caps

function.name: gst_value_set_date

function.name: gst_value_set_fraction
function.description: Sets @value to the fraction specified by @numerator over @denominator. The fraction gets reduced to the smallest numerator and denominator, and if necessary the sign is moved to the numerator.

function.name: gst_value_set_fraction_range
function.description: Sets @value to the range specified by @start and @end.

parameter.name: start

parameter.name: end
parameter.parameter_description: the end of the range (a GST_TYPE_FRACTION GValue)

function.name: gst_value_set_fraction_range_full
function.description: Sets @value to the range specified by @numerator_start/@denominator_start and @numerator_end/@denominator_end.

parameter.parameter_description: the numerator start of the range

parameter.name: denominator_start
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator start of the range

parameter.name: numerator_end
parameter.parameter_description: the numerator end of the range

parameter.name: denominator_end
parameter.parameter_description: the denominator end of the range

function.name: gst_value_set_int64_range
function.description: Sets @value to the range specified by @start and @end.

function.name: gst_value_set_int_range
function.description: Sets @value to the range specified by @start and @end.

function.name: gst_value_set_mini_object
gst_value_set_structure
function.description: Sets the contents of @value to @structure. The actual

parameter.name: structure
parameter.parameter_description: the structure to set the value to

function.name: gst_value_subtract
function.description: Subtracts @subtrahend from @minuend and stores the result in @dest. Note that this means subtraction as in sets, not as in mathematics.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: the destination value for the result if the subtraction is not empty

function.return: %TRUE if the subtraction is not empty

function.name: gst_value_take_mini_object
gst_value_union
function.description: Creates a GValue corresponding to the union of @value1 and @value2.
function.return: always returns %TRUE

function.name: gst_version
function.description: Gets the version number of the GStreamer library.

parameter.name: major
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the major version number

parameter.name: minor
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the minor version number

parameter.name: micro
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the micro version number

parameter.name: nano
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a guint to store the nano version number

function.name: gst_version_string
function.description: This function returns a string that is useful for describing this version of GStreamer to the outside world: user agent strings, logging, ...
function.return: a newly allocated string describing this version of GStreamer.

function.name: gst_video_calculate_display_ratio
function.description: Given the Pixel Aspect Ratio and size of an input video frame, and the pixel aspect ratio of the intended display device, calculates the actual display ratio the video will be rendered with.

parameter.name: video_width
parameter.parameter_description: Width of the video frame in pixels

parameter.name: video_height
parameter.parameter_description: Height of the video frame in pixels

parameter.name: video_par_n
parameter.parameter_description: Numerator of the pixel aspect ratio of the input video.

parameter.name: video_par_d
parameter.parameter_description: Denominator of the pixel aspect ratio of the input video.

parameter.name: display_par_n
parameter.parameter_description: Numerator of the pixel aspect ratio of the display device

parameter.name: display_par_d
parameter.parameter_description: Denominator of the pixel aspect ratio of the display device

function.return: A boolean indicating success and a calculated Display Ratio in the dar_n and dar_d parameters. The return value is FALSE in the case of integer overflow or other error.

function.name: gst_video_convert_frame
function.description:
Converts a raw video buffer into the specified output caps.
The output caps can be any raw video formats or any image formats (jpeg, png, ...).
The width, height and pixel-aspect-ratio can also be specified in the output caps.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum amount of time allowed for the processing.

function.return: The converted #GstBuffer, or %NULL if an error happened (in which case @err will point to the #GError).

function.name: gst_video_convert_frame_async

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum amount of time allowed for the processing.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: %GstVideoConvertFrameCallback that will be called after conversion.

parameter.name: destroy_notify
parameter.parameter_description: %GDestroyNotify to be called after @user_data is not needed anymore

function.name: gst_video_event_new_still_frame
function.description:
Creates a new Still Frame event. If @in_still is %TRUE, then the event represents the start of a still frame sequence. If it is %FALSE, then the event ends a still frame sequence.
To parse an event created by gst_video_event_new_still_frame() use gst_video_event_parse_still_frame().

parameter.name: in_still
parameter.parameter_description: boolean value for the still-frame state of the event.

function.return: The new GstEvent

function.name: gst_video_event_parse_still_frame
function.description:
Parse a #GstEvent, identify if it is a Still Frame event, and return the still-frame state from the event if it is. If the event represents the start of a still frame, the in_still variable will be set to TRUE, otherwise FALSE. It is OK to pass NULL for the in_still variable order to just check whether the event is a valid still-frame event.
Create a still frame event using gst_video_event_new_still_frame()

parameter.name: in_still
parameter.parameter_description: A boolean to receive the still-frame status from the event, or NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the event is a valid still-frame event. %FALSE if not

function.name: gst_video_format_convert
function.description: Converts among various #GstFormat types. This function handles GST_FORMAT_BYTES, GST_FORMAT_TIME, and GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT. For raw video, GST_FORMAT_DEFAULT corresponds to video frames. This function can be to handle pad queries of the type GST_QUERY_CONVERT.
function.return: TRUE if the conversion was successful.

function.name: gst_video_format_from_fourcc
function.description: Converts a FOURCC value into the corresponding #GstVideoFormat. If the FOURCC cannot be represented by #GstVideoFormat, #GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_UNKNOWN is returned.

parameter.name: fourcc
parameter.parameter_description: a FOURCC value representing raw YUV video

function.return: the #GstVideoFormat describing the FOURCC value

function.name: gst_video_format_get_component_depth
function.description: Returns the number of bits used to encode an individual pixel of a given component. Typically this is 8, although higher and lower values are possible for some formats.
function.return: depth of component

function.name: gst_video_format_get_component_height
function.return: height of component @component

function.name: gst_video_format_get_component_offset
function.description: Calculates the offset (in bytes) of the first pixel of the component with index @component. For packed formats, this will typically be a small integer (0, 1, 2, 3). For planar formats, this will be a (relatively) large offset to the beginning of the second or third component planes. See @gst_video_format_get_row_stride for a description of the component index.
function.return: offset of component @component

function.name: gst_video_format_get_component_width
function.return: width of component @component

function.name: gst_video_format_get_pixel_stride
function.description: Calculates the pixel stride (number of bytes from one pixel to the pixel to its immediate left) for the video component with an index of @component. See @gst_video_format_get_row_stride for a description of the component index.
function.return: pixel stride of component @component

function.name: gst_video_format_get_row_stride
function.description: Calculates the row stride (number of bytes from one row of pixels to the next) for the video component with an index of @component. For YUV video, Y, U, and V have component indices of 0, 1, and 2, respectively. For RGB video, R, G, and B have component indicies of 0, 1, and 2, respectively. Alpha channels, if present, have a component index of 3. The @width parameter always represents the width of the video, not the component.
function.return: row stride of component @component

function.name: gst_video_format_get_size
function.description: Calculates the total number of bytes in the raw video format. This number should be used when allocating a buffer for raw video.
function.return: size (in bytes) of raw video format

function.name: gst_video_format_has_alpha
function.description: Returns TRUE or FALSE depending on if the video format provides an alpha channel.
function.return: TRUE if @format has an alpha channel

function.name: gst_video_format_is_gray
function.description: Determine whether the video format is a grayscale format.
function.return: TRUE if @format represents grayscale video

function.name: gst_video_format_is_rgb
function.description: Determine whether the video format is an RGB format.
function.return: TRUE if @format represents RGB video

function.name: gst_video_format_is_yuv
function.description: Determine whether the video format is a YUV format.
function.return: TRUE if @format represents YUV video

function.name: gst_video_format_new_caps
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps object based on the parameters provided.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstVideoFormat describing the raw video format

function.return: a new #GstCaps object, or NULL if there was an error

function.name: gst_video_format_new_caps_interlaced
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps object based on the parameters provided.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstVideoFormat describing the raw video format

function.return: a new #GstCaps object, or NULL if there was an error

function.name: gst_video_format_new_template_caps
function.description: Creates a new #GstCaps object based on the parameters provided. Size, frame rate, and pixel aspect ratio are set to the full range.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstVideoFormat describing the raw video format

function.return: a new #GstCaps object, or NULL if there was an error

function.name: gst_video_format_parse_caps
function.description: Determines the #GstVideoFormat of @caps and places it in the location pointed to by @format. Extracts the size of the video and places it in the location pointed to by @width and @height. If @caps does not represent one of the raw video formats listed in #GstVideoFormat, the function will fail and return FALSE.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstVideoFormat of the video represented by @caps (output)

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the video represented by @caps, may be NULL (output)

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the video represented by @caps, may be NULL (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_video_format_parse_caps_interlaced
function.description: Extracts whether the caps represents interlaced content or not and places it in @interlaced.

parameter.name: interlaced
parameter.parameter_description: whether @caps represents interlaced video or not, may be NULL (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_video_format_to_fourcc
function.description: Converts a #GstVideoFormat value into the corresponding FOURCC. Only a few YUV formats have corresponding FOURCC values. If @format has no corresponding FOURCC value, 0 is returned.
function.return: the FOURCC corresponding to @format

function.name: gst_video_frame_rate
function.description:
A convenience function to retrieve a GValue holding the framerate from the caps on a pad.
The pad needs to have negotiated caps containing a framerate property.
function.return: NULL if the pad has no configured caps or the configured caps do not contain a framerate.

function.name: gst_video_get_size
function.description:
Inspect the caps of the provided pad and retrieve the width and height of the video frames it is configured for.
The pad needs to have negotiated caps containing width and height properties.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to integer to hold pixel width of the video frames (output)

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to integer to hold pixel height of the video frames (output)

function.return: TRUE if the width and height could be retrieved.

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_hcenter
function.description: Get the horizontal centering offset from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_hflip
function.description: Get the horizontal flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_vcenter
function.description: Get the vertical centering offset from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_get_vflip
function.description: Get the vertical flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) from the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_hcenter
function.description: Set the horizontal centering offset for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_hflip
function.description: Set the horizontal flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_vcenter
function.description: Set the vertical centering offset for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports centering

function.name: gst_video_orientation_set_vflip
function.description: Set the vertical flipping state (%TRUE for flipped) for the given object.
function.return: %TRUE in case the element supports flipping

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_chroma_site
function.description:
Extracts the chroma site used by the caps. Possible values are "mpeg2" for MPEG-2 style chroma siting (co-sited horizontally, halfway-sited vertically), "jpeg" for JPEG and Theora style chroma siting (halfway-sited both horizontally and vertically). Other chroma site values are possible, but uncommon.
When no chroma site is specified in the caps, it should be assumed to be "mpeg2".
function.return: a chroma site string, or NULL if no chroma site could be determined.

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_color_matrix
function.description: Extracts the color matrix used by the caps. Possible values are "sdtv" for the standard definition color matrix (as specified in Rec. ITU-R BT.470-6) or "hdtv" for the high definition color matrix (as specified in Rec. ITU-R BT.709)
function.return: a color matrix string, or NULL if no color matrix could be determined.

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_framerate
function.description:
Extracts the frame rate from @caps and places the values in the locations pointed to by @fps_n and @fps_d. Returns TRUE if the values could be parsed correctly, FALSE if not.
This function can be used with #GstCaps that have any media type; it is not limited to formats handled by #GstVideoFormat.

parameter.name: fps_n
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to integer to hold numerator of frame rate (output)

parameter.name: fps_d
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to integer to hold denominator of frame rate (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_palette
function.description: Returns the palette data from the caps as a #GstBuffer. For #GST_VIDEO_FORMAT_RGB8_PALETTED this is containing 256 #guint32 values, each containing ARGB colors in native endianness.
function.return: a #GstBuffer containing the palette data. Unref after usage.

function.name: gst_video_parse_caps_pixel_aspect_ratio
function.description:
Extracts the pixel aspect ratio from @caps and places the values in the locations pointed to by @par_n and @par_d. Returns TRUE if the values could be parsed correctly, FALSE if not.
This function can be used with #GstCaps that have any media type; it is not limited to formats handled by #GstVideoFormat.

parameter.name: par_n
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to numerator of pixel aspect ratio (output)

parameter.name: par_d
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to denominator of pixel aspect ratio (output)

function.return: TRUE if @caps was parsed correctly.

function.name: gst_video_sink_center_rect
function.description: Takes @src rectangle and position it at the center of @dst rectangle with or without @scaling. It handles clipping if the @src rectangle is bigger than the @dst one and @scaling is set to FALSE.

parameter.name: result
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a #GstVideoRectangle which will receive the result area

parameter.name: scaling
parameter.parameter_description: a #gboolean indicating if scaling should be applied or not

function.name: gst_vorbis_tag_add
function.description:
Convenience function using gst_tag_from_vorbis_tag(), parsing a vorbis comment string into the right type and adding it to the given taglist @list.
Unknown vorbiscomment tags will be added to the tag list in form of a #GST_TAG_EXTENDED_COMMENT (since 0.10.10 at least).

parameter.name: tag
parameter.parameter_description: a vorbiscomment tag string (key in key=value), must be valid UTF-8

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: a vorbiscomment value string (value in key=value), must be valid UTF-8

function.name: gst_x_overlay_expose
function.description: Tell an overlay that it has been exposed. This will redraw the current frame in the drawable even if the pipeline is PAUSED.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_got_window_handle
function.description:
This will post a "have-xwindow-id" element message on the bus.
This function should only be used by video overlay plugin developers.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.parameter_description: a platform-specific handle referencing the window

function.name: gst_x_overlay_got_xwindow_id
function.description:
This will post a "have-xwindow-id" element message on the bus.
This function should only be used by video overlay plugin developers.
Deprecated: Use gst_x_overlay_got_window_handle() instead.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_handle_events
function.description: Tell an overlay that it should handle events from the window system. These events are forwared upstream as navigation events. In some window system, events are not propagated in the window hierarchy if a client is listening for them. This method allows you to disable events handling completely from the XOverlay.

parameter.name: handle_events
parameter.parameter_description: a #gboolean indicating if events should be handled or not.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_prepare_xwindow_id
function.description:
This will post a "prepare-xwindow-id" element message on the bus to give applications an opportunity to call gst_x_overlay_set_xwindow_id() before a plugin creates its own window.
This function should only be used by video overlay plugin developers.

parameter.name: overlay
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstXOverlay which does not yet have an XWindow.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_set_render_rectangle
function.description:
Configure a subregion as a video target within the window set by gst_x_overlay_set_window_handle(). If this is not used or not supported the video will fill the area of the window set as the overlay to 100%. By specifying the rectangle, the video can be overlayed to a specific region of that window only. After setting the new rectangle one should call gst_x_overlay_expose() to force a redraw. To unset the region pass -1 for the @width and @height parameters.
This method is needed for non fullscreen video overlay in UI toolkits that do not support subwindows.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal offset of the render area inside the window

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical offset of the render area inside the window

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the render area inside the window

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the render area inside the window

function.return: %FALSE if not supported by the sink.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_set_window_handle
function.description: This will call the video overlay's set_window_handle method. You should use this method to tell to a XOverlay to display video output to a specific XWindow. Passing 0 as the xwindow_id will tell the overlay to stop using that window and create an internal one.

parameter.name: overlay
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstXOverlay to set the XWindow on.

function.name: gst_x_overlay_set_xwindow_id
function.description:
This will call the video overlay's set_xwindow_id method. You should use this method to tell to a XOverlay to display video output to a specific XWindow. Passing 0 as the xwindow_id will tell the overlay to stop using that window and create an internal one.
Deprecated: Use gst_x_overlay_set_window_handle() instead.

parameter.name: overlay
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstXOverlay to set the XWindow on.

function.name: gst_xml_get_element
function.description: This function is used to get a pointer to the GstElement corresponding to name in the pipeline description. You would use this if you have to do anything to the element after loading.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.parameter_description: The GstXML to get the element from

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of element to retrieve

function.return: a pointer to a new GstElement, caller owns returned reference.

function.name: gst_xml_get_topelements
function.description: Retrieve a list of toplevel elements.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.parameter_description: The GstXML to get the elements from

function.return: a GList of top-level elements. The caller does not own a copy of the list and must not free or modify the list. The caller also does not own a reference to any of the elements in the list and should obtain its own reference using gst_object_ref() if necessary.

function.name: gst_xml_make_element
function.description: Load the element from the XML description

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the parent of this object when it's loaded

function.return: the new element

function.name: gst_xml_new
function.description: Create a new GstXML parser object.
function.return: a pointer to a new GstXML object.

function.name: gst_xml_parse_doc
function.description: Fills the GstXML object with the elements from the xmlDocPtr.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a GstXML object

parameter.name: doc
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an xml document to parse

parameter.name: root
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the root object to build

function.return: TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_xml_parse_file
function.description:
Fills the GstXML object with the corresponding elements from the XML file fname. Optionally it will only build the element from the element node root (if it is not NULL). This feature is useful if you only want to build a specific element from an XML file but not the pipeline it is embedded in.
Pass "-" as fname to read from stdin. You can also pass a URI of any format that libxml supports, including http.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a GstXML object

parameter.name: fname
parameter.parameter_description: The filename with the xml description

parameter.name: root
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the root object to build

function.return: TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise

function.name: gst_xml_parse_memory
function.description: Fills the GstXML object with the corresponding elements from an in memory XML buffer.

parameter.name: xml
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to a GstXML object

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the in memory XML buffer

parameter.name: root
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the root objects to build

function.return: TRUE on success

function.name: gst_xml_write
function.description: Converts the given element into an XML presentation.
function.return: a pointer to an XML document

function.name: gst_xml_write_file
function.description: Converts the given element into XML and writes the formatted XML to an open file.
function.return: number of bytes written on success, -1 otherwise.

parameter.name: parentprofilename
parameter.parameter_description: the parent profile name (including 'profile-' or 'streamprofile-' header)

parameter.name: profilename
parameter.parameter_description: the profile name group to parse

function.name: read_packet_header
function.description: Read the packet headers for the packet pointed to by @packet.
function.return: TRUE if @packet pointed to a valid header.

function.name: str_case_equal
function.description: Compares @v1 and @v2 in a case-insensitive manner
function.return: %TRUE if they are equal (modulo case)

function.name: str_case_hash
function.description: Hashes @key in a case-insensitive manner.
function.return: the hash code.

function.name: validate_data
function.description: Checks if @data is a valid RTP packet.

parameter.name: payload
parameter.parameter_description: the payload if @data represents the header only

function.return: TRUE if @data is a valid RTP packet
